translated: Alternatively, the “place” is the support of the qualities such as the ten powers.

original: rtag tu zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba ma stongs kyi bar du 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: rtag tu zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba ma stongs kyi bar du 'jug pa ste /
translated: The phrase “always” indicates that it is active as long as saṃsāra is not emptied.

original: khyad par gnyis po de ni ltag 'og gzhan du yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: khyad par gnyis po de ni ltag 'og gzhan du yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: These two distinctions should be applied in reverse order.

original: kunda zla 'dra zhes bya ba ni 'khor lo de yang dkar po'i mdog tu ston pa'o //
analyzed: kunda zla 'dra zhes bya ba ni 'khor lo de yang dkar po'i mdog tu ston pa'o //
translated: The phrase “like a jasmine flower” indicates that the wheel is white in color.

original: rnam shes ye shes bdud rtsi ni //
analyzed: rnam shes ye shes bdud rtsi ni //
translated: The nectar of consciousness and intuition

original: lha mo chen mo 'bar ba'i mchog / ces bya ba la /
analyzed: lha mo chen mo 'bar ba'i mchog / ces bya ba la /
translated: is the great goddess, the supreme blazing.

original: rnam shes ni bdud rtsi dang sbyar bas ye shes ni 'bab pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: rnam shes ni bdud rtsi dang sbyar bas ye shes ni 'bab pa dang sbyar ro //
translated: Since consciousness is associated with nectar, intuition is associated with the descent.

original: de la ye shes 'bab pa ni 'khor lo de dag goms pa las thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de la ye shes 'bab pa ni 'khor lo de dag goms pa las thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes 'jug pa'o //
translated: The descent of pristine consciousness is the entry of the pristine consciousness of omniscience from the practice of those cakras.

original: ji lta bu zhig ce na /🔽rnam shes @133a * //
analyzed: ji lta bu zhig ce na / rnam shes @133a * //
translated: What is it like?🔽Consciousness is nectar.

original: bdud rtsi ste zhes bya ba la rnam shes ni sems so //
analyzed: bdud rtsi ste zhes bya ba la rnam shes ni sems so //
translated: Consciousness is the mind.

original: de nyid ni 'chi ba med pa'i bdud rtsi'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni 'chi ba med pa'i bdud rtsi'o //
translated: That itself is the nectar of immortality.

original: yang na rnam shes bdud rtsi ni bag yod pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams ye shes kyis 'cho zhing 'chi bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: yang na rnam shes bdud rtsi ni bag yod pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams ye shes kyis 'cho zhing 'chi bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Alternatively, the nectar of consciousness is the yogis who are heedful, who are nourished by pristine consciousness, and who do not die.

original: de yang gsungs pa /🔽bag yod mi 'chi'i gnas yin te //
analyzed: de yang gsungs pa / bag yod mi 'chi'i gnas yin te //
translated: That is also stated:🔽Heedfulness is the state of not dying;

original: bag med 'chi ba'i gnas yin pas //
analyzed: bag med 'chi ba'i gnas yin pas //
translated: heedlessness is the state of death.

original: bag yod pas ni 'chi mi 'gyur //
analyzed: bag yod pas ni 'chi mi 'gyur //
translated: Through heedfulness, one does not die;

original: bag med pa ni rtag tu 'chi //
analyzed: bag med pa ni rtag tu 'chi //
translated: through heedlessness, one always dies.

original: zhes so // sbrul pa'i 'khor lo gsungs pa /🔽rten du gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes so // sbrul pa'i 'khor lo gsungs pa / rten du gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The emanation cakra is stated:🔽The support is the navel.

original: rten du gyur pa zhes bya ba na lte bar brten pa'i padma ste 'dis skye ba 'dzin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten du gyur pa zhes bya ba na lte bar brten pa'i padma ste 'dis skye ba 'dzin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The support is the lotus at the navel, because it supports the taking of birth.

original: zla ba'i 'od kyis rnam par brgyan //
analyzed: zla ba'i 'od kyis rnam par brgyan //
translated: Adorned with the light of the moon.

original: zhes bya ba ni chos kyi 'khor lo'i lte bar gnas pa h'um gi thig le'i 'od zer gyis de'i steng du brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni chos kyi 'khor lo'i lte bar gnas pa h'um gi thig le'i 'od zer gyis de'i steng du brgyan pa'o //
translated: This is the light of the bindu of the syllable hum located in the center of the wheel of Dharma, which adorns it above.

original: de ni cha dad cha yi gzugs //
analyzed: de ni cha dad cha yi gzugs //
translated: It is the part and the form of the part.

original: zhes bya ba la cha ni 'tsho ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la cha ni 'tsho ba'o //
translated: The part is life.

original: cha'i gzugs ni bgrang ba'i rang bzhin te dbugs kyi grangs bgrang bar gnas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: cha'i gzugs ni bgrang ba'i rang bzhin te dbugs kyi grangs bgrang bar gnas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The form of the part is the nature of counting, meaning the counting of the number of breaths.🔽The abode of the aggregate.

original: gong bu gnas pa zhes bya ba la gong bu ni sems can gyi tshogs bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: gong bu gnas pa zhes bya ba la gong bu ni sems can gyi tshogs bsdu ba'o //
translated: The aggregate is the collection of sentient beings.

original: gnas pa ni des nye bar gnas pa ste /
analyzed: gnas pa ni des nye bar gnas pa ste /
translated: The abode is the one who abides by that.

original: 'dis sprul pa'i skus 'gro ba'i don gyi tshegs kyis nye bar gnas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dis sprul pa'i skus 'gro ba'i don gyi tshegs kyis nye bar gnas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that the emanation body abides by the effort of benefiting migrating beings.

original: 'khor lo gnyis pa de dag kyang mchog tu dga' ba dang kun du dga' ba'i rang bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo gnyis pa de dag kyang mchog tu dga' ba dang kun du dga' ba'i rang bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: Those two wheels should be understood to have the nature of supreme joy and universal joy.

original: de dag gis ni gtum mo'i rnal 'byor gyis gong du 'pho ba bsgom pa'i phyir lus sbyang ba bstan to //
analyzed: de dag gis ni gtum mo'i rnal 'byor gyis gong du 'pho ba bsgom pa'i phyir lus sbyang ba bstan to //
translated: By these, the training of the body is taught for the sake of cultivating the transference upward by means of the yoga of fierce woman.

original: da ni sbyang ba gzhan gnyis pa sgo sbyang ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni sbyang ba gzhan gnyis pa sgo sbyang ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the second other training, the training of the doors,

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “Then, etc. ”

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni lus sbyangs kyi 'og tu'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni lus sbyangs kyi 'og tu'o //
translated: “ Then ” means after the training of the body.

original: gnas kyi mtha' ni dag par bya //
analyzed: gnas kyi mtha' ni dag par bya //
translated: “ The end of the place should be purified. ”

original: zhes bya ba la gnas ni lus te bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi snod yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la gnas ni lus te bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi snod yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The place is the body, because it is the vessel of pleasure and pain.

original: mtha' ni nang ste nang gi sgo rnams so //
analyzed: mtha' ni nang ste nang gi sgo rnams so //
translated: The end is the inside, the inner doors.

original: kyi zhes bya ba ni 'brel ba'i don gyi drug pa yin no //
analyzed: kyi zhes bya ba ni 'brel ba'i don gyi drug pa yin no //
translated: “ By ” has the sense of connection, the sixth case.

original: gzhan du na ni zhes bya ba ni sbyang ba gnyis ma gtogs par te /
analyzed: gzhan du na ni zhes bya ba ni sbyang ba gnyis ma gtogs par te /
translated: “ Otherwise ” means except for the two trainings.

original: sbyang ba gnyis dang bral na gong du 'pho ba'i 'bras bur mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sbyang ba gnyis dang bral na gong du 'pho ba'i 'bras bur mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that without the two trainings, there is no result of transference upward.

original: sbyang ba gnyis pa de gsungs pa dgang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sbyang ba gnyis pa de gsungs pa dgang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: He teaches the two trainings, beginning with “inflation. ”

original: dgang ba yis ni lus bkang na //
analyzed: dgang ba yis ni lus bkang na //
translated: By filling, the body is filled.

original: zhes bya ba ni dbugs nad du brngubs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dbugs nad du brngubs te /
translated: Having inhaled the wind,

original: mgrin pa nas lte ba'i mthar thug pa'i ji srid nus kyi bar du drangs la gang gi tshe ma nus na rim @133b gyis dal bus phyir gtang bar bya'o //
analyzed: mgrin pa nas lte ba'i mthar thug pa'i ji srid nus kyi bar du drangs la gang gi tshe ma nus na rim @133b gyis dal bus phyir gtang bar bya'o //
translated: one should draw it up from the throat to the navel as long as one is able. When one is no longer able, one should slowly exhale.

original: de yang rdo rje skyil krung bcings la /
analyzed: de yang rdo rje skyil krung bcings la /
translated: Moreover, having bound the vajra posture,

original: thong ka dkyil 'khor ltar yangs par byas nas mig sna'i rtse mor phab ste bltas la rlung drangs pas lto thams cad dang / mgrin pa'i bar du gang bar bya ba 'di ni dgang ba'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: thong ka dkyil 'khor ltar yangs par byas nas mig sna'i rtse mor phab ste bltas la rlung drangs pas lto thams cad dang / mgrin pa'i bar du gang bar bya ba 'di ni dgang ba'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: having made the chest cavity spacious like the sky, having lowered the eyes to the tip of the nose, having drawn up the wind, one should fill the whole belly and up to the throat. This is the definition of filling.

original: des cir 'gyur zhe na dug dang rims kyi tsha ba 'phrog / ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: des cir 'gyur zhe na dug dang rims kyi tsha ba 'phrog / ces bya ba ste /
translated: What is the result of that? It removes poison and the heat of fever.

original: dgang ba'i mtshan nyid grub pa 'dis dug la sogs pa'i nyes pa 'joms pa ste 'phral gyi phan yon no //
analyzed: dgang ba'i mtshan nyid grub pa 'dis dug la sogs pa'i nyes pa 'joms pa ste 'phral gyi phan yon no //
translated: By accomplishing this definition of filling, one conquers faults such as poison. This is the immediate benefit.

original: gnyis pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: gnyis pa gsungs pa /
translated: The second is stated:

original: bum pa can gyi sgo bcings na //
analyzed: bum pa can gyi sgo bcings na //
translated: Having closed the door of the vase

original: zhes bya ba snga ma ltar rlung nang du drangs te bum pa mi g-yo ba ltar dbang po'i sgo thams cad bkag nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba snga ma ltar rlung nang du drangs te bum pa mi g-yo ba ltar dbang po'i sgo thams cad bkag nas /
translated: As before, having drawn in the wind, one should hold it as if it were an unmoving vase, having closed all the doors of the senses.

original: ji srid nus kyi bar du lus kyi nang du rlung bsdams pa 'di ni bum pa can gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: ji srid nus kyi bar du lus kyi nang du rlung bsdams pa 'di ni bum pa can gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: This is the definition of the vase-holding, which is the wind held within the body for as long as one can.

original: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the result of that?

original: sgo'i bu ga dag par 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sgo'i bu ga dag par 'gyur // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The doors are purified.

original: pug thams cad kyi gnod pa dang bral bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: pug thams cad kyi gnod pa dang bral bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: All the pores are freed from harm.

original: gsum pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: gsum pa gsungs pa /
translated: The third is stated:

original: 'thor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'thor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Scattering, etc.

original: 'thor ba ni sna sgo'i dbugs kyi phyi rol sor bcu gnyis kyi bar du rim gyis spro ba'o //
analyzed: 'thor ba ni sna sgo'i dbugs kyi phyi rol sor bcu gnyis kyi bar du rim gyis spro ba'o //
translated: Scattering is the gradual emission of the breath through the nostrils up to twelve inches.

original: sna tshogs rdul du zhes bya ba ni de lta bur gyur pas dngos po sna tshogs pa rnams de'i rang bzhin du byas nas /
analyzed: sna tshogs rdul du zhes bya ba ni de lta bur gyur pas dngos po sna tshogs pa rnams de'i rang bzhin du byas nas /
translated: The various things are made into dust by that, having made the various things into its nature.

original: rlung zad par phyir spro bar bya zhing yun ring du gtang bar bya'o //
analyzed: rlung zad par phyir spro bar bya zhing yun ring du gtang bar bya'o //
translated: The wind should be emitted outside until it is exhausted, and it should be held for a long time.

original: 'di ni 'thor ba'i mtshan nyid de 'thor ba'i mtshan nyid 'dis sgo brgyad po rim gyis 'gag cing steng gi sgo nas bde blag tu 'pho bar 'gyur bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'thor ba'i mtshan nyid de 'thor ba'i mtshan nyid 'dis sgo brgyad po rim gyis 'gag cing steng gi sgo nas bde blag tu 'pho bar 'gyur bar shes par bya'o //
translated: This is the characteristic of scattering. It should be understood that by this characteristic of scattering, the eight doors gradually close and one easily transfers through the upper door.

original: bzhi pa gsungs pa rab tu zhi bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la legs par phyir spros pa'i 'og tu spro bar yang mi bya la bsdu bar yang mi bya bar mig sna'i rtse mo nyid du gtad de /
analyzed: bzhi pa gsungs pa rab tu zhi bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la legs par phyir spros pa'i 'og tu spro bar yang mi bya la bsdu bar yang mi bya bar mig sna'i rtse mo nyid du gtad de /
translated: The fourth is stated in “very peaceful,” and so on. After the excellent expansion, one should neither expand nor gather but focus on the tip of the nose and

original: sgo thams cad bkag nas gnas pa 'di ni rab tu zhi ba'i mtshan nyid de zhi bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rab tu zhi ba des rlung de dbang du 'dus shing rlung bde bar gyur ba ste /
analyzed: sgo thams cad bkag nas gnas pa 'di ni rab tu zhi ba'i mtshan nyid de zhi bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rab tu zhi ba des rlung de dbang du 'dus shing rlung bde bar gyur ba ste /
translated: remain with all doors blocked. This is the characteristic of very peaceful. “ One becomes peaceful” means that by that peacefulness, the vāyu is brought under control and the vāyu becomes comfortable.

original: de'i tshe sgo gang nas 'dod pa de nas 'pho ba'i 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe sgo gang nas 'dod pa de nas 'pho ba'i 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, one will obtain the result of transference through whichever door one wishes.

original: da ni sngar bshad pa ltar nang sbyangs nas /
analyzed: da ni sngar bshad pa ltar nang sbyangs nas /
translated: Now, after training internally as explained previously,

original: phyi rol gzhan sbyang bar bya ste /
analyzed: phyi rol gzhan sbyang bar bya ste /
translated: one should train externally.

original: rnam par shes pa dbrog pa'i cho ga dang / gzhan du 'gro ba bshad par bya ba'i phyir rnam shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dbrog pa'i cho ga dang / gzhan du 'gro ba bshad par bya ba'i phyir rnam shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to explain the ritual for the removal of consciousness and the going to another place, he says consciousness, etc.

original: cho ga zhes bya ba ni de dag gi bya ba'i man ngag go //
analyzed: cho ga zhes bya ba ni de dag gi bya ba'i man ngag go //
translated: Ritual means the esoteric instructions for their performance.

original: phyi rol zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phyi rol zhes bya ba ni /
translated: External means

original: mkhas pa yis ni sbyang bar bya //🔽zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //
analyzed: mkhas pa yis ni sbyang bar bya // zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //
translated: the wise should purify.

original: @134a * // gnas gnyis dag tu bsam bya ba //
analyzed: @134a * // gnas gnyis dag tu bsam bya ba //
translated: The two places should be imagined.

original: zhes bya ba la gnas gnyis ni rten gnas gnyis te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la gnas gnyis ni rten gnas gnyis te /
translated: The two places are the two locations of the support.

original: lte ba dang snying ga'i gnas su'o //
analyzed: lte ba dang snying ga'i gnas su'o //
translated: They are the navel and the heart.

original: bsam pa ni sems pa ste /
analyzed: bsam pa ni sems pa ste /
translated: Imagining is thinking.

original: lus su sems pa dang sems su sems pa'o //
analyzed: lus su sems pa dang sems su sems pa'o //
translated: It is thinking of the body and thinking of the mind.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How?

original: rlung gi dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rlung gi dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The wind mandala, etc.

original: lte ba nas sor bzhi bor ba'i 'og tu rlung gi dkyil 'khor bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: lte ba nas sor bzhi bor ba'i 'og tu rlung gi dkyil 'khor bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Four fingerbreadths below the navel, the wind mandala should be imagined.

original: de'i steng du ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: de'i steng du ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: What should be done on top of that?

original: rlung gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rlung gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The wind, etc.

original: dbus su zhes bya ba'i sgra ni steng du zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dbus su zhes bya ba'i sgra ni steng du zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word “middle” means “above.”

original: me zhes bya ba ni me'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: me zhes bya ba ni me'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: “Fire” means the fire maṇḍala.

original: yang dang yang du zhes bya ba ni shin tu yang ngo //
analyzed: yang dang yang du zhes bya ba ni shin tu yang ngo //
translated: “Again and again” means “very much.”

original: dbye bar bya zhes bya ba ni rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi me sbar ba'o //
analyzed: dbye bar bya zhes bya ba ni rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi me sbar ba'o //
translated: “One should divide” means one should ignite the fire of the wind maṇḍala.

original: a'a li zhes bya ba la sogs pa la a'a li'i sa bon ni aam ngo //
analyzed: a'a li zhes bya ba la sogs pa la a'a li'i sa bon ni aam ngo //
translated: With regard to “the āli seed,” the āli seed is aṃ.

original: k'a li'i sa bon ni h'um ngo //
analyzed: k'a li'i sa bon ni h'um ngo //
translated: The kāli seed is hūṃ.

original: der ni zhes bya ba ni lte ba dang snying ga'i padma dag tu'o //
analyzed: der ni zhes bya ba ni lte ba dang snying ga'i padma dag tu'o //
translated: “There” means in the navel and heart lotuses.

original: sbyar bar bya zhes bya ba ni lte ba dang snying ga'i padmar aam dang h'um gi sa bon bkod pa de bsam par bya zhes bya ba snga ma dang sbyar te /
analyzed: sbyar bar bya zhes bya ba ni lte ba dang snying ga'i padmar aam dang h'um gi sa bon bkod pa de bsam par bya zhes bya ba snga ma dang sbyar te /
translated: “One should unite” means one should imagine the seed syllables aṃ and hūṃ placed in the navel and heart lotuses, respectively.

original: lus su bsam pa dang sems su bsam pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lus su bsam pa dang sems su bsam pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is connected with the previous line, which means “one should imagine the body and one should imagine the mind.”

original: rnal 'byor pa yis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rnal 'byor pa ni rnam pa de lta bus sems rtse gcig pa'i sgrub pa po'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa yis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rnal 'byor pa ni rnam pa de lta bus sems rtse gcig pa'i sgrub pa po'o //
translated: The yogī, and so on. The yogī is the practitioner who has one-pointed concentration in that way.

original: khyad par ni sa bon gyi khyad par gyis so //
analyzed: khyad par ni sa bon gyi khyad par gyis so //
translated: The difference is due to the difference in the seed.

original: 'byung dang 'jug pas bzlas par bya //
analyzed: 'byung dang 'jug pas bzlas par bya //
translated: One should repeat the arising and entering.

original: zhes bya ba la 'byung ba ni phyi rol 'phro ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la 'byung ba ni phyi rol 'phro ba'o //
translated: Arising is the going out to the external.

original: 'jug pa ni nang du sdud pa ste de gnyis bzla ba'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa ni nang du sdud pa ste de gnyis bzla ba'o //
translated: Entering is the gathering in to the internal. One should repeat those two.

original: des ci ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: des ci ltar bya zhe na /
translated: What is done by that?

original: 'byung ba ye shes sa bon ni //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'byung ba ye shes sa bon ni // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The seed of intuition is the arising.

original: ye shes sa bon ni snying ga'i padma'i yi ge h'um ste /🔽de 'byung bas na bsnun ngang ldan par bsam zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: ye shes sa bon ni snying ga'i padma'i yi ge h'um ste / de 'byung bas na bsnun ngang ldan par bsam zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: The seed of intuition is the letter hum in the heart lotus.🔽Since that arises, one should imagine the striking with the nature of the wind and fire that are endowed with the blazing light of the seed of fierce fire.

original: de yang gtum mo'i sa bon 'od zer 'bar ba dang ldan pa rlung dang mes sbar ba'i rang bzhin gyis h'um dang bcas pa'i snying ga'i padma la bsnun pas gyen du kha bzlog par yang dang yang du bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang gtum mo'i sa bon 'od zer 'bar ba dang ldan pa rlung dang mes sbar ba'i rang bzhin gyis h'um dang bcas pa'i snying ga'i padma la bsnun pas gyen du kha bzlog par yang dang yang du bsam par bya'o //
translated: Since one strikes the lotus of the heart with the hum, one should imagine the reversal of the direction upward again and again.

original: yang ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: What else should one do?

original: 'jug pa snying gi rnam shes la //
analyzed: 'jug pa snying gi rnam shes la //
translated: The entering is the consciousness of the heart.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa de ltar 'byung bas bsnun nas snying ga'i rnam par shes pa'i sa bon h'um de 'byung ba nyid kyis mgrin pa dang mgo'i gnas kyi bar du 'dren cing 'phul bar bsams la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa de ltar 'byung bas bsnun nas snying ga'i rnam par shes pa'i sa bon h'um de 'byung ba nyid kyis mgrin pa dang mgo'i gnas kyi bar du 'dren cing 'phul bar bsams la /
translated: Having thus struck, one should imagine that the seed syllable of consciousness at the heart, hūṃ, is drawn up and pushed by the wind as far as the throat and head.

original: slar yang 'jug pas kha thur du bzlog ste snying g'a bar du 'ong bar bsam mo //
analyzed: slar yang 'jug pas kha thur du bzlog ste snying g'a bar du 'ong bar bsam mo //
translated: Again, by the wind one should imagine that it is reversed and comes to the heart.

original: me tog lta bur bsnun zhes bya ba ni ka shi ka'i me tog rlung gis bskyod pa ltar snying ga'i padma de @134b rlung gis yang dang yang du kha gyen du bstan pa dang / thur du bzlog par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: me tog lta bur bsnun zhes bya ba ni ka shi ka'i me tog rlung gis bskyod pa ltar snying ga'i padma de @134b rlung gis yang dang yang du kha gyen du bstan pa dang / thur du bzlog par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The striking like a flower means that the lotus of the heart is repeatedly opened upward and reversed by the wind, like a kashī flower shaken by the wind.

original: de ltar bzlas pa goms pa'i rnal 'byor pas rang gi rnam par shes pa'i phyi rol du bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar bzlas pa goms pa'i rnal 'byor pas rang gi rnam par shes pa'i phyi rol du bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the external activity of one’s consciousness through the yoga of familiarizing with the repetition,

original: rnal 'byor pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares the yoga, etc.

original: 'byung bzlas te zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba dang 'jug pa'i bzlas pa ste bar gyi tshig mi mngon pa yin no //
analyzed: 'byung bzlas te zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba dang 'jug pa'i bzlas pa ste bar gyi tshig mi mngon pa yin no //
translated: The repetition of the elements is the repetition of the elements and the entry, and the middle word is elided.

original: bdag nyid ces bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid ces bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The self is consciousness.

original: phyi rol du bya ba ni phyir dbyung ba'o //
analyzed: phyi rol du bya ba ni phyir dbyung ba'o //
translated: The external is the externalization.

original: gang gis she na /
analyzed: gang gis she na /
translated: By what?

original: 'byung dang 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid kyis //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'byung dang 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid kyis // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: By the characteristic of the elements and the entry,

original: 'jug pa dang ldan pa'i 'byung bas bzlas pas so //
analyzed: 'jug pa dang ldan pa'i 'byung bas bzlas pas so //
translated: by the repetition of the elements and the entry.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How?

original: de kho na nyid mnyam par 'jug / ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: de kho na nyid mnyam par 'jug / ces bya ba ste /
translated: By the entry into the equality of reality,

original: rnal 'byor pas mnyam pa nyid du bsgoms pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas mnyam pa nyid du bsgoms pa'o //
translated: by the yogi's meditation on equality.

original: ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: ci zhig ce na /
translated: What?

original: de kho na nyid de rnam par shes pa dang rlung gi de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: de kho na nyid de rnam par shes pa dang rlung gi de kho na nyid do //
translated: The reality, which is the reality of consciousness and wind.

original: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa'i de kho na nyid rang bzhin gyi 'od gsal ba ltar rlung yang de dang dbyer med par 'od gsal bar bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa'i de kho na nyid rang bzhin gyi 'od gsal ba ltar rlung yang de dang dbyer med par 'od gsal bar bsgom pa'o //
translated: Thus, just as the reality of consciousness is naturally luminous, the wind is also meditated as luminous, inseparable from that.

original: yang na 'jug pa dang 'byung ba dang mnyam pa ste gcig tu bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang na 'jug pa dang 'byung ba dang mnyam pa ste gcig tu bya ba'o //
translated: Or else, it is the same, i.e., one, in the sense of being engaged, emerging, and equal.

original: ci lan gcig tsam goms pas sam zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: ci lan gcig tsam goms pas sam zhe na ma yin te /
translated: Is it by merely once cultivating? No, it is not.

original: mnyam gzhag dngos po bsgoms na'o //
analyzed: mnyam gzhag dngos po bsgoms na'o //
translated: It is when one has cultivated the entity of equipoise.

original: 'di ltar dngos po ni bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po ni bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the entity is what is to be cultivated.

original: mnyam gzhag ni yang dang yang du goms pas 'grub par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mnyam gzhag ni yang dang yang du goms pas 'grub par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The equipoise is accomplished by repeatedly cultivating it.

original: the tshom med pa ni yid gnyis spangs pa ste /
analyzed: the tshom med pa ni yid gnyis spangs pa ste /
translated: Without doubt means having abandoned doubt.🔽And that is to be believed by such statements as:

original: de yang / nor bu sngags dang sman rnams kyi //
analyzed: de yang / nor bu sngags dang sman rnams kyi //
translated: The power of jewels, mantras, and medicines

original: mthu ni bsam gyis mi khyab ste //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pas yid ches par bya'o //
analyzed: mthu ni bsam gyis mi khyab ste // zhes bya ba la sogs pas yid ches par bya'o //
translated: is inconceivable.

original: da ni rnam par shes pa dbrog pa dang nang gi las kyi sbyor ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni rnam par shes pa dbrog pa dang nang gi las kyi sbyor ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the yoga of the inner activity of taking consciousness,

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “Then, etc.”

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni gong du 'pho ba'i sbyor ba las sbyar ba dang bzlas pa la sogs pa de ltar byas kyi 'og tu'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni gong du 'pho ba'i sbyor ba las sbyar ba dang bzlas pa la sogs pa de ltar byas kyi 'og tu'o //
translated: Then means after the yoga of transference has been performed, i.e., after the recitation, etc.

original: phyi rol du ni zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi ste rnam par shes pa dbrog go zhes bya ba lhag ma yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol du ni zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi ste rnam par shes pa dbrog go zhes bya ba lhag ma yin no //
translated: The etc. is the rest of the verse.

original: ni zhes bya ba ni bshad par bya zhes bya ba snga ma dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba ni bshad par bya zhes bya ba snga ma dang sbyar ro //
translated: The etc. is connected with the previous should be explained.

original: lus sgrub pa po yis rnam par sprul //
analyzed: lus sgrub pa po yis rnam par sprul //
translated: The creator of the body is the practitioner.

original: zhes bya ba ni pha rol gyi rnam par shes pa dbrog pa'i phyir sgrub pa pos dang por snga ma ltar rang gi lus rnam par sprul zhing bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni pha rol gyi rnam par shes pa dbrog pa'i phyir sgrub pa pos dang por snga ma ltar rang gi lus rnam par sprul zhing bsgom pa'o //
translated: The emanation is the first meditation by the practitioner on his own body in the manner described above, in order to take away the consciousness of the other.

original: dbrog pa de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: dbrog pa de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: He explains just that taking away:🔽The path of the sun is the right nostril.

original: nyi ma'i lam nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la nyi ma'i lam ni sna sgo g-yas pa'o //🔽de @135a * //
analyzed: nyi ma'i lam nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la nyi ma'i lam ni sna sgo g-yas pa'o // de @135a * //
translated: The path of the moon is the left nostril.

original: zhes bya ba ni thabs kyi cha ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni thabs kyi cha ste /
translated: That is the part of the method.

original: k'a li'i sa bon no //
analyzed: k'a li'i sa bon no //
translated: The seed of kāli is the letter e.

original: phyung ba ni gdon pa'o //🔽ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: phyung ba ni gdon pa'o // ji lta zhe na /
translated: The extraction is the taking out.

original: lha mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa la lha mo ni shes rab kyi cha ste /
analyzed: lha mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa la lha mo ni shes rab kyi cha ste /
translated: How? He says the goddess, etc. The goddess is the part of wisdom.

original: a'a li'i sa bon no //
analyzed: a'a li'i sa bon no //
translated: The seed of āli is the letter va.

original: cha shas ni zla tshes dang thig le ste /
analyzed: cha shas ni zla tshes dang thig le ste /
translated: The part is the crescent moon and the drop.

original: des brgyan ba'i a'a li dang k'a li'i sa bon sngar bshad pa ste lhan cig gdon pa'o //
analyzed: des brgyan ba'i a'a li dang k'a li'i sa bon sngar bshad pa ste lhan cig gdon pa'o //
translated: The seed syllables of Alikali, which are adorned with that, are the previously explained ones, which are to be uttered together.

original: bsgrub bya'i snying gar zhugs nas ni //
analyzed: bsgrub bya'i snying gar zhugs nas ni //
translated: Having entered into the heart of the victim,

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: means

original: de yi rnam shes dbrog par bya //
analyzed: de yi rnam shes dbrog par bya //
translated: one should take away his consciousness.

original: zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: This is to be connected with the above.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How?

original: bzung nas su zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bzung nas su zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Having seized him,

original: da dang lha mos bzung nas su //
analyzed: da dang lha mos bzung nas su //
translated: means having seized him with the mantra and the goddess,🔽one should cause him to enter into the body maṇḍala.

original: lus kyi dkyil 'khor du ni gzhug / ces bya ba ni rang gi lus la bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: lus kyi dkyil 'khor du ni gzhug / ces bya ba ni rang gi lus la bsdu ba'o //
translated: This is the gathering into one’s own body.

original: de nas ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: de nas ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: What should one do then?

original: 'og gi 'khor lor sbyar bar bya //🔽zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'og gi 'khor lor sbyar bar bya // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: One should apply him to the lower wheel.

original: lte ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'og ni me'i dkyil 'khor la gdud bar bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lte ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'og ni me'i dkyil 'khor la gdud bar bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The lower of the navel maṇḍala is the fire maṇḍala, to which one should apply him. This is the meaning.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,🔽the wind and fire are blazing.

original: rlung dang me yis 'bar ba dag / ces bya ba gsungs so //🔽de dag gis ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: rlung dang me yis 'bar ba dag / ces bya ba gsungs so //🔽de dag gis ni 'di skad du /
translated: This is what they say.

original: sprul pa'i 'khor lor gnas pa'i gtum mo'i sa bon gyi thig le las 'phros pa'i 'od zer dang snying ga'i sa bon gyi 'od gcig tu gyur nas zhes rab dang thabs kyi sa bon 'bar ba'i gzugs su rang gi sna sgo g-yas pa nas phyung ste /
analyzed: sprul pa'i 'khor lor gnas pa'i gtum mo'i sa bon gyi thig le las 'phros pa'i 'od zer dang snying ga'i sa bon gyi 'od gcig tu gyur nas zhes rab dang thabs kyi sa bon 'bar ba'i gzugs su rang gi sna sgo g-yas pa nas phyung ste /
translated: The seed of wisdom and method in the form of a blazing fire emerges from one’s right nostril and

original: bsgrub bya'i sna sgo g-yon par zhugs nas /
analyzed: bsgrub bya'i sna sgo g-yon par zhugs nas /
translated: enters the left nostril of the victim.

original: snying gar bstan pa'i rnam par shes pa rin po che 'bar ba'i rnam pa lta bu la khyab ste /
analyzed: snying gar bstan pa'i rnam par shes pa rin po che 'bar ba'i rnam pa lta bu la khyab ste /
translated: It spreads into the consciousness that is visualized at the heart in the form of a blazing jewel.

original: drangs nas de'i sna sgo g-yas nas byung nas rang gi sna sgo g-yon par zhugs te /
analyzed: drangs nas de'i sna sgo g-yas nas byung nas rang gi sna sgo g-yon par zhugs te /
translated: It is drawn out from the right nostril of the victim and enters one’s left nostril.

original: lte ba'i rlung dang me'i dkyil 'khor 'bar ba'i steng du bcug ste bsreg par bsgom me zhes ston to //
analyzed: lte ba'i rlung dang me'i dkyil 'khor 'bar ba'i steng du bcug ste bsreg par bsgom me zhes ston to //
translated: It is placed on the wind and fire maṇḍala that blazes at the navel and is meditated on as burning.

original: 'di ni pha rol gyi rnam par shes pa dbrog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni pha rol gyi rnam par shes pa dbrog pa'o //
translated: This is the extraction of the consciousness of the victim.

original: ji srid zad par byas pas zhes bya ba ni pha rol gyi lus dang rang gi rna par she pas ma bkang gi bar du'o //
analyzed: ji srid zad par byas pas zhes bya ba ni pha rol gyi lus dang rang gi rna par she pas ma bkang gi bar du'o //
translated: “As long as it is exhausted” means as long as the body of the victim and one’s consciousness are not filled.

original: 'dis ni gzhan gyi grong du 'jug pa yang bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni gzhan gyi grong du 'jug pa yang bstan te /
translated: This also teaches the entry into another's town.

original: 'on kyang rang gi lus spangs te 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang rang gi lus spangs te 'jug pa'o //
translated: However, one enters having abandoned one's own body.

original: da ni sngar bstan pa'i skabs kyi dbye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni sngar bstan pa'i skabs kyi dbye ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to classify the previously taught,

original: 'chi ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'chi ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, death, etc.

original: sngar bstan pa'i 'chi bltas mthong nas gang gi tshe bzlog par ma nus pa de ni 'chi ba'i dus la bab par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i 'chi bltas mthong nas gang gi tshe bzlog par ma nus pa de ni 'chi ba'i dus la bab par gyur pa'o //
translated: When, having seen the previously taught signs of death, one is unable to avert it, then the time of death has arrived.

original: ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
translated: How is this to be known?

original: 'chi ba'i mtshan ma ston pa ste 'chi ltas kyis 'chi bar ston pa'i dus so //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i mtshan ma ston pa ste 'chi ltas kyis 'chi bar ston pa'i dus so //
translated: It is the time when the signs of death are shown, when the omens of death are shown.

original: rims la sogs pas ma phog par //
analyzed: rims la sogs pas ma phog par //
translated: Without being struck by fever, etc.

original: zhes bya ba ni rims la sogs pa'i nad kyi tshogs kyis ma @135b gzir bar gong du 'pho ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rims la sogs pa'i nad kyi tshogs kyis ma @135b gzir bar gong du 'pho ba'o //
translated: means that the transference to a higher level is without being oppressed by the mass of diseases such as fever.

original: gong du 'pho ba mchog yin no //
analyzed: gong du 'pho ba mchog yin no //
translated: The transference to a higher level is supreme.

original: zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe steng gi sgo nas 'pho ba de bde blag tu 'bras bur smin pa dang / skye bo rnams 'dul bar byed pa'i phyir mchog ste dam pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe steng gi sgo nas 'pho ba de bde blag tu 'bras bur smin pa dang / skye bo rnams 'dul bar byed pa'i phyir mchog ste dam pa yin no //
translated: This is the supreme because at that time, the transference through the upper door is easily ripened into the result, and because it is for the sake of subduing beings.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //🔽seng ge rnam rol phyag rgya yis //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o // seng ge rnam rol phyag rgya yis //
translated: Then, etc. is easy to understand.

original: rnal 'byor ma ni bcing bar bya //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma ni bcing bar bya //
translated: The yoginīs are bound with the lion-posture seal.

original: zhes bya ba la rnal 'byor ma ni bod pa'o //🔽seng ge rnam rol phyag rgya yis //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la rnal 'byor ma ni bod pa'o // seng ge rnam rol phyag rgya yis //
translated: The yoginīs are bound.

original: zhes bya ba ni srog dang rtsos pa zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni srog dang rtsos pa zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //
translated: With the lion-posture seal is connected with life and exertion.

original: bcing zhes bya ba ni mig dang rna ba dang sna ba dang sna dang kha'i bu ga rnams rang gi sor mo rnams kyis bsdams la /
analyzed: bcing zhes bya ba ni mig dang rna ba dang sna ba dang sna dang kha'i bu ga rnams rang gi sor mo rnams kyis bsdams la /
translated: Bound means that the eye, ear, nose, and mouth holes are blocked with one's fingers,

original: steng 'og gi rlung rnams bzlums shing btsir ba'o //
analyzed: steng 'og gi rlung rnams bzlums shing btsir ba'o //
translated: and the upper and lower winds are pressed together and squeezed.

original: de nas ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: de nas ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: Then, what is to be done?

original: rang gi 'khrul 'khor ltar btsir zhing bsdams te /
analyzed: rang gi 'khrul 'khor ltar btsir zhing bsdams te /
translated: One's machine is squeezed and bound.

original: de'i 'og tu steng nas gtang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu steng nas gtang bar bya'o //
translated: Then, it is released from above.

original: kha cig ni yul rnams la 'bad pa med par longs spyod pa ni seng ge rnam rol gyi phyag rgya yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig ni yul rnams la 'bad pa med par longs spyod pa ni seng ge rnam rol gyi phyag rgya yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say that the enjoyment of objects without effort is the mudrā of the lion’s play.

original: de nyid gsungs pa khyod kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa khyod kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: That itself is stated in “you” and so on.

original: khyod kyis zhes bya ba ni lha mo'i rang bzhin ta shes rab kyi cha'o //
analyzed: khyod kyis zhes bya ba ni lha mo'i rang bzhin ta shes rab kyi cha'o //
translated: “ You” is the goddess’s nature, the wisdom aspect.

original: 'di ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
translated: This is an example.

original: nga zhes bya ba bsngar gsungs pa'i thabs kyi cha yang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: nga zhes bya ba bsngar gsungs pa'i thabs kyi cha yang blta bar bya'o //
translated: “ I” is the previously mentioned method aspect.

original: gnas zhes bya ba ni thabs dang shes rab kyi go 'phang de nyid de /
analyzed: gnas zhes bya ba ni thabs dang shes rab kyi go 'phang de nyid de /
translated: “ Place” is that very state of method and wisdom.

original: 'di ltar rlung steng du 'gro ba ni shes rab kyi cha yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar rlung steng du 'gro ba ni shes rab kyi cha yin la /
translated: Thus, the upward movement of the wind is the wisdom aspect.

original: 'og tu 'gro ba ni thabs kyi cha yin te /
analyzed: 'og tu 'gro ba ni thabs kyi cha yin te /
translated: The downward movement is the method aspect.

original: sbyar ba ni gcig tu bzlums shing btsir ba'o //
analyzed: sbyar ba ni gcig tu bzlums shing btsir ba'o //
translated: “ Union” is the combination and pressing together of the two.

original: de nas ci zhig bya zhe na /🔽rang gi lus ni yongs su gtong //
analyzed: de nas ci zhig bya zhe na / rang gi lus ni yongs su gtong //
translated: What is done then?

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: “ One should give up one’s body.”

original: rang gi lus yongs su gtong ba ste bor nas 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi lus yongs su gtong ba ste bor nas 'gro ba'o //
translated: “ One should give up one’s body” means one should abandon it.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How?

original: rim gyis sbyor bas phyi nas su //
analyzed: rim gyis sbyor bas phyi nas su //
translated: By the gradual process, later on.

original: zhes bya ba la goms pa dbang du gyur pas tshegs med par rang gi steng gi sgo nas phye nas rnam par shes pa gzhan gyi lus la gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la goms pa dbang du gyur pas tshegs med par rang gi steng gi sgo nas phye nas rnam par shes pa gzhan gyi lus la gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Having become familiar with the process, one should open the door above oneself without difficulty and introduce the consciousness into another's body.

original: de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: That is stated:

original: sbyor ba'i rim pa de nyid kyis //🔽zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i rim pa de nyid kyis // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: By the same process of yoga,

original: 'chi ltas snang bar gyur nas phyi nang gi sbyor ba la sogs pa'i rim pa de nyid kyis so //
analyzed: 'chi ltas snang bar gyur nas phyi nang gi sbyor ba la sogs pa'i rim pa de nyid kyis so //
translated: Having seen the signs of death, by the same process of yoga, external and internal, and so forth.

original: rang gi lus su sbyar bar 'dong //
analyzed: rang gi lus su sbyar bar 'dong //
translated: One should introduce it into one's own body.

original: ces bya ba la rang gi lus su sbyar ba ni gang du gzhug par bya ba'i lus de rang gi rnam par shes pa dang bsres nas rang gi lus su bya ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba la rang gi lus su sbyar ba ni gang du gzhug par bya ba'i lus de rang gi rnam par shes pa dang bsres nas rang gi lus su bya ba'o //
translated: Introducing it into one's own body means that the body into which it is to be introduced is mixed with one's own consciousness and made into one's own body.

original: 'dod ces bya ba ni sgrub pa po nus pa dang ldan pas pha rol gyi lus gzhon pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa gang du gzhug par 'dod pa de'o //
analyzed: 'dod ces bya ba ni sgrub pa po nus pa dang ldan pas pha rol gyi lus gzhon pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa gang du gzhug par 'dod pa de'o //
translated: Desiring means that the adept, having become capable, desires to introduce it into the body of another, endowed with youth and so forth.

original: cho ga 'di'i che ba'i bdag nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: cho ga 'di'i che ba'i bdag nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the greatness of this rite,

original: cho ga @136a * //
analyzed: cho ga @136a * //
translated: he says,

original: 'di ltar byas pa yis //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di ltar byas pa yis // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: By performing this rite,

original: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba zhes bya ba ni rlung gi 'gro ba dang 'od ba'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba zhes bya ba ni rlung gi 'gro ba dang 'od ba'o //
translated: Going and coming refers to the going and coming of the winds.

original: bye brag ces bya ba ni de goms par byas pas phul du byung ba'i gnas thob pa'o //
analyzed: bye brag ces bya ba ni de goms par byas pas phul du byung ba'i gnas thob pa'o //
translated: Superior means that by cultivating that, one attains the supreme state.

original: mkha' 'gro ma dang sbyor ba'i ma //🔽zhes bya ba la sbyor ba'i ma ni sbyor ba'i dngos grub dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma dang sbyor ba'i ma // zhes bya ba la sbyor ba'i ma ni sbyor ba'i dngos grub dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The dakinis and the yoginis

original: de ltar na dpa' bo dang mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa rnams dang sbyor ba'i dngos grub can thams cad kyi mchod pa 'dis ni phan yon bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na dpa' bo dang mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa rnams dang sbyor ba'i dngos grub can thams cad kyi mchod pa 'dis ni phan yon bstan pa yin no //
translated: The yoginis are those who possess the power of union. Thus, by this worship of all the heroes, dakinis, etc., who possess the power of union, the benefits are taught.

original: gang gis ring nas thos gyur pa //
analyzed: gang gis ring nas thos gyur pa //
translated: By whom this has been heard for a long time,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mngon par shes pa drug bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mngon par shes pa drug bstan te /
translated: and so forth. By this, the six superknowledges are taught.

original: ring nas zhes bya ba ni yul dang dus la sogs pas bskal ba'o //
analyzed: ring nas zhes bya ba ni yul dang dus la sogs pas bskal ba'o //
translated: A long time means a long time in terms of place, time, etc.

original: bsam pa rjes su shes par bya //
analyzed: bsam pa rjes su shes par bya //
translated: One should know the mind of another through inference.

original: zhes bya ba la rjes su ni rjes su mthun pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la rjes su ni rjes su mthun pa ste /
translated: Here, “inference” means a logical mark.

original: pha rol gyi sems kyi rnam par byung ba'i shes pas shes par bya'o //
analyzed: pha rol gyi sems kyi rnam par byung ba'i shes pas shes par bya'o //
translated: One should know the mind of another through the knowledge that arises from the logical mark of the mind of another.

original: 'dir yang ring nas zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'dir yang ring nas zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: Here also, “from afar” should be supplied.

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni mngon par shes pa lhag ma bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni mngon par shes pa lhag ma bstan pa yin no //
translated: “Just so” indicates the teaching of the remaining superknowledges.

original: sus she na mkhas pas so //
analyzed: sus she na mkhas pas so //
translated: By whom? By the wise.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir bsgom pa dang bzlas pa'i khyad par gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir bsgom pa dang bzlas pa'i khyad par gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says, “through the distinction of meditation and repetition. ”

original: rnal 'byor ba gang gi khyad par bsgom pa dang bzlas pa la goms pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ba gang gi khyad par bsgom pa dang bzlas pa la goms pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The one who is skilled in the distinction of meditation and repetition is called “the one who is skilled in meditation and repetition. ”

original: gang gi lam la bsams nas ni //
analyzed: gang gi lam la bsams nas ni //
translated: “Having reflected on whose path? ”

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: gang gi zhes bya ba rnal 'byor pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi zhes bya ba rnal 'byor pa'o //
translated: “whose” refers to the yogin.

original: bsams pa ni bsgoms pa ste rnal 'byor pa gang gi lam gang dang gang nas bsgoms pa de dang de'i 'bras bu 'grub par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bsams pa ni bsgoms pa ste rnal 'byor pa gang gi lam gang dang gang nas bsgoms pa de dang de'i 'bras bu 'grub par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The thought is the meditation, and whatever path of whatever yogi is meditated, the result of that is accomplished.

original: de yang / goms pa'i stobs ni rdzogs pa yis //
analyzed: de yang / goms pa'i stobs ni rdzogs pa yis //
translated: And that is just as it is said: By the power of practice being complete,

original: 'grub par mi 'gyur ci yang med //🔽ces gang gsungs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'grub par mi 'gyur ci yang med // ces gang gsungs pa bzhin no //
translated: there is nothing that will not be accomplished.

original: 'khor lo gang zhig sngar bstan pa //
analyzed: 'khor lo gang zhig sngar bstan pa //
translated: The wheel that was previously taught

original: zhes bya ba ni gtum mo'i rnal 'byor sngar goms par byas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gtum mo'i rnal 'byor sngar goms par byas pa'o //
translated: is the yoga of fierce woman, which was previously practiced.🔽Having entered

original: zhugs te zhes bya ba ni gtum mo'i 'od zer ro //
analyzed: zhugs te zhes bya ba ni gtum mo'i 'od zer ro //
translated: is the light ray of fierce woman.

original: 'jig rten gsum dang 'dres nas ni //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum dang 'dres nas ni //
translated: Having mixed with the three worlds

original: zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gsum na yod pa'i sgra rnams bzlums zhing gcig tu 'dres pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gsum na yod pa'i sgra rnams bzlums zhing gcig tu 'dres pa'o //
translated: is the sound of the three worlds being combined and mixed into one.

original: ci lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ci lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: me stag bzhin du rnam par 'khor //
analyzed: me stag bzhin du rnam par 'khor //
translated: Like a spark, it circles.

original: zhes bya ba ni me stag 'phro ba'i me'i phung bo ltar byung ba'i 'od kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni me stag 'phro ba'i me'i phung bo ltar byung ba'i 'od kyi tshogs so //
translated: It is a mass of light that arises like a mass of fire with sparks flying off it.

original: ci'i 'od ce na /
analyzed: ci'i 'od ce na /
translated: What light?

original: rlung gis bskyod pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rlung gis bskyod pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The verse beginning stirred by the wind and so forth.

original: rlung dang me yis bskyod pa yis //
analyzed: rlung dang me yis bskyod pa yis //
translated: Stirred by the wind and fire,

original: shes rab ces bya ba gtum mo'i 'od dang / des bskul ba'i snying ga'i @136b padmar brten pa'i yi ge h'um gi 'od rlung gis bskyod pa'i gtum mo'i 'od dang lhan cig tu gyur nas phyir byung ba de dang de 'dres pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab ces bya ba gtum mo'i 'od dang / des bskul ba'i snying ga'i @136b padmar brten pa'i yi ge h'um gi 'od rlung gis bskyod pa'i gtum mo'i 'od dang lhan cig tu gyur nas phyir byung ba de dang de 'dres pa'o //
translated: the light of the wisdom fire and the light of the syllable hūṃ based in the heart lotus, which is stimulated by that, together with the light of the candālī stirred by the wind, emerge and mix with that.

original: zhugs bsams na zhes bya ba ni 'od de dag dang 'dres pa'i sgra'i tshogs ma lce'i phung po lta bu de slar yang rang gi snying gar brten pa'i padma'i gnas su gzhug par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhugs bsams na zhes bya ba ni 'od de dag dang 'dres pa'i sgra'i tshogs ma lce'i phung po lta bu de slar yang rang gi snying gar brten pa'i padma'i gnas su gzhug par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase imagining it enters means that the mass of sound mixed with those lights, which is like a mass of tongues, should again enter the place of the lotus in one's heart center. This is the meaning.

original: 'di ni yan lag gi don yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni yan lag gi don yin no //
translated: This is the branch topic.

original: 'di dag gi bsdus pa'i don ni sngar bstan pa ltar lte ba'i nang du chud pa'i sbrul pa'i 'khor lo bsgoms te /
analyzed: 'di dag gi bsdus pa'i don ni sngar bstan pa ltar lte ba'i nang du chud pa'i sbrul pa'i 'khor lo bsgoms te /
translated: The summarized topic is as follows: As previously explained, one should meditate on the emanation wheel that is located inside the navel.

original: rlung gis me sbar ba bltas la der gnas pa'i sa bon gyi 'od zer gyis snying ga'i chos kyi 'khor lor chud pa'i h'um la bskul nas de'i 'od dang lhan cig tu gyur nas sna sgo g-yas pa nas byung ste /
analyzed: rlung gis me sbar ba bltas la der gnas pa'i sa bon gyi 'od zer gyis snying ga'i chos kyi 'khor lor chud pa'i h'um la bskul nas de'i 'od dang lhan cig tu gyur nas sna sgo g-yas pa nas byung ste /
translated: Together with the light, it emerges from the right nostril, and,

original: 'jig rten gsum na gnas pa'i sgra'i tshogs dang 'dres nas ye shes kyi gzi brjid kyi phung por gyur te /
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum na gnas pa'i sgra'i tshogs dang 'dres nas ye shes kyi gzi brjid kyi phung por gyur te /
translated: mixing with the host of sounds located in the three worlds, becomes a mass of the splendor of pristine awareness.

original: gang 'dod pa'i rna ba'i lam nas bcug la snying ga'i padmar thim par bsgom pa 'di yin no //
analyzed: gang 'dod pa'i rna ba'i lam nas bcug la snying ga'i padmar thim par bsgom pa 'di yin no //
translated: It enters the ear of the person to be subdued, and one should meditate on it dissolving into the heart lotus.

original: bsgom pa'i sbyor ba 'di yis ni //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i sbyor ba 'di yis ni //
translated: By this yoga of meditation,

original: zhes bya ba ni 'das ma thag pa'i sbyor ba de yis te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'das ma thag pa'i sbyor ba de yis te /
translated: means by the yoga just described.

original: bye brag tu ni gzugs thams cad dang 'dres nas mig gi lam nas gzhug par bya ba'o //
analyzed: bye brag tu ni gzugs thams cad dang 'dres nas mig gi lam nas gzhug par bya ba'o //
translated: In particular, it mixes with all forms and enters the path of the eye.

original: skad cig gis zhes bya ba ni da ltar gnas pa bzhin du'am thogs pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skad cig gis zhes bya ba ni da ltar gnas pa bzhin du'am thogs pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: In an instant means that it becomes like the present, unobstructed.

original: gsal bar mthong zhes bya ba ni lag mthil na gnas pa'i dngos po ltar mthong ba'o //
analyzed: gsal bar mthong zhes bya ba ni lag mthil na gnas pa'i dngos po ltar mthong ba'o //
translated: Seeing clearly means seeing like an object placed in the palm of the hand.

original: de bzhin du gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang / lus kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi bya ba shes pa de dag kyang cho ga'i sbyor ba de nyid kyis rjes su dpag par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang / lus kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi bya ba shes pa de dag kyang cho ga'i sbyor ba de nyid kyis rjes su dpag par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the knowledge of others' minds and the knowledge of the performance of bodily miracles should be inferred by that very application of the rite.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /🔽bstan dang ma bstan gang ci 'ang rung //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa / bstan dang ma bstan gang ci 'ang rung //
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Whatever is taught or not taught... and so on.

original: ma bstan pa ni le'u 'dir ma bstan pa'i mngon par shes pa lhag ma rnams so //
analyzed: ma bstan pa ni le'u 'dir ma bstan pa'i mngon par shes pa lhag ma rnams so //
translated: Here, the not taught refers to the remaining superknowledges not taught in this chapter.

original: bstan pa ni de nyid le'u gzhan dang rgyud gzhan dag tu bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bstan pa ni de nyid le'u gzhan dang rgyud gzhan dag tu bstan pa'o //
translated: The taught refers to those taught in other chapters and other tantras.

original: de kun nga yis yang dag bshad //
analyzed: de kun nga yis yang dag bshad //
translated: I will fully explain all that.

original: ces bya ba ni cho ga'i sbyor ba 'dir bstan pa gnyis la ltos pa'i phyir bstan pa dang 'dra'o snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni cho ga'i sbyor ba 'dir bstan pa gnyis la ltos pa'i phyir bstan pa dang 'dra'o snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
translated: This means that it is similar to the taught, thinking that it is in relation to the two taught in this application of the rite.

original: da ni 'pho ba'i sgo rnams kyi skyon yon gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni 'pho ba'i sgo rnams kyi skyon yon gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the faults and virtues of the doors of transference are taught:

original: nyon cig lha mo sgyu ma che //
analyzed: nyon cig lha mo sgyu ma che //
translated: Listen, O great illusory goddess!

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa sgyu ma che ni bod pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa sgyu ma che ni bod pa'o //
translated: In this passage, “great illusory” means “deceptive.”

original: dge ba'i sgo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad kyis nyon cig ces bya ba dang sbyar ro //🔽thar pa'i dngos grub rab ster ba //
analyzed: dge ba'i sgo zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bshad kyis nyon cig ces bya ba dang sbyar ro // thar pa'i dngos grub rab ster ba //
translated: “ Door of virtue” and so forth are connected with “listen.”

original: zhes bya ba ni thar pa dang mthun pa'i lha'i lus te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni thar pa dang mthun pa'i lha'i lus te /
translated: “ Bestows the supreme attainment of liberation” means the divine body that is conducive to liberation.

original: gser gyi sgo nas 'gro ba dang sbyar ro //🔽de nyid @137a * //
analyzed: gser gyi sgo nas 'gro ba dang sbyar ro // de nyid @137a * //
translated: This is connected with “going through the golden door.”

original: kyis ni mchog dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: kyis ni mchog dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says “supreme” and so forth.

original: mchog ni thar pa dang mthun pa'i rig 'dzin gyi lus so //
analyzed: mchog ni thar pa dang mthun pa'i rig 'dzin gyi lus so //
translated: “ Supreme” means the body of a knowledge-holder that is conducive to liberation.

original: tha ma ni ngan song gsum gyi lus so //
analyzed: tha ma ni ngan song gsum gyi lus so //
translated: “ Inferior” means the body of the three lower rebirths.

original: don gyis ni bar ba yang gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: don gyis ni bar ba yang gzung bar bya ste /
translated: By implication, the “middling” is also included.

original: lha dang mi'i lus so //
analyzed: lha dang mi'i lus so //
translated: This is the body of a god or human.

original: de dag gis ni 'gro ba'i bye brag gi sgo rab 'bring gsum du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gis ni 'gro ba'i bye brag gi sgo rab 'bring gsum du bstan pa yin no //
translated: These three—supreme, middling, and inferior—indicate the three doors of migrating beings.

original: lte ba las ni 'dod khams lha //
analyzed: lte ba las ni 'dod khams lha //
translated: “ The gods of the desire realm are from the navel” and so forth.

original: zhes bya ba ni gang gi rnam par shes pa lte ba'i sgo nas 'gro ba de ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi ltar skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang gi rnam par shes pa lte ba'i sgo nas 'gro ba de ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi ltar skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That is, one who goes through the navel door is born in the desire realm.

original: thig le'i gzugs can mtho ris te //
analyzed: thig le'i gzugs can mtho ris te //
translated: The form of the drop is the higher realms.

original: zhes bya ba ni smin ma'i dbus kyi sgo nas 'gro ba gang yin pa de gzugs kyi khams kyi ltar skye ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni smin ma'i dbus kyi sgo nas 'gro ba gang yin pa de gzugs kyi khams kyi ltar skye ba'o //
translated: That is, one who goes through the door in the middle of the eyebrows is born in the form realm.

original: steng nas 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni gser gyi sgo nas 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: steng nas 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni gser gyi sgo nas 'gro ba'o //
translated: Going above is going through the golden door.

original: myur du 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni myur ba nyid du 'pho ba ste steng gi 'gro ba zhes bya ba thar pa'i lam dang mthun pa'i yid las byung ba ni lha'i lus te 'gro ba thams cad kyi bla mar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: myur du 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni myur ba nyid du 'pho ba ste steng gi 'gro ba zhes bya ba thar pa'i lam dang mthun pa'i yid las byung ba ni lha'i lus te 'gro ba thams cad kyi bla mar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Going quickly is transference quickly. Going above is the divine body arisen from mind, which is in harmony with the path of liberation, because it is the highest of all migrations.

original: yang na myur bar bde 'gro khyad par can thob pa'o //
analyzed: yang na myur bar bde 'gro khyad par can thob pa'o //
translated: Or else, it is the attainment of a special happy migration quickly.

original: srid pa'i sgo zhes bya ba ni kha'o //
analyzed: srid pa'i sgo zhes bya ba ni kha'o //
translated: The door of existence is the mouth.

original: chu zhes bya ba ni gci ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: chu zhes bya ba ni gci ba'i lam mo //
translated: Water is the path of excretion.

original: chu min zhes bya ba ni bshad ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: chu min zhes bya ba ni bshad ba'i lam mo //
translated: The not water is the path of explanation.

original: thar pa'i lam nas gzhan du 'gro / zhes bya ba ni sgo de dag thar pa dang mi mthun pa'o //
analyzed: thar pa'i lam nas gzhan du 'gro / zhes bya ba ni sgo de dag thar pa dang mi mthun pa'o //
translated: One goes elsewhere than the path of liberation means that those gates are not in accord with liberation.

original: kha cig na re thar pa'i lam ni gser gyi sgo yin la /
analyzed: kha cig na re thar pa'i lam ni gser gyi sgo yin la /
translated: Some say that the path of liberation is the golden gate.

original: gzhan du 'gro zhes bya ba ni gang du 'dod par 'pho ba'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan du 'gro zhes bya ba ni gang du 'dod par 'pho ba'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Going elsewhere means going wherever one wishes.

original: gzhan dag ni chos thams cad bdag med par rtogs pa'i lha'i ting nge 'dzin gyis ni thar bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni chos thams cad bdag med par rtogs pa'i lha'i ting nge 'dzin gyis ni thar bar 'gyur la /
translated: Others say that one is liberated by the divine concentration that realizes that all phenomena are selfless.

original: gzhan du ste bdag med pa'i shes rab dang bral na 'gro ba ste 'khor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du ste bdag med pa'i shes rab dang bral na 'gro ba ste 'khor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Going elsewhere means that one goes into cyclic existence, because one is separated from the wisdom of selflessness.

original: de yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de yang gsungs pa /
translated: That is also stated:

original: yang dag ji bzhin yongs shes nas //
analyzed: yang dag ji bzhin yongs shes nas //
translated: Having fully understood reality as it is,

original: mthar ni yang srid med par 'gyur //
analyzed: mthar ni yang srid med par 'gyur //
translated: in the end there is no more existence.

original: zhes bya bar 'dod do //
analyzed: zhes bya bar 'dod do //
translated: Thus it is asserted.

original: god du 'pho ba nye bar bsdu ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: god du 'pho ba nye bar bsdu ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the summary of going elsewhere, he says,

original: sngon du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sngon du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: First, etc.

original: sngon du bum pa brtsams pa yis //
analyzed: sngon du bum pa brtsams pa yis //
translated: First, having made the pot,

original: zhes bya ba ni sgo sbyang ba'i dus su bum pa can bstan pa ltar 'pho ba'i dus su yang bum pa can bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sgo sbyang ba'i dus su bum pa can bstan pa ltar 'pho ba'i dus su yang bum pa can bya ste /
translated: As was taught in the section on the purification of the doors, one should practice vase yoga at the time of transference.

original: sgo thams cad du sa bon rnams bkod pas bsdams shing btsir ba la goms par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sgo thams cad du sa bon rnams bkod pas bsdams shing btsir ba la goms par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should practice the binding and pressing of all the doors by the arrangement of the seed syllables.

original: sa bon rnams dgod pa gsungs pa /🔽rgyas pa lnga yis zhes bya ba la sogs pa /
analyzed: sa bon rnams dgod pa gsungs pa / rgyas pa lnga yis zhes bya ba la sogs pa /
translated: The arrangement of the seed syllables is taught:

original: rgyas pa lnga'i mchod rten ni mgo'o //
analyzed: rgyas pa lnga'i mchod rten ni mgo'o //
translated: The fivefold expansion is the head.

original: de'i sgo'i bu ga ni gser gyi sgo'o //
analyzed: de'i sgo'i bu ga ni gser gyi sgo'o //
translated: The opening of its door is the golden door.

original: bsgom @137b par bya ba ni der h'um dkar po dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: bsgom @137b par bya ba ni der h'um dkar po dgod par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on the placement of the white syllable hum there.

original: yang na rgyas pa lnga'i mchod rten ni yi ge h'um ngo //
analyzed: yang na rgyas pa lnga'i mchod rten ni yi ge h'um ngo //
translated: Alternatively, the fivefold expansion is the syllable hum.

original: lhag ma ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as explained previously.

original: 'og gi sgo zhes bya ba ni de'i 'og tu ste mgrin pa'i nang du'o //
analyzed: 'og gi sgo zhes bya ba ni de'i 'og tu ste mgrin pa'i nang du'o //
translated: The lower door is below that, in the throat.

original: ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: ci zhig ce na /
translated: What?

original: chu yis bon dkar po bsam //
analyzed: chu yis bon dkar po bsam //
translated: The white syllable of water is imagined.

original: zhes bya ba ste yi ge hmryum ngo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste yi ge hmryum ngo //
translated: The syllable is hum.

original: de la phrag pa gnyis su ni hmryum ngo //
analyzed: de la phrag pa gnyis su ni hmryum ngo //
translated: The two shoulders are hum.

original: snying gar ni ymryum ngo //
analyzed: snying gar ni ymryum ngo //
translated: In the heart, yaṃ.

original: lte bar ni kshmryum ngo //
analyzed: lte bar ni kshmryum ngo //
translated: In the navel, kṣaṃ.

original: chu dang chu min gyi sgo ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: chu dang chu min gyi sgo ni bshad zin to //
translated: The door of water and non-water has been explained.

original: me'i sa bon 'bar ba ni sgo de gnyis su yang me'i mdog can gyi kshmryum dgod pa'o //
analyzed: me'i sa bon 'bar ba ni sgo de gnyis su yang me'i mdog can gyi kshmryum dgod pa'o //
translated: The seed of fire, blazing, is the color of fire, and is placed in those two doors.

original: yang na gser gyi sgor sa bon kshum ser po'o //
analyzed: yang na gser gyi sgor sa bon kshum ser po'o //
translated: Or, in the golden door, the seed is the yellow kṣaṃ.

original: mig gnyis su ni h'um sngon po'o //
analyzed: mig gnyis su ni h'um sngon po'o //
translated: In the two eyes, blue hūṃ.

original: rna ba gnyis dang sna gnyis dag tu ni yum dmar pa'o //
analyzed: rna ba gnyis dang sna gnyis dag tu ni yum dmar pa'o //
translated: In the two ears and two nostrils, red yaṃ.

original: khar ni sa bon sum ste de dag gis bum pa can du byas nas 'jug pa dang 'byung ba'i bzlas pa la goms par bya'o zhes pa'i /
analyzed: khar ni sa bon sum ste de dag gis bum pa can du byas nas 'jug pa dang 'byung ba'i bzlas pa la goms par bya'o zhes pa'i /
translated: In the mouth, the seed is suṃ. Having made the vase with those, one should become familiar with the recitation of inhalation and exhalation.

original: don te de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: don te de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: This is the meaning. Therefore it is said:

original: de la shin tu mnyam gzhag pas //
analyzed: de la shin tu mnyam gzhag pas //
translated: There, with great equipoise,

original: dbugs ni bum pa can du bsgom //
analyzed: dbugs ni bum pa can du bsgom //
translated: the breath is cultivated as a vase.

original: zhes so // de ltar sngon du brtsams nas /
analyzed: zhes so // de ltar sngon du brtsams nas /
translated: Having thus practiced beforehand,

original: da ni dngos su 'pho ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni dngos su 'pho ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to teach the actual transference,

original: lus ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: lus ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares “body” and so on.

original: lus ni rlung gi mdog tu ste //
analyzed: lus ni rlung gi mdog tu ste //
translated: The body is the color of wind.

original: rlung gi dkyil 'khor bsgom par bya //
analyzed: rlung gi dkyil 'khor bsgom par bya //
translated: One should meditate on the mandala of wind.

original: zhes bya ba ni snying gar rlung gi dkyil 'khor bsgoms la de'i dbus su lus ni ste h'um gi lus rlung gi mdog tu ste rlung ltar sngo ba bsgom pa ste bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni snying gar rlung gi dkyil 'khor bsgoms la de'i dbus su lus ni ste h'um gi lus rlung gi mdog tu ste rlung ltar sngo ba bsgom pa ste bsam par bya'o //
translated: This means that one should meditate on the mandala of wind at the heart, and in the middle of that one should meditate on the body, that is, the body of the syllable hum, the color of wind, that is, blue like wind.

original: 'dir rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su zhes bya bar blta ste /
analyzed: 'dir rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su zhes bya bar blta ste /
translated: Here one should understand that it is in the middle of the mandala of wind.

original: drug pa dang dbus kyi sgra mi mngon pa yin no //
analyzed: drug pa dang dbus kyi sgra mi mngon pa yin no //
translated: The sixth case and the middle are not expressed.

original: rlung gi sa bon rtsa bar te //
analyzed: rlung gi sa bon rtsa bar te //
translated: The seed of wind is at the root.

original: zhes bya ba la rlung gi sa bon ni ya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la rlung gi sa bon ni ya'o //
translated: The seed of wind is ya.

original: sa bon de thig le'i sgra dang ldan pa ste bsdus pas yam zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa bon de thig le'i sgra dang ldan pa ste bsdus pas yam zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: That seed is endowed with the sound of a drop, that is, it is contracted, and so becomes yam.

original: rtsa ba ni rlung gi rtsa bar te bsgoms zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //
analyzed: rtsa ba ni rlung gi rtsa bar te bsgoms zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //
translated: The root is at the root of wind.

original: rlung gi mtha' ni rtsa ba can //
analyzed: rlung gi mtha' ni rtsa ba can //
translated: The end of wind is at the root.

original: zhes bya ba la rlung gi mtha' ni rlung gi steng ngo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la rlung gi mtha' ni rlung gi steng ngo //
translated: The end of wind is above wind.

original: rtsa ba ni rlung gi sa bon yam ste de dang ldan par bya'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba ni rlung gi sa bon yam ste de dang ldan par bya'o //
translated: The root is the seed of wind, yam, and one should be endowed with that.

original: rtsa ba'i sa bon ni sa bon hi dang / sa bon kam ngo //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i sa bon ni sa bon hi dang / sa bon kam ngo //
translated: The root seed is the seed hi and the seed kam.

original: drang ba ni yan man bzlog cing bsnun pa'o //
analyzed: drang ba ni yan man bzlog cing bsnun pa'o //
translated: Straight means reversing up and down and striking.

original: de dag gis ni 'di skad du snying gar rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su sa bon h'um bsgoms la /
analyzed: de dag gis ni 'di skad du snying gar rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su sa bon h'um bsgoms la /
translated: They mean the following: Meditate on the seed hum in the center of the wind mandala in the heart.

original: rlung gi steng dang 'og tu yang sa bon yam gnyis bkod la /
analyzed: rlung gi steng dang 'og tu yang sa bon yam gnyis bkod la /
translated: Place two yam seeds above and below the wind.

original: de gnyis kyi dbus su rtsa ba'i sa bon hi ka bsams la /🔽gang gi tshe rlung ste du ldang ba'i tshe yam gi sa bon ni steng du hi ni 'og tu bsam zhing de bzhin du ka'i sa bon ni @138a * //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi dbus su rtsa ba'i sa bon hi ka bsams la / gang gi tshe rlung ste du ldang ba'i tshe yam gi sa bon ni steng du hi ni 'og tu bsam zhing de bzhin du ka'i sa bon ni @138a * //
translated: In the middle of those two, imagine the root seed hi ka.🔽When the wind rises, imagine the yam seed above and the hi seed below.

original: steng du bsam zhing yam gi sa bon ni 'og tu bsam mo //
analyzed: steng du bsam zhing yam gi sa bon ni 'og tu bsam mo //
translated: In the same way, imagine the ka seed above and the yam seed below.

original: gang gi tshe rlung 'og tu 'bar ba'i tshe ni de las bzlog par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rlung 'og tu 'bar ba'i tshe ni de las bzlog par blta bar bya'o //
translated: When the wind blazes below, it should be seen as the opposite of that.

original: 'og tu rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyis //
analyzed: 'og tu rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyis //
translated: The wind mandala below

original: sgra dang sgra yis 'phul bar byed //
analyzed: sgra dang sgra yis 'phul bar byed //
translated: is pushed by sound and sound.

original: ces bya ba la 'og tu zhes bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa ste steng dang 'og tu'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba la 'og tu zhes bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa ste steng dang 'og tu'o //
translated: Here, below is a synecdoche for above and below.

original: 'phul zhes bya ba ni yan man rlung gi dkyil 'khor 'dren pa'o //
analyzed: 'phul zhes bya ba ni yan man rlung gi dkyil 'khor 'dren pa'o //
translated: Push means to draw up and down the wind-mandala.

original: gang gis she na /
analyzed: gang gis she na /
translated: By what?

original: sgra dang sgra yis te hi ka'i sngags yang dang yang du bzlas pas yan man du drangs te goms par byas la mthar de nyid kyis 'dod pa'i lam nas gtang bar bya'o //
analyzed: sgra dang sgra yis te hi ka'i sngags yang dang yang du bzlas pas yan man du drangs te goms par byas la mthar de nyid kyis 'dod pa'i lam nas gtang bar bya'o //
translated: By sound and sound, by repeatedly reciting the mantra hi ka, one draws up and down, and having become accustomed to that, in the end one should release it through the path of the vajra.

original: goms pa de yang nyi shu rtsa gcig tsam du sbyang bar bya'o //
analyzed: goms pa de yang nyi shu rtsa gcig tsam du sbyang bar bya'o //
translated: That practice should be trained in for about twenty-one days.

original: gang du 'pho ba'i dus shes par bya ba bzlas te bstan pa'i phyir dus la bab na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang du 'pho ba'i dus shes par bya ba bzlas te bstan pa'i phyir dus la bab na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach the time of transference, it is said when the time comes, and so on.

original: 'chi ltas kyis 'chi ba'i dus la bab na bya'i gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'chi ltas kyis 'chi ba'i dus la bab na bya'i gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: When the time of death has come due to the signs of death, one should practice, not otherwise.

original: gzhan du na nyes pa cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan du na nyes pa cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If one practices otherwise, what fault arises?

original: dus min lha rnams gsod par 'gyur //
analyzed: dus min lha rnams gsod par 'gyur //
translated: One will kill the gods at the wrong time.

original: zhes bya ba ste rang gi phung po la sogs pa'i lus nyid lha rnams kyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste rang gi phung po la sogs pa'i lus nyid lha rnams kyi rang bzhin te /
translated: One’s own body, consisting of the aggregates, etc., is the nature of the gods.

original: de rnams gsod pa por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnams gsod pa por 'gyur ro //
translated: One becomes the killer of them.

original: des kyang cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des kyang cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the result of that?

original: lha rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste go sla'o //
analyzed: lha rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste go sla'o //
translated: The gods, etc. are easy to understand.

original: skra dkar bcings pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: skra dkar bcings pa gsungs pa /
translated: The binding of gray hair is stated:

original: rnal 'byor pa yis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sngar bstan pa zhes bya ba ni mgo bor bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo 'dab ma sum cu rtsa gnyis pa bstan to //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa yis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sngar bstan pa zhes bya ba ni mgo bor bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo 'dab ma sum cu rtsa gnyis pa bstan to //
translated: The yogi/nī, etc. The previously taught is the teaching of the thirty-two-spoked wheel of great bliss in the head.

original: sngo zhes bya ba ni der yi ge ham sngon po bdud rtsi'i chu rgyun 'bab pa ste /
analyzed: sngo zhes bya ba ni der yi ge ham sngon po bdud rtsi'i chu rgyun 'bab pa ste /
translated: Blue is the blue letter haṃ, the stream of the water of nectar.

original: bsgom zhes bya ba lhag ma yin no //
analyzed: bsgom zhes bya ba lhag ma yin no //
translated: Meditation is the remainder.

original: bde ba phun sum tshogs zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor pa la bde ba ster ba'i gnas te tshe dang nad med pa la sogs pa'i bde ba ster ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: bde ba phun sum tshogs zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor pa la bde ba ster ba'i gnas te tshe dang nad med pa la sogs pa'i bde ba ster ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: The abode of perfect bliss is the abode that bestows bliss on the yogi/nī, because it bestows the bliss of longevity, health, etc.

original: / steng gi rtsa ba bza' bar bya //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: / steng gi rtsa ba bza' bar bya //🔽zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should eat the upper root.

original: steng gi rtsa ba ni padma de nyid kyi khyad par te /
analyzed: steng gi rtsa ba ni padma de nyid kyi khyad par te /
