analyzed: ro hi ta la sogs pa las skyes pa'i byis pa 'dis ni 'di srid cig 'tsho bar 'gyur ro zhes rim pa bzhin lung bstan par bya'i gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: and that one should say, This child born from a Rohita, etc., will live for so long, and not otherwise.

original: nges par 'chi bar tshar gcod pa'i dbang du byas pa bstan pa'i rim par phye ba zhes bya ba la nges par 'chi ba ni srog 'dor ba'o //
analyzed: nges par 'chi bar tshar gcod pa'i dbang du byas pa bstan pa'i rim par phye ba zhes bya ba la nges par 'chi ba ni srog 'dor ba'o //
translated: The twenty-third chapter is called “The Determination of Death,” because it is about the subjugation of death.🔽“Death” is the loss of life.

original: tshar gcad pa ni bdag gi dbang du bya ba ste /
analyzed: tshar gcad pa ni bdag gi dbang du bya ba ste /
translated: “Subjugation” is the bringing of death under one’s control.

original: thig le dang sgra'i rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: thig le dang sgra'i rnal 'byor ro //
translated: This is the yoga of the drop and sound.

original: gzhung gang du de lhag par ston pa de ni nges par 'chi bar tshar gcad pa'i dbang du byas pa'i rim par phye ba ste nyi shu rtsa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: gzhung gang du de lhag par ston pa de ni nges par 'chi bar tshar gcad pa'i dbang du byas pa'i rim par phye ba ste nyi shu rtsa gsum pa'o //
translated: The chapter in which this is taught in excess is the twenty-third, called “The Determination of Death.”

original: rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po dpal rdo rje mkha' 'gro'i rnam par bshad pa las le'u nyi shu rtsa gsum pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
analyzed: rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po dpal rdo rje mkha' 'gro'i rnam par bshad pa las le'u nyi shu rtsa gsum pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
translated: This concludes the explanation of the twenty-third chapter in the commentary on the glorious Vajradaka, the great king of tantras.

original: // / @144a * //  da ni ltas la sogs pa'i sgo nas skye bo rnams gzhug par bzhed nas /
analyzed: // / @144a * //  da ni ltas la sogs pa'i sgo nas skye bo rnams gzhug par bzhed nas /
translated: Now, wishing to introduce people by means of omens and so forth,

original: rtsis kyi le'u gsungs pa /
analyzed: rtsis kyi le'u gsungs pa /
translated: he teaches the chapter on astrology.

original: ltas kyi mtshan nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ltas kyi mtshan nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The chapter on the characteristics of omens, and so forth,🔽is called “The Characteristics of Omens.”

original: de la a'a li zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni aa la sogs pa'i yi ge'o //
analyzed: de la a'a li zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni aa la sogs pa'i yi ge'o //
translated: There, “the alphabet” and so forth refers to the letters such as A.

original: k'a li ni ka la sogs pa'i yi ge'o //
analyzed: k'a li ni ka la sogs pa'i yi ge'o //
translated: The letters are the letters of the alphabet beginning with ka.

original: mnyam byas ni mtshungs par bya ba ste /
analyzed: mnyam byas ni mtshungs par bya ba ste /
translated: Equalized means made equal.

original: ji ltar mtshungs par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar mtshungs par bya zhe na /
translated: How are they made equal?

original: sde tshan du ni bsdeb par bya //
analyzed: sde tshan du ni bsdeb par bya //
translated: They are combined into groups.

original: zhes bya ba la sde tshan ni sde tshan brgyad do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sde tshan ni sde tshan brgyad do //
translated: The groups are the eight groups.

original: bsdeb pa ni sde tshan so sor re re zhing dang po dang 'og ma la sogs pa mthun pa dgu dgur bsdeb pa'o //
analyzed: bsdeb pa ni sde tshan so sor re re zhing dang po dang 'og ma la sogs pa mthun pa dgu dgur bsdeb pa'o //
translated: The combining is the combining of each of the groups into nine, with the first and the last, etc., being in agreement.

original: des ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: des ci zhig ce na /
translated: What is that?

original: dbyangs dang gsal byed dang po ste //
analyzed: dbyangs dang gsal byed dang po ste //
translated: The first of the vowels and consonants.

original: zhes bya ba la dbyangs ni aa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la dbyangs ni aa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The vowels are the vowels beginning with a.

original: gsal byed ni ka la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gsal byed ni ka la sogs pa ste /
translated: The consonants are the consonants beginning with ka.

original: de rnams kyi sde tshan lnga po'i yi ge gang dag gi ming gi dang por gnas pa de dag phan tshun du mthun zhing 'phrod par blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de rnams kyi sde tshan lnga po'i yi ge gang dag gi ming gi dang por gnas pa de dag phan tshun du mthun zhing 'phrod par blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the letters of the five groups of those should be seen as mutually agreeable and suitable, if they occur at the beginning of a name.

original: cha shas ldan la zhes bya ba ni lha dang mi la sogs pa'i cha shas la gnas pa rnams so //
analyzed: cha shas ldan la zhes bya ba ni lha dang mi la sogs pa'i cha shas la gnas pa rnams so //
translated: Endowed with parts means those that occur in the parts of gods, humans, etc.

original: snying stobs can zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: snying stobs can zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The one who is called “courageous”🔽

original: 'bad cing brtson 'grus brtsam par bya ba ste mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bad cing brtson 'grus brtsam par bya ba ste mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The one who is courageous is the one who should exert himself and apply himself, because he is suitable.

original: de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: He himself says:

original: de'i rigs su shes par bya //🔽zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i rigs su shes par bya // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: One should know his clan.🔽Because the syllables of the names of those sentient beings are similar, they are of the same clan.

original: sems can de dang de'i ming gi yi ge mthun pas rigs gcig pa nyid yin pa dang / de bzhin du lha dang de'i sgrub pa po dag kyang sde tshan rnam par dag cing mthun par bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa po nyid du 'os par de'i rigs zhes bya ba 'dis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can de dang de'i ming gi yi ge mthun pas rigs gcig pa nyid yin pa dang / de bzhin du lha dang de'i sgrub pa po dag kyang sde tshan rnam par dag cing mthun par bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa po nyid du 'os par de'i rigs zhes bya ba 'dis bstan pa yin no //
translated: Similarly, the gods and their adepts are to be accomplished with pure and similar classes, and the one who is suitable to be an adept is indicated by this, “his clan.”

original: sems can gyi rigs mthun pa de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: sems can gyi rigs mthun pa de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: He himself says that very sentient being is of a similar clan:

original: mtha' yas la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste go sla'o //
analyzed: mtha' yas la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste go sla'o //
translated: “Ananta and so forth,” and so on, which is easy to understand.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni sde tshan de dag go //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni sde tshan de dag go //
translated: “Those” are those classes.

original: yi ge bcu gnyis sgyu mche //
analyzed: yi ge bcu gnyis sgyu mche //
translated: The twelve syllables are the illusion-knot.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni r'a si la sogs pa'i rtsis bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni r'a si la sogs pa'i rtsis bstan pa yin te /
translated: And so on indicates the calculation of Rāśi and so on.

original: yi ge bcu gnyis ni dbyangs kyi yi ge bcu gnyis so //🔽'tsho dang dus kyi rang bzhin brjod //
analyzed: yi ge bcu gnyis ni dbyangs kyi yi ge bcu gnyis so // 'tsho dang dus kyi rang bzhin brjod //
translated: The twelve vowels are the twelve vowels.🔽Life and death are expressed.

original: ces bya ba la 'tsho ba ni srog go //
analyzed: ces bya ba la 'tsho ba ni srog go //
translated: Life is the life force.

original: dus ni 'chi ba'o //
analyzed: dus ni 'chi ba'o //
translated: Death is the end of life.

original: de dag r'a si zhes bya ba ste //
analyzed: de dag r'a si zhes bya ba ste //
translated: They are called rāśi.

original: zhes bya ba ni ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ;
translated: This means

original: yi ge de dag nyid r'a si'i gzugs su brtsi ba'o //
analyzed: yi ge de dag nyid r'a si'i gzugs su brtsi ba'o //
translated: those very syllables are counted in the form of rāśis.

original: skar ma kun dang yang dag ldan //
analyzed: skar ma kun dang yang dag ldan //
translated: Endowed with all the stars.

original: zhes bya ba ni dbyangs de rnams nyid rgyu skar rnams la longs spyod pa nang gi sbyor bas brtsi bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dbyangs de rnams nyid rgyu skar rnams la longs spyod pa nang gi sbyor bas brtsi bar bya'o //
translated: This means those very vowels are to be counted by means of inner yoga in the enjoyment of the lunar mansions.

original: zla ba nyi ma'i bye brag bar gis //
analyzed: zla ba nyi ma'i bye brag bar gis //
translated: By the difference between the moon and sun,

original: de bzhin 'og dang steng du bltas //
analyzed: de bzhin 'og dang steng du bltas //
translated: look below and above.

original: zhes bya ba la zla ba dang nyi ma'i bye @144b prag ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la zla ba dang nyi ma'i bye @144b prag ni /
translated: The difference between the moon and sun

original: zla ba dang nyi ma rgyu ba'i lhag par byas pa ste /
analyzed: zla ba dang nyi ma rgyu ba'i lhag par byas pa ste /
translated: is the excess of the movement of the moon and sun.

original: zla ba yar ngo dang mar ngo'o //
analyzed: zla ba yar ngo dang mar ngo'o //
translated: The moon is the waxing and waning moon.

original: 'og dang steng du blta ba ni dbyangs dang r'a si rnams kyis rgyu ba ste /
analyzed: 'og dang steng du blta ba ni dbyangs dang r'a si rnams kyis rgyu ba ste /
translated: Looking below and above is the movement by means of the vowels and rāśis.

original: yar ngo la ni 'og tu bltas la /
analyzed: yar ngo la ni 'og tu bltas la /
translated: On the waxing moon, look below.

original: mar ngo la ni bzlog ste brtsi bar bya'o //
analyzed: mar ngo la ni bzlog ste brtsi bar bya'o //
translated: On the waning side, the calculation is reversed.

original: nang gi la yang dbugs 'jug pa ni 'og tu blta ba yin la 'byung ba ni steng du blta ba'o //
analyzed: nang gi la yang dbugs 'jug pa ni 'og tu blta ba yin la 'byung ba ni steng du blta ba'o //
translated: Also, internally, inhalation is downward-facing, and exhalation is upward-facing.

original: brtan pa nyid dang g-yo ba nyid //
analyzed: brtan pa nyid dang g-yo ba nyid //
translated: Steadiness and movement.

original: ces bya ba la brtan pa dang g-yo ba ni sems rnam par g-yo ba dang brtan pa ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba la brtan pa dang g-yo ba ni sems rnam par g-yo ba dang brtan pa ste /
translated: Steadiness and movement are the mind's movement and steadiness.

original: brtan pa las ni dge ba'i mtshan ma shes par byas la /
analyzed: brtan pa las ni dge ba'i mtshan ma shes par byas la /
translated: From steadiness, one should recognize the sign of virtue.

original: g-yo ba las ni sdig pa'i mtshan mar ro //
analyzed: g-yo ba las ni sdig pa'i mtshan mar ro //
translated: From movement, one should recognize the sign of non-virtue.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: For that very reason, it is said:

original: gnyis po gnyis su brjod pa yin //
analyzed: gnyis po gnyis su brjod pa yin //
translated: The two are expressed as two.

original: zhes so // rkyang pa dang ni sbyar ba ste //
analyzed: zhes so // rkyang pa dang ni sbyar ba ste //
translated: The short and the joined.

original: zhes bya ba la rkyang pa ni thung du ngo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la rkyang pa ni thung du ngo //
translated: The short is the short vowel.

original: sbyar ba ni ring po ste de nyid ni yang ba dang lci ba zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: sbyar ba ni ring po ste de nyid ni yang ba dang lci ba zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: The joined is the long vowel, which is also called light and heavy.

original: rgyal dang pham zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rgyal dang pham zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Victory and defeat.

original: shis pa dang mi shis pa ste /
analyzed: shis pa dang mi shis pa ste /
translated: Auspicious and inauspicious.

original: thung du ni shis la /
analyzed: thung du ni shis la /
translated: The short is auspicious.

original: ring po ni mi shis pa'o //
analyzed: ring po ni mi shis pa'o //
translated: The long is inauspicious.

original: de dag gis bsdus pa'o don ni aa la sogs pa'i yi ge bcu gnyis dang ldan pa'i re'u mig bcu gnyis pa'i 'khor lo la me tog la sogs pa bor ba las thung ngu rnams ni shis la ring po rnams ni mi shis pa'o zhes bya ba ni
analyzed: de dag gis bsdus pa'o don ni aa la sogs pa'i yi ge bcu gnyis dang ldan pa'i re'u mig bcu gnyis pa'i 'khor lo la me tog la sogs pa bor ba las thung ngu rnams ni shis la ring po rnams ni mi shis pa'o zhes bya ba ni
translated: The meaning is: “The short vowels are auspicious, and the long vowels are inauspicious, from the flower-casting, etc., on the wheel of the twelve houses endowed with the twelve vowels a, etc.”

original: 'di yin no //
analyzed: 'di yin no //
translated: This is it.

original: khyad par rnams ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: khyad par rnams ni bshad zin to //
translated: The distinctions have been explained.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: gnyis po steng ni rgyal ba ste //
analyzed: gnyis po steng ni rgyal ba ste //
translated: The upper one is the victor,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la steng ni thung du'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la steng ni thung du'o //
translated: etc. The upper one is the short one.

original: 'og ni ring ba'o //
analyzed: 'og ni ring ba'o //
translated: The lower one is the long one.

original: 'chi ba ni nye bar mtshon pa'o //
analyzed: 'chi ba ni nye bar mtshon pa'o //
translated: Death is indicated.

original: yang r'a si la sogs pa rnams nyi ma dang zla ba'i bye brag gis rgyu ba'i dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang r'a si la sogs pa rnams nyi ma dang zla ba'i bye brag gis rgyu ba'i dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Again, in order to teach the classification of the movements of the Rāśis, etc., by the distinctions of the sun and moon,

original: nyi ma'i rgyu ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: nyi ma'i rgyu ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “The movement of the sun,” etc.

original: nyi ma'i rgyu ba ni nyi ma'i 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: nyi ma'i rgyu ba ni nyi ma'i 'gro ba'o //
translated: The movement of the sun is the movement of the sun.

original: nyi ma la ni gnas te 'char //
analyzed: nyi ma la ni gnas te 'char //
translated: Dwelling in the sun, it rises.

original: zhes bya ba ni nyi ma'i rgyu bas gza' la sogs pa'i rgyu ba dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni nyi ma'i rgyu bas gza' la sogs pa'i rgyu ba dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: This is the control of the movements of the planets, etc. by the movement of the sun.

original: r'a si rgyu ba gsum du 'dod //
analyzed: r'a si rgyu ba gsum du 'dod //
translated: The movement of the Rasis is considered to be threefold.

original: ces bya ba la gsum ni gza' dang skar ma dang sbyar ba ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba la gsum ni gza' dang skar ma dang sbyar ba ste /
translated: The three are the planets, the stars, and the combinations.

original: de dag rgyu ba r'a si dbugs kyi rgyu ba dang rim pa bzhin du sbyar ba'o ;
analyzed: de dag rgyu ba r'a si dbugs kyi rgyu ba dang rim pa bzhin du sbyar ba'o ;
translated: Their movements are the movements of the Rasis, the breaths, and the series.

original: / de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: / de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: dbugs rgyu ba dang yang dag ldan //
analyzed: dbugs rgyu ba dang yang dag ldan //
translated: In union with the movement of the breath.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: And so on.

original: de la dbugs rgyu ba ni sna sgo'i dbugs phyi nang du gtul ba'o //
analyzed: de la dbugs rgyu ba ni sna sgo'i dbugs phyi nang du gtul ba'o //
translated: Therein, the movement of the breath is the exhalation and inhalation of breath through the nostrils.

original: thams cad ces bya ba ni gza' dang skar ma dang sbyor ba rnams kyi dbugs rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba ni gza' dang skar ma dang sbyor ba rnams kyi dbugs rgyu ba'o //
translated: All refers to the movement of the breath of the planets, stars, and combinations.

original: r'a si shes par bya ba zhes bya @145a * //
analyzed: r'a si shes par bya ba zhes bya @145a * //
translated: The Rasis are to be known.

original: ba ni / r'a si dbugs kyi ngo bor shes par bya'o //
analyzed: ba ni / r'a si dbugs kyi ngo bor shes par bya'o //
translated: The Rasis are to be known as the essence of the breath.

original: zla ba'i rgyu ba la r'a si rgyu ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: zla ba'i rgyu ba la r'a si rgyu ba gsungs pa /
translated: The movement of the Rasis in the movement of the moon is stated:

original: ka rka ta zhes bya ba la sogs pa la glang po'i dgra zhes bya ba ni seng ge'o //
analyzed: ka rka ta zhes bya ba la sogs pa la glang po'i dgra zhes bya ba ni seng ge'o //
translated: In Karkaṭa and so on. The enemy of the elephant is the lion.

original: cha shas drug ces bya ba ni zla ba'i cha shas drug go //
analyzed: cha shas drug ces bya ba ni zla ba'i cha shas drug go //
translated: The six parts are the six parts of the moon.

original: gza' yis bskul nas 'char bar 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba ni ;
analyzed: gza' yis bskul nas 'char bar 'gyur // zhes bya ba ni ;
translated: The moon rises when urged by the planets.

original: gza' zla ba dang yang dag par ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gza' zla ba dang yang dag par ldan pa'o //
translated: The moon is in conjunction with the planet moon.

original: chu skyes zhes bya ba ni chu srin no //
analyzed: chu skyes zhes bya ba ni chu srin no //
translated: The water-born is the crocodile.

original: zung du sprod pa zhes bya ba ni 'khrig pa'o //
analyzed: zung du sprod pa zhes bya ba ni 'khrig pa'o //
translated: The coupling is the copulation.

original: cha shas lnga dang bzhi zhes bya ba yang zla ba yin te /
analyzed: cha shas lnga dang bzhi zhes bya ba yang zla ba yin te /
translated: The five and four parts are the moon.

original: de ltar na zla ba'i ri mo gsal ba cha shas bco lnga dang / r'a si bcu gnyis rgyu ba sbyar ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na zla ba'i ri mo gsal ba cha shas bco lnga dang / r'a si bcu gnyis rgyu ba sbyar ba yin no //
translated: Thus the clear figure of the moon is fifteen parts, and the twelve signs are the movement.

original: de la nyi ma'i rgyu ba ni zla ba mar ngo'o //
analyzed: de la nyi ma'i rgyu ba ni zla ba mar ngo'o //
translated: The movement of the sun is the waning fortnight.

original: zla ba'i rgyu ba ni yar ngo'o //
analyzed: zla ba'i rgyu ba ni yar ngo'o //
translated: The movement of the moon is the waxing fortnight.

original: de bzhin du dbugs phyir rgyu ba ni nyi ma'i rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dbugs phyir rgyu ba ni nyi ma'i rgyu ba'o //
translated: Similarly, the exhalation is the movement of the sun.

original: nang du 'jug pa ni zla ba'i rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: nang du 'jug pa ni zla ba'i rgyu ba'o //
translated: The inhalation is the movement of the moon.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: snga ma bzhin du 'char bar 'gyur //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du 'char bar 'gyur //
translated: It rises as before.

original: zhes so // da ni gza' la sogs pa 'char ba'i bltas brtsi ba gsungs pa slar yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes so // da ni gza' la sogs pa 'char ba'i bltas brtsi ba gsungs pa slar yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Now, the calculation of the observation of the rising of the planets, etc. is stated:

original: 'bras bu'i ming dang ldan par bya //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i ming dang ldan par bya // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Again, the name of the fruit should be taken.

original: 'bras bu'am me tog gi ming gdon zhing gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu'am me tog gi ming gdon zhing gzung bar bya ste /
translated: The name of the fruit or flower should be uttered and taken.

original: 'bras bu dang me tog gi ming gi yi ge dang / bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa po'i ming gi yi ge rnams gal te sde tshan gcig tu gyur na /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang me tog gi ming gi yi ge dang / bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa po'i ming gi yi ge rnams gal te sde tshan gcig tu gyur na /
translated: If the letters of the name of the fruit or flower and the letters of the name of the one to be accomplished and the name of the practitioner are in the same group,

original: de'i tshe mtshan ma dge ba yin la /
analyzed: de'i tshe mtshan ma dge ba yin la /
translated: at that time, the sign is virtuous.

original: gzhan du na de las bzlog par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan du na de las bzlog par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Otherwise, it should be seen as the opposite of that.

original: yang rnam pa gzhan gsungs pa /
analyzed: yang rnam pa gzhan gsungs pa /
translated: Again, another aspect is stated:

original: ltas chen 'byung ba mnyan par bya //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ltas chen 'byung ba mnyan par bya // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The arising of great omens should be listened to.

original: nag mo dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: nag mo dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: The black one, etc. is easy to understand.

original: nyi shu rtsa bzhi zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa ltar zla ba gcig la tshes nyi shu rtsa bzhir phye ba'i ming gis lha mo nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i ming gzung zhing brtsi ba'o //
analyzed: nyi shu rtsa bzhi zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa ltar zla ba gcig la tshes nyi shu rtsa bzhir phye ba'i ming gis lha mo nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i ming gzung zhing brtsi ba'o //
translated: The twenty-four are the names of the twenty-four goddesses, which are counted by the names of the twenty-four lunar days in one month, as previously explained.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: For that very reason it is said:

original: nyis 'gyur du ni byas nas su //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: nyis 'gyur du ni byas nas su // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Having doubled them, and so on.

original: nyis 'gyur ni gnyis su bsgyur te brtsi ba'o //
analyzed: nyis 'gyur ni gnyis su bsgyur te brtsi ba'o //
translated: Here doubled means counted as two.

original: ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: ci zhig ce na /
translated: What?

original: dbang po'i cha ste dbang po drug gnyis su bsgyur bas bcu gnyis yin no //
analyzed: dbang po'i cha ste dbang po drug gnyis su bsgyur bas bcu gnyis yin no //
translated: The parts of the sense faculties, that is, the six sense faculties, doubled are twelve.

original: de dag gis ni zla ba yar ngo mar ngo la nyi ma bcu gnyis bcu gnyis su ston pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gis ni zla ba yar ngo mar ngo la nyi ma bcu gnyis bcu gnyis su ston pa yin no //
translated: They show the twelve days of the waxing and waning moon.

original: ltas ni lhag ma bzung nas su //
analyzed: ltas ni lhag ma bzung nas su //
translated: The sign is taken as the remainder.

original: zhes bya ba ni ri mo tha ma ma mo gang gi ming yin pa des brtsi ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ri mo tha ma ma mo gang gi ming yin pa des brtsi ba ste /
translated: That is, the last line is counted by the name of the mother.

original: de dag gi don ni 'di ltar thod le kor la rkang pa brgyad pa la sogs @145b pa'i sngags mngon par bzlas nas der sngar bstan pa ltar glang gi gcin rjes lta bu'i ri mo ci tsam sems kyis 'dod par bris la /
analyzed: de dag gi don ni 'di ltar thod le kor la rkang pa brgyad pa la sogs @145b pa'i sngags mngon par bzlas nas der sngar bstan pa ltar glang gi gcin rjes lta bu'i ri mo ci tsam sems kyis 'dod par bris la /
translated: The meaning of these is as follows: Having recited the mantra of eight lines, etc. on a round mirror, one should draw as much as one wishes in one's mind, with the cow's urine and bezoar, etc. as previously taught, the lines like the footprints of an elephant.

original: de'i ri mo tha ma nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de'i ri mo tha ma nas brtsams te /
translated: Beginning from the last line,

original: ri mo 'bur ba rnams ni ri mo dang po'i bar du phyogs gcig brtsi bar bya ste /
analyzed: ri mo 'bur ba rnams ni ri mo dang po'i bar du phyogs gcig brtsi bar bya ste /
translated: one should count the raised lines in one direction up to the first line.

original: rtsis kyi tha ma ni ri mo'i dang po rnal 'byor ma gang la 'bab pa de'i skyon dang yon tan du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: rtsis kyi tha ma ni ri mo'i dang po rnal 'byor ma gang la 'bab pa de'i skyon dang yon tan du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: The last of the calculations is this: Whatever is the first line of the yoginis, that is the fault and the virtue.

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //🔽lus la gnas pa'i dbugs dang ni //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nye bar bsdu ba yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o // lus la gnas pa'i dbugs dang ni // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni nye bar bsdu ba yin no //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: 'di dag gis ni me tog dang / 'bras bu dang dbyangs la sogs pa'i ming gzung ba'i rtsis kyi so so'i 'bras bu rtogs pa brtan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag gis ni me tog dang / 'bras bu dang dbyangs la sogs pa'i ming gzung ba'i rtsis kyi so so'i 'bras bu rtogs pa brtan pa yin no //
translated: The summary is as follows: The calculation of the body, the calculation of the breath, the calculation of the voice, the calculation of the mind, the calculation of the elements, the calculation of the channels, the calculation of the syllables, the calculation of the seed, the calculation of the mantra, the calculation of the deity, the calculation of the mandala, the calculation of the maṇḍala palace, the calculation of the maṇḍala deities, the calculation of the maṇḍala wheels, the calculation of the maṇḍala wheels' deities, the calculation of the maṇḍala wheels' deities' faces, the calculation of the maṇḍala wheels' deities' hands, the calculation of the maṇḍala wheels' deities' implements, the calculation of the maṇḍala wheels' deities' colors, the calculation of the maṇḍala wheels' deities' hand implements, the calculation of the maṇḍala wheels' deities' hand implements' colors, the calculation of the maṇḍala wheels' deities' hand implements' implements, the calculation of the maṇḍala wheels' deities' hand implements' implements' colors, the calculation of the maṇḍala wheels' deities' hand implements' implements' implements, the calculation of the maṇḍala wheels' deities' hand implements' implements' implements' colors, the calculation of the maṇḍala wheels' deities' hand implements' implements' implements' implements, the calculation of the maṇḍala wheels' deities' hand implements' implements' implements' implements' colors, the calculation of the maṇḍala wheels' deities' hand implements' implements' implements' implements' implements, the calculation of the maṇḍala wheels' deities' hand implements' implements' implements' implements' implements' colors, the calculation of the maṇḍala wheels' deities' hand implements'

original: gza' rnams dang ltas kyi rgyu ba dang ming dang sde tshan gyi cho ga'i rim par phye ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gza' rnams dang ltas kyi rgyu ba dang ming dang sde tshan gyi cho ga'i rim par phye ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: The chapter is called The Movement of the Planets and the Constellations, Names and the Sequence of the Rituals of the Houses.

original: r'a si'i rgyu ba gang gis gza' dang ltas rnams rgyu ba de ni gza' dang ltas kyi rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: r'a si'i rgyu ba gang gis gza' dang ltas rnams rgyu ba de ni gza' dang ltas kyi rgyu ba'o //
translated: The movement of the planets and the constellations is that by which the planets and the constellations move.

original: ming zhes bya ba ni gsal bar byas pa'o //
analyzed: ming zhes bya ba ni gsal bar byas pa'o //
translated: Names means that which is made clear.

original: de ci zhig ce na sde tshan gyi chog ste ;
analyzed: de ci zhig ce na sde tshan gyi chog ste ;
translated: What is that? It is the rituals of the houses.

original: dgu ste rnam pa lngar byas pa'o //
analyzed: dgu ste rnam pa lngar byas pa'o //
translated: There are nine, made into five types.

original: de ston pa'i gzhung ni rim par phye ba ste nyi shu rtsa bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: de ston pa'i gzhung ni rim par phye ba ste nyi shu rtsa bzhi pa'o //
translated: The text that teaches that is the sequence, the twenty-fourth.

original: rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po dpal rdo rje mkha' 'gro'i rnam par bshad pa las le'u nyi shu rtsa bzhi pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
analyzed: rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po dpal rdo rje mkha' 'gro'i rnam par bshad pa las le'u nyi shu rtsa bzhi pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
translated: This completes the explanation of the twenty-fourth chapter in the commentary on the glorious Vajradaka, the great king of tantras.

original: // / da ni rgyu skar dang gza' rnams 'char ba'i le'u gsungs pa /
analyzed: // / da ni rgyu skar dang gza' rnams 'char ba'i le'u gsungs pa /
translated: Now, the chapter on the rising of the stars and planets is stated:

original: da ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: da ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Now, etc.

original: nyi ma rgyu ba zhes bya ba ni gza' nyi ma rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: nyi ma rgyu ba zhes bya ba ni gza' nyi ma rgyu ba'o //
translated: The movement of the sun means the movement of the planet Sun.

original: nyin mo ni zhes bya ba ni tshes rnams la'o //
analyzed: nyin mo ni zhes bya ba ni tshes rnams la'o //
translated: Day means the lunar days.

original: thun phyed lnga dang bdun pa la //
analyzed: thun phyed lnga dang bdun pa la //
translated: In the fifth and seventh half-watches,

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: means

original: nyin mo dang mtshan mo'i thun phyed pa brgyad brgyad du gnas pa las /
analyzed: nyin mo dang mtshan mo'i thun phyed pa brgyad brgyad du gnas pa las /
translated: In the day and night, there are eight half-watches each.

original: thun phyed pa lnga pa dang bdun pa la gza' nyi ma rgyu ba de'i dus su bya ba ci yang mi 'grub po zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: thun phyed pa lnga pa dang bdun pa la gza' nyi ma rgyu ba de'i dus su bya ba ci yang mi 'grub po zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: In the fifth and seventh half-watches, the sun moves. At that time, nothing is accomplished.

original: bya ba mi 'grub cing 'joms par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bya ba mi 'grub cing 'joms par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: What is to be done is not accomplished and is destroyed. This is the meaning.

original: lnga zhes bya ba ni lnga pa ste /
analyzed: lnga zhes bya ba ni lnga pa ste /
translated: Five means the fifth.

original: pa'i sgra mi mngon par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: pa'i sgra mi mngon par byas pa yin no //
translated: The word “pa” is elided.

original: rtsis 'dis kun la bsgre bar bya'o //
analyzed: rtsis 'dis kun la bsgre bar bya'o //
translated: This calculation should be applied to all.🔽In the fourth and sixth of the moon,

original: zla ba yi ni bzhi dang drug / ces bya ba ni thun phyed pa bzhi pa dang drug pa ste /
analyzed: zla ba yi ni bzhi dang drug / ces bya ba ni thun phyed pa bzhi pa dang drug pa ste /
translated: means the fourth and sixth half-watches.

original: gza' zla ba'i rgyu ba de la gdong na mi za bar 'joms par 'gyur zhes bya ba dang sbyar te /
analyzed: gza' zla ba'i rgyu ba de la gdong na mi za bar 'joms par 'gyur zhes bya ba dang sbyar te /
translated: In the movement of the moon, it destroys the face. This is to be applied.

original: dus kyi rang bzhin can zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: dus kyi rang bzhin can zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: Up to the nature of time.

original: gsum pa dang lnga pa ni mig dmar gyi'o //
analyzed: gsum pa dang lnga pa ni mig dmar gyi'o //
translated: The third and fifth are of Mars.

original: gnyis pa dang bzhi pa ni gza' lhag gi'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa dang bzhi pa ni gza' lhag gi'o //
translated: The second and fourth are of Mercury.

original: bla ma zhes bya ba ni phur bu ste /🔽de'i ni dang po @146a * //
analyzed: bla ma zhes bya ba ni phur bu ste / de'i ni dang po @146a * //
translated: The preceptor is Jupiter.

original: dang gsum pa'o //
analyzed: dang gsum pa'o //
translated: His are the first and third.

original: ngan spang zhes bya ba ni pa ba sangs so //
analyzed: ngan spang zhes bya ba ni pa ba sangs so //
translated: The enemy is Saturn.

original: de'i ni gnyis pa dang bdun pa ste /
analyzed: de'i ni gnyis pa dang bdun pa ste /
translated: His are the second and seventh.

original: shes par bya zhes bya ba dang 'chi ba nyid du zhes bya ba ni lhag ma yin no //
analyzed: shes par bya zhes bya ba dang 'chi ba nyid du zhes bya ba ni lhag ma yin no //
translated: The one to be known and the one to die are the remainder.

original: dang po dang drug pa ni ngal ba'i ste ngal ba ni spen pa'o //
analyzed: dang po dang drug pa ni ngal ba'i ste ngal ba ni spen pa'o //
translated: The first and sixth are of Rahu.

original: de dag las bzlog pa'i thun phyed pa rnams ni bya ba rnams la ni shis pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag las bzlog pa'i thun phyed pa rnams ni bya ba rnams la ni shis pa yin no //
translated: The half-periods that are the reverse of these are auspicious for actions.

original: kha cig ni skye ba'i dus su gza' de rnams la skyes pa de rnams kyi 'chi ba'i dus bstan pa yin no //🔽zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig ni skye ba'i dus su gza' de rnams la skyes pa de rnams kyi 'chi ba'i dus bstan pa yin no // zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say that these are the times of death of those born under those planets.

original: rigs 'char ba zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba'i dus la bab pa'o //
analyzed: rigs 'char ba zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba'i dus la bab pa'o //
translated: The rising of the family is the time of death.

original: de dag gi dus ni yongs su 'chad par bstan zhes bya ba la de dag ni gza' de rnams te /
analyzed: de dag gi dus ni yongs su 'chad par bstan zhes bya ba la de dag ni gza' de rnams te /
translated: The time of those is taught as the complete explanation. Those are the planets.

original: de rnams kyi 'char ba'i dus kyi yongs su 'chad pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi 'char ba'i dus kyi yongs su 'chad pa ste /
translated: The complete explanation of the time of their rising

original: nges pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: nges pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: is taught as the ascertainment.

original: de dag thun mong mchan nyid de //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag thun mong mchan nyid de // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Those are the common signs.

original: 'chi ba'i dus la sogs pa sngar bstan pa de dag rnal 'byor pa rnams dang / so so'i skye bo tha mal pa rnams kyi thun mong ba yin no //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i dus la sogs pa sngar bstan pa de dag rnal 'byor pa rnams dang / so so'i skye bo tha mal pa rnams kyi thun mong ba yin no //
translated: The common signs of death and so forth that were previously taught are common to both yogis and ordinary people.

original: rnal 'byor pa yi gzhan bshad nyon //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa yi gzhan bshad nyon //
translated: Listen to the explanation of the others of the yogis.

original: zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi thun mong ma yin pa'i 'chi ba'i dus kyi mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi thun mong ma yin pa'i 'chi ba'i dus kyi mtshan ma'o //
translated: The others of the yogis are the uncommon signs of the time of death.

original: de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: He says just that:

original: lnga nas nyi shu lnga'i bar 'di dag gi brjod bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: lnga nas nyi shu lnga'i bar 'di dag gi brjod bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: From five to twenty-five and so forth.

original: lnga nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di'i don sngar le'u nyi shu par nyi ma drug la sogs pa'i rlung phyin ci log tu rgyu ba'i dus bstan pa'i lhag mar gyur pa lnga pa dang bcu pa dang bco lnga pa dang nyi shu pa dang nyi shu🔽lnga'i bar du rnam pa lngar spel ba'i dus bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lnga nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di'i don sngar le'u nyi shu par nyi ma drug la sogs pa'i rlung phyin ci log tu rgyu ba'i dus bstan pa'i lhag mar gyur pa lnga pa dang bcu pa dang bco lnga pa dang nyi shu pa dang nyi shu lnga'i bar du rnam pa lngar spel ba'i dus bshad par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of five and so forth is that the time of the reversal of the winds in six days and so forth, which was taught in the twentieth chapter, is incomplete. The remainder, the fifth, tenth, fifteenth, twentieth, and twenty-fifth, should be explained as the time of the fivefold increase.🔽The meaning of five and so forth is that the time of the reversal of the winds in six days and so forth, which was taught in the twentieth chapter, is incomplete. The remainder, the fifth, tenth, fifteenth, twentieth, and twenty-fifth, should be explained as the time of the fivefold increase.🔽The meaning of five and so forth is that the time of the reversal of the winds in six days and so forth, which was taught in the twentieth chapter, is incomplete. The remainder, the fifth, tenth, fifteenth, twentieth, and twenty-fifth, should be explained as the time of the fivefold increase.🔽The meaning of five and so forth is that the time of the reversal of the winds in six days and so forth, which was taught in the twentieth chapter, is incomplete. The remainder, the fifth, tenth, fifteenth, twentieth, and twenty-fifth, should be explained as the time of the fivefold increase.🔽The meaning of five and so forth is that the time of the reversal of the winds in six days and so forth, which was taught in the twentieth chapter, is incomplete. The remainder, the fifth, tenth, fifteenth, twentieth, and twenty-fifth, should be explained as the time of the fivefold increase.

original: lnga zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di dag kyang /🔽pa'i sgra mi mngon par byas pa yin no //🔽de las bcu gsum gsum gyi bar du re re zhing spel bar bya zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lnga zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di dag kyang / pa'i sgra mi mngon par byas pa yin no // de las bcu gsum gsum gyi bar du re re zhing spel bar bya zhes bya ba la /
translated: The meaning of five and so forth is that the time of the reversal of the winds in six days and so forth, which was taught in the twentieth chapter, is incomplete. The remainder, the fifth, tenth, fifteenth, twentieth, and twenty-fifth, should be explained as the time of the fivefold increase.

original: de las zhes bya ba ni nyi shu rtsa lnga'i las gong du gyur pa'o //🔽bcu gsum zhes bya ba ni bcu phrag gsum ste sum cu'o //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni nyi shu rtsa lnga'i las gong du gyur pa'o // bcu gsum zhes bya ba ni bcu phrag gsum ste sum cu'o //
translated: The meaning of five and so forth is that the time of the reversal of the winds in six days and so forth, which was taught in the twentieth chapter, is incomplete. The remainder, the fifth, tenth, fifteenth, twentieth, and twenty-fifth, should be explained as the time of the fivefold increase.

original: gsum zhes bya ba ni grangs lcag pa gsum mo //
analyzed: gsum zhes bya ba ni grangs lcag pa gsum mo //
translated: The meaning of five and so forth is that the time of the reversal of the winds in six

original: re re spel zhes bya ba ni nyi ma nyi shu rtsa drug nas sum cu rtsa gsum gyi bar du re re zhing spel bar bya'o /
analyzed: re re spel zhes bya ba ni nyi ma nyi shu rtsa drug nas sum cu rtsa gsum gyi bar du re re zhing spel bar bya'o /
translated: One should increase each day from the twenty-sixth day to the thirty-third day.

original: snga ma ltar ni ma yin no //
analyzed: snga ma ltar ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not as before.

original: de ltar na nyi ma drug pa dang / bdun pa dang / brgyad pa dang / dgu pa dang / bcu pa dang / bcu gcig pa dang / bcu gnyis pa dang / bcu gsum pa dang / bcu bzhi pa dang / bco lnga pa dang /
analyzed: de ltar na nyi ma drug pa dang / bdun pa dang / brgyad pa dang / dgu pa dang / bcu pa dang / bcu gcig pa dang / bcu gnyis pa dang / bcu gsum pa dang / bcu bzhi pa dang / bco lnga pa dang /
translated: Thus, the sixth, seventh, eighth, ninth, tenth, eleventh, twelfth, thirteenth, fourteenth, fifteenth,

original: bcu drug pa dang / bcu bdun pa dang / bco brgyad @146b pa dang / bcu dgu pa dang / nyi shu rtsa gcig pa dang / rtsa gnyis pa dang / rtsa gsum pa dang / rtsa bzhi pa ste /
analyzed: bcu drug pa dang / bcu bdun pa dang / bco brgyad @146b pa dang / bcu dgu pa dang / nyi shu rtsa gcig pa dang / rtsa gnyis pa dang / rtsa gsum pa dang / rtsa bzhi pa ste /
translated: sixteenth, seventeenth, eighteenth, nineteenth, twenty-first, twenty-second, twenty-third, and twenty-fourth days

original: bar bar gyi nyi ma rnams ma gtogs pa lnga nas nyi shu lnga'i bar du lnga lngar spel ba'i tshig rnams dang nyi shu rtsa drug la sogs par spel nas brjod par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bar bar gyi nyi ma rnams ma gtogs pa lnga nas nyi shu lnga'i bar du lnga lngar spel ba'i tshig rnams dang nyi shu rtsa drug la sogs par spel nas brjod par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: are increased by five from the fifth to the twenty-fifth day, except for the intermediate days. The meaning is that one should recite after increasing on the twenty-sixth day and so on.

original: dgun zla tha chungs nyi ma la /
analyzed: dgun zla tha chungs nyi ma la /
translated: On the last day of winter

original: mtshungs gsum mig gi zla ba drug / ces bya ba la /
analyzed: mtshungs gsum mig gi zla ba drug / ces bya ba la /
translated: The three equalings and the six months of the eye.

original: dgun zla tha chungs nyi ma la //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dgun zla tha chungs nyi ma la // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The last winter month is the sun.

original: snga dro'i chu tshod gsum la ste /
analyzed: snga dro'i chu tshod gsum la ste /
translated: This means that the sun moves three hours earlier each day.

original: 'phel ba'i cha shas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'phel ba'i cha shas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the term “part of increase.”

original: mtshungs zhes bya ba ni sngar nyi ma drug la sogs pa bor ba la 'phel ba'i dus su brtsi ba ltar 'dir yang brtsi bar bya /
analyzed: mtshungs zhes bya ba ni sngar nyi ma drug la sogs pa bor ba la 'phel ba'i dus su brtsi ba ltar 'dir yang brtsi bar bya /
translated: The term “equal” means that the calculation is done in the same way as the calculation of the time of increase, subtracting six days, etc.

original: kha cig ni mtshungs zhes bya ba ni rlung phyin ci log tu rgyu ba'i bye brag gis lo la sogs pa bri ba ste /
analyzed: kha cig ni mtshungs zhes bya ba ni rlung phyin ci log tu rgyu ba'i bye brag gis lo la sogs pa bri ba ste /
translated: Some say that the term “equal” means that the years, etc. are subtracted by the specific movement of the wind in the opposite direction.

original: mthun par spel zhing dbri bar bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: mthun par spel zhing dbri bar bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: They say that the years, etc. should be added or subtracted in accordance with the movement of the wind.

original: mig ces bya ba ni gnyis so //
analyzed: mig ces bya ba ni gnyis so //
translated: The term “eye” means two.

original: zla ba zhes bya ba ni gcig ste /
analyzed: zla ba zhes bya ba ni gcig ste /
translated: The term “moon” means one.

original: de ltar na nyi ma lnga dang bcu dang bco lnga'i rlung bzlog ste rgyu ba na lo gsum dang gnyis dang gcig tu 'tsho ba'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ltar na nyi ma lnga dang bcu dang bco lnga'i rlung bzlog ste rgyu ba na lo gsum dang gnyis dang gcig tu 'tsho ba'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Thus, when the wind moves in the opposite direction for five, ten, or fifteen days, it is said that one lives for three, two, or one year.

original: gsum zung zla ste zla lhag ches phyogs mda' yon tan thig le zhes bya ba la zung ni gnyis so //
analyzed: gsum zung zla ste zla lhag ches phyogs mda' yon tan thig le zhes bya ba la zung ni gnyis so //
translated: The three pairs are the six months, the three months, the two months, and the one month.🔽What is a pair?🔽It is two.

original: zla ba ni gcig ste ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: zla ba ni gcig ste ci zhig ce na /
translated: What is a month?

original: zla ba'i grangs so //
analyzed: zla ba'i grangs so //
translated: It is a lunar day.

original: des na zhag nyi shu pa dang / nyi shu lnga pa dang / drug pa dang / bdun pa'i bar du phyin ci log tu rgyu ba na zla ba drug dang / gsum dang / gnyis dang / gcig tu 'tsho ba'o //
analyzed: des na zhag nyi shu pa dang / nyi shu lnga pa dang / drug pa dang / bdun pa'i bar du phyin ci log tu rgyu ba na zla ba drug dang / gsum dang / gnyis dang / gcig tu 'tsho ba'o //
translated: Thus, when the winds move in the opposite direction for twenty days, twenty-five days, thirty days, and thirty-five days, one lives for six months, three months, two months, and one month, respectively.

original: lhag ces bya ba ni lhag ma ste lhag ma ni zhag grangs so //
analyzed: lhag ces bya ba ni lhag ma ste lhag ma ni zhag grangs so //
translated: The remainder is the remaining lunar days.

original: yang na nyi ma nyi shu brgyad pa la sogs par rlung phyin ci log tu rgyu ba ni lhag ma ste de dag gi 'tsho ba'i dus ni tshes la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yang na nyi ma nyi shu brgyad pa la sogs par rlung phyin ci log tu rgyu ba ni lhag ma ste de dag gi 'tsho ba'i dus ni tshes la sogs pa'o //
translated: Or, the remainder is the twenty-eight days, etc., when the winds move in the opposite direction. The time of life for those is the lunar days, etc.

original: tshes ni zhag bco lnga'o //
analyzed: tshes ni zhag bco lnga'o //
translated: The lunar days are the fifteen days.

original: phyogs ni bcu'o //
analyzed: phyogs ni bcu'o //
translated: The directions are the ten directions.

original: mda' ni lnga'o //
analyzed: mda' ni lnga'o //
translated: The arrows are the five arrows.

original: yon tan ni snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa ste gsum mo //
analyzed: yon tan ni snying stobs dang rdul dang mun pa ste gsum mo //
translated: The qualities are the three: sattva, rajas, and tamas.

original: theg le ni nyi ma gnyis dang yang gcig go //
analyzed: theg le ni nyi ma gnyis dang yang gcig go //
translated: The circles are the two suns and one more.

original: bar bar gyi nyi ma mdo tsam du bstan pa'i phyir lnga las bcu'i bar dang / de bzhin du bcu las ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bar bar gyi nyi ma mdo tsam du bstan pa'i phyir lnga las bcu'i bar dang / de bzhin du bcu las ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to show the sun days in between, he says, “from five up to ten,” and so on.

original: lnga nas bcu'i bar zhes bya ba ni sbyar bar bya zhes bya ba dang sbyar te /
analyzed: lnga nas bcu'i bar zhes bya ba ni sbyar bar bya zhes bya ba dang sbyar te /
translated: “From five up to ten” should be connected with “should be applied.”

original: sngar bshad pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni lhag ma yin no //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni lhag ma yin no //
translated: “As explained before” is the remainder.

original: de la lnga nas bcu'i bar zhes bya ba ni nyi ma drug pa dang bdun pa dang / brgyad pa dang dgu pa rnams so //
analyzed: de la lnga nas bcu'i bar zhes bya ba ni nyi ma drug pa dang bdun pa dang / brgyad pa dang dgu pa rnams so //
translated: Therein, “from five up to ten” are the sixth, seventh, eighth, and ninth days.

original: bcu nas bco lnga'i bar zhes bya ba ni de bzhin du bcu gcig pa dang bcu gnyis pa dang / bcu gsum pa dang / bcu @147a * //
analyzed: bcu nas bco lnga'i bar zhes bya ba ni de bzhin du bcu gcig pa dang bcu gnyis pa dang / bcu gsum pa dang / bcu @147a * //
translated: “From ten up to fifteen” are the eleventh, twelfth, thirteenth, and fourteenth days.

original: bzhi pa rnams te de ltar lhag ma rnams kyang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa rnams te de ltar lhag ma rnams kyang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, the remainder should be applied in the same way.

original: zla ba'i gnas skabs gsungs pa /
analyzed: zla ba'i gnas skabs gsungs pa /
translated: The lunar phases are stated:

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste sgrub pa pos shes par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste sgrub pa pos shes par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: “Then,” and so on. In order to be understood by the practitioner,

original: bshad par bya zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: bshad par bya zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: “should be explained” is connected.

original: ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: ci zhig ce na /
translated: What is it?

original: gnas skabs thams cad du 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: gnas skabs thams cad du 'gyur ba ste /
translated: It is the change in all conditions.

original: zla ba'i zhes bya ba 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: zla ba'i zhes bya ba 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: The word “moon” is connected with the word “counted” that will come later.

original: dang po skar ma bgrang bar bya //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dang po skar ma bgrang bar bya // zhes bya ba la /
translated: First, count the stars.

original: dang po zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i dus kyi'o //
analyzed: dang po zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i dus kyi'o //
translated: Here, “first” refers to the time of birth.

original: skar ma bgrang bar bya zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: skar ma bgrang bar bya zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Count the stars” means

original: de'i dus kyi skar ma gang la zla ba gnas pa'i rtsis byas la /
analyzed: de'i dus kyi skar ma gang la zla ba gnas pa'i rtsis byas la /
translated: that one should calculate which star the moon is in at that time,

original: zla ba de'i chu tshod dag gi grangs ji snyed pa de snyed kyi ri mo bri ba'o //🔽nyi ma yi ni chu tshod dag ces bya ba ni zhag gang las skyes pa'i dus nas bzung ste /
analyzed: zla ba de'i chu tshod dag gi grangs ji snyed pa de snyed kyi ri mo bri ba'o // nyi ma yi ni chu tshod dag ces bya ba ni zhag gang las skyes pa'i dus nas bzung ste /
translated: and draw that many lines, equal to the number of hours of the moon.

original: zhag gi dang po'i bar du chu tshod ji snyed 'das pa de snyed kyi mtshan ma bri ba'o //🔽zla ba'i gnas skabs rgyu yi phyir //
analyzed: zhag gi dang po'i bar du chu tshod ji snyed 'das pa de snyed kyi mtshan ma bri ba'o // zla ba'i gnas skabs rgyu yi phyir //
translated: The “hours of the sun” means that one should draw that many signs, equal to the number of hours that have passed from the time of birth up to the first day.🔽For the sake of knowing the condition of the moon.

original: zhes bya ba ni zla ba'i gnas skabs kyi mtshan nyid rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni zla ba'i gnas skabs kyi mtshan nyid rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This means for the sake of understanding the characteristics of the condition of the moon.

original: yang na dang por zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang na dang por zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Or else, first means

original: thog ma nyid du ste thog ma nyid du zla ba'i chu tshod bris la /
analyzed: thog ma nyid du ste thog ma nyid du zla ba'i chu tshod bris la /
translated: at the beginning. At the beginning, one should draw the lunar hours.

original: de'i 'og tu nyi ma ji snyed 'das pa'i chu tshod kyi ri mo bri ba'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu nyi ma ji snyed 'das pa'i chu tshod kyi ri mo bri ba'o //
translated: Then, below that, one should draw the number of solar hours that have elapsed.

original: de ni drug cur bsgyur bar bya //
analyzed: de ni drug cur bsgyur bar bya //
translated: That is multiplied by sixty.

original: zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma gnyis kyi grangs ji snyed pa de drug cur 'gyur du spel ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma gnyis kyi grangs ji snyed pa de drug cur 'gyur du spel ba'o //
translated: The number of the two signs is multiplied by sixty.

original: slar yang nyi tshod zla ba bsnan //
analyzed: slar yang nyi tshod zla ba bsnan //
translated: Again, the solar hours are added to the moon.

original: zhes bya ba la nyi tshod dang zla ba ni rtsis byed pa'i dus kyi zla ba la chu tshod ji snyed yod pa dang de'i nyin mo zhag gi dang po'i bar du chu tshod ji snyed cig 'das pa'i mtshan ma de gnyis bsnan par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la nyi tshod dang zla ba ni rtsis byed pa'i dus kyi zla ba la chu tshod ji snyed yod pa dang de'i nyin mo zhag gi dang po'i bar du chu tshod ji snyed cig 'das pa'i mtshan ma de gnyis bsnan par bya'o //
translated: The solar hours and the lunar hours are the number of hours in the month of the calculation period and the number of hours that have elapsed in the first part of the day of that month. Those two signs are added.

original: drug cu ru ni bsgyur byas la //
analyzed: drug cu ru ni bsgyur byas la //
translated: That is divided by sixty.

original: zhes bya ba ni de dag thams cad gcig tu bzlums nas slar yang drug cu 'gyur du spel ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de dag thams cad gcig tu bzlums nas slar yang drug cu 'gyur du spel ba'o //
translated: All of that is combined and again multiplied by sixty.

original: mda' dang sred byed ro yi ni //
analyzed: mda' dang sred byed ro yi ni //
translated: The remainder is the number of hours.

original: dbang por bcas pa'i de bzhin bcad //
analyzed: dbang por bcas pa'i de bzhin bcad //
translated: together with the sense faculties.

original: ces bya ba ni de'i 'og tu slar dbri ba ston pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni de'i 'og tu slar dbri ba ston pa yin no //
translated: This shows the further reduction by nine.

original: de la mda' zhes bya ba ni lnga'o //
analyzed: de la mda' zhes bya ba ni lnga'o //
translated: Therein, the “arrows” are five.

original: sreg byed ni gsum mo //
analyzed: sreg byed ni gsum mo //
translated: The “burners” are three.

original: ro'i dbang po ni gcig ste /
analyzed: ro'i dbang po ni gcig ste /
translated: The “sense faculty of taste” is one.

original: de ltar na dang po grangs dgu dgur dbri ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar na dang po grangs dgu dgur dbri ba'o //
translated: Thus, the first reduction is by nine each.

original: bcu gnyis dag gi nang nas ni //
analyzed: bcu gnyis dag gi nang nas ni //
translated: From the twelve

original: zhes bya ba ni de'i 'og tu yang bcu gnyis bcu gnyis dbri ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de'i 'og tu yang bcu gnyis bcu gnyis dbri ba'o //
translated: This shows the further reduction by twelve each.

original: lhag ma'i cha shas gzung bar bya //
analyzed: lhag ma'i cha shas gzung bar bya //
translated: The remaining parts should be taken.

original: zhes bya ba ni de ltar bri ba las kyang /🔽gang zhig lhag par gyur pa'i cha shas tha ma gcig nas brtsams te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de ltar bri ba las kyang / gang zhig lhag par gyur pa'i cha shas tha ma gcig nas brtsams te /
translated: This shows that even from the reduction

original: bcu gnyis kyi par du lhag ma gang yin pa de bzung la brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: bcu gnyis kyi par du lhag ma gang yin pa de bzung la brtag par bya'o //
translated: one should take the remaining parts, beginning with the last one, up to the twelfth, and examine them.

original: nyin dang mtshan gyi sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni nyin mtshan gyi chu chod @147b ji snyed pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: nyin dang mtshan gyi sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni nyin mtshan gyi chu chod @147b ji snyed pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: The “application of day and night” is the number of day and night parts.

original: dang po zla ba rab gnas pa //
analyzed: dang po zla ba rab gnas pa //
translated: The first is the moon’s position.

original: zhes bya ba ni zla ba'i chu tshod de dag las lhag ma'i cha shas gal te grangs gcig lus par gyur pa de ni dang po'i zla ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni zla ba'i chu tshod de dag las lhag ma'i cha shas gal te grangs gcig lus par gyur pa de ni dang po'i zla ba'o //
translated: If one of the lunar hours remains of those lunar hours, that is the first lunar day.

original: de yi bya ba nyams par 'gyur //
analyzed: de yi bya ba nyams par 'gyur //
translated: Its activity is lost.

original: zhes bya ba ni zla ba'i chu tshod de'i bya ba rnams nyams shing mi 'grub la gnas skabs ngan par bgrang ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni zla ba'i chu tshod de'i bya ba rnams nyams shing mi 'grub la gnas skabs ngan par bgrang ba'o //
translated: The activity of that lunar hour is lost, not accomplished, and is counted as an inauspicious occasion.🔽The second is auspicious.

original: gnyis pa bkra shis pa ste zhes bya ba la gnyis pa ni lhag mar gyur pa'i cha shas kyi ri mo'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa bkra shis pa ste zhes bya ba la gnyis pa ni lhag mar gyur pa'i cha shas kyi ri mo'o //
translated: The second is the line of the remaining part.

original: gnyis shig lus pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis shig lus pa ste /
translated: Two remain.

original: de ni sgrub pa po la shis par byed pa'i phyir bkra shis yin no //
analyzed: de ni sgrub pa po la shis par byed pa'i phyir bkra shis yin no //
translated: That is auspicious because it makes the practitioner auspicious.

original: gsum pa 'chi ste gsod par 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gsum pa 'chi ste gsod par 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The third is death, that is, killing.

original: lhag ma ni cha shas gsum lus bsgrub pa po gsod cing 'chi bar 'gyur ba yin no //🔽bzhi pa dgod de tshim par byed //
analyzed: lhag ma ni cha shas gsum lus bsgrub pa po gsod cing 'chi bar 'gyur ba yin no // bzhi pa dgod de tshim par byed //
translated: The remaining three parts remain. The practitioner is killed and dies.🔽The fourth is laughter, that is, satisfaction.

original: ces bya ba la chu tshod bzhi'i ri mo lhag mas ni bzhi pa ston to /
analyzed: ces bya ba la chu tshod bzhi'i ri mo lhag mas ni bzhi pa ston to /
translated: The fourth is shown by the remaining part of four lunar hours.

original: des na dgod pa dang bcas shing tshim par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na dgod pa dang bcas shing tshim par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, it is said that one will laugh and be satisfied.

original: yang na rab gnas pa zhes bya ba dang / bkra shis zhes bya ba dang / 'chi byed ces bya ba dang / dgod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di dag ni zla ba bcu gnyis kyi ming yin te //
analyzed: yang na rab gnas pa zhes bya ba dang / bkra shis zhes bya ba dang / 'chi byed ces bya ba dang / dgod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di dag ni zla ba bcu gnyis kyi ming yin te //
translated: Or else, the terms “settled,” “auspicious,” “death-maker,” “laughter,” and so on are the names of the twelve months.

original: zla ba de dag nyid chu tshod kyi ri mo gcig dang / gnyis dang / gsum dang / bzhi la sogs pa'i lhag ma ma lus pa las skyid sdug gi gnas skabs ston pa yin no //🔽lug la sogs pa bstan pa yis //
analyzed: zla ba de dag nyid chu tshod kyi ri mo gcig dang / gnyis dang / gsum dang / bzhi la sogs pa'i lhag ma ma lus pa las skyid sdug gi gnas skabs ston pa yin no // lug la sogs pa bstan pa yis //
translated: Those very months, with the remaining one, two, three, four, and so on hours, indicate the state of happiness and suffering.🔽The months are to be known in order,

original: zla ba rim pa bzhin du rgyu //
analyzed: zla ba rim pa bzhin du rgyu //
translated: beginning with Aries and so on.

original: zhes bya ba ni zla ba de dag gi chu tshod kyi grangs ni lug la sogs pa'i r'a si chu tshod kyi grangs kyis shes par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni zla ba de dag gi chu tshod kyi grangs ni lug la sogs pa'i r'a si chu tshod kyi grangs kyis shes par bya'o //
translated: The number of hours of those months is to be known by the number of hours of the zodiac sign of Aries and so on.

original: thams cad rgyu ba'i rim par phye ba zhes bya ba la thams cad ni gza' dang zla ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad rgyu ba'i rim par phye ba zhes bya ba la thams cad ni gza' dang zla ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The division of the order of the movement of all is called “all.” All refers to the planets, the moon, and so on.

original: de rnams kyi rgyu ba ni 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi rgyu ba ni 'byung ba'o //
translated: Their movement is the arising.

original: gzhung gang las thams cad kyi 'byung ba ston pa de ni rim par phye ba ste nyi shu rtsa lnga pa'o //
analyzed: gzhung gang las thams cad kyi 'byung ba ston pa de ni rim par phye ba ste nyi shu rtsa lnga pa'o //
translated: The text that teaches the arising of all of them is the twenty-fifth chapter.

original: rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po dpal rdo rje mkha' 'gro'i rnam par bshad pa las le'u nyi shu rtsa lnga pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
analyzed: rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po dpal rdo rje mkha' 'gro'i rnam par bshad pa las le'u nyi shu rtsa lnga pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
translated: This concludes the explanation of the twenty-fifth chapter of the glorious Vajradaka-maha-tantra.

original: // / da ni dus rnams kyi rang bzhin gsal bar bya ba'i phyir //🔽de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: // / da ni dus rnams kyi rang bzhin gsal bar bya ba'i phyir // de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, in order to clarify the nature of the times,🔽it is said:

original: mchod cing zhes bya ba ni gar la sogs pa'i mchod pa'o //🔽sgang gshong 'khor lo zhes bya ba ni dbugs kyi 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: mchod cing zhes bya ba ni gar la sogs pa'i mchod pa'o // sgang gshong 'khor lo zhes bya ba ni dbugs kyi 'khor lo'o //
translated: Then, having worshipped with dance and so forth,🔽the wheel of the valleys and peaks,

original: de rnams zhes bya ba ni dbugs rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de rnams zhes bya ba ni dbugs rnams kyi'o //
translated: the wheel of the breath,

original: dus kyi grangs ni ji bzhin gsungs //
analyzed: dus kyi grangs ni ji bzhin gsungs //
translated: the number of times is taught just as it is.

original: zhes bya ba la /🔽dus ni mig btsums pa la sogs pa'o //🔽rgyu ba yi ni khyad par dag / ces bya ba ni dus @148a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la / dus ni mig btsums pa la sogs pa'o // rgyu ba yi ni khyad par dag / ces bya ba ni dus @148a * //
translated: Here,🔽the times are the closing of the eyes and so forth.🔽The special movements

original: rnams 'char ba'i bye brag go //
analyzed: rnams 'char ba'i bye brag go //
translated: are the arising of the times.

original: dus kyi bgrang ba lus med cing //
analyzed: dus kyi bgrang ba lus med cing //
translated: Time is not a body.

original: zhes bya ba la dus zhes bya ba ni dngos po rnams kyi gnas skabs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la dus zhes bya ba ni dngos po rnams kyi gnas skabs so //
translated: Here, time is the state of things.

original: bgrang ba zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs kyi khyad par te /
analyzed: bgrang ba zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs kyi khyad par te /
translated: Counting is the particular state,

original: skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'chi ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'chi ba'o //
translated: birth, abiding, and death.

original: lus med pa zhes bya ba ni de dag lus can las gud du mig la sogs pas mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus med pa zhes bya ba ni de dag lus can las gud du mig la sogs pas mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said that time is not a body because it is not perceived by the eye, etc. as something that has a body.

original: yang na bgrang ba ni dngos po rnams kyi gnas skabs yin la /
analyzed: yang na bgrang ba ni dngos po rnams kyi gnas skabs yin la /
translated: Alternatively, counting is the state of things.

original: dus zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa nyid yin te 'chi bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dus zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa nyid yin te 'chi bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Time is impermanence, that is, death.

original: de ltar yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar yang gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: mda' ni brgya snyed bsnun gyur kyang /
analyzed: mda' ni brgya snyed bsnun gyur kyang /
translated: Even if one is struck hundreds of times by arrows,

original: dus lam bab 'chi mi 'gyur //🔽rtsva rtse reg pa tsam gyis kyang //
analyzed: dus lam bab 'chi mi 'gyur // rtsva rtse reg pa tsam gyis kyang //
translated: one does not die if the time has not come.

original: dus la bab na 'chi bar 'gyur //
analyzed: dus la bab na 'chi bar 'gyur //
translated: But if the time has come, one dies🔽even if touched by the tip of a blade of grass.

original: zhes so // dus la bab pa de yang gnas pa'i mthun pa'i rkyen zad pa dang / 'gal ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas pa las so //
analyzed: zhes so // dus la bab pa de yang gnas pa'i mthun pa'i rkyen zad pa dang / 'gal ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas pa las so //
translated: Moreover, the coming of the time is due to the exhaustion of the favorable conditions for abiding and the presence of unfavorable conditions.

original: 'gal ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas pas kyang mthun pa'i rgyu la gnod par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'gal ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas pas kyang mthun pa'i rgyu la gnod par byed pa yin te /
translated: Also, adverse conditions that are present harm the concordant cause.

original: yang dag par na rgyu zad pa nyid kyis 'chi bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par na rgyu zad pa nyid kyis 'chi bar shes par bya'o //
translated: In reality, death should be understood as the exhaustion of the cause.

original: de yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de yang gsungs pa /
translated: Moreover, it is said:

original: rgyu zad pa yis shi ba ni //
analyzed: rgyu zad pa yis shi ba ni //
translated: Death by exhaustion of the cause

original: zad ces bya bar brjod pa ste /
analyzed: zad ces bya bar brjod pa ste /
translated: is called “exhaustion.”

original: rang bzhin gyis ni gang ma zad //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis ni gang ma zad //
translated: If something is not exhausted by nature,

original: de yi zad pa ji ltar brjod //
analyzed: de yi zad pa ji ltar brjod //
translated: how can its exhaustion be described?

original: ces so // de la mthun pa'i rgyu ni mthun pa'i kha zas la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ces so // de la mthun pa'i rgyu ni mthun pa'i kha zas la sogs pa'o //
translated: Therein, concordant causes are concordant food and so on.

original: mi mthun pa'i rkyen nye bar gnas pa ni rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan dang / 'du ba la sogs pa'i phyi nang gi nad gzhi 'khrugs pa dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi srog 'joms par byed pa'i rtsol bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i rkyen nye bar gnas pa ni rlung dang mkhris pa dang bad kan dang / 'du ba la sogs pa'i phyi nang gi nad gzhi 'khrugs pa dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi srog 'joms par byed pa'i rtsol bar byed pa'o //
translated: Adverse conditions that are present are the disturbance of outer and inner diseases such as wind, bile, and phlegm, and the exertion of those that destroy the life of self and others.

original: de la rang gi rtsol ba ni 'gegs pa dang / me dang chur mchong ba dang dug za ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la rang gi rtsol ba ni 'gegs pa dang / me dang chur mchong ba dang dug za ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Therein, one’s own exertion is blocking, jumping into fire or water, eating poison, and so on.

original: gzhan gyi rtsol ba ni stag dang sprul la sogs pa'i sems can gyi gnod pa dang / phyi rol gyi mtshon cha la sogs pas bcom pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rtsol ba ni stag dang sprul la sogs pa'i sems can gyi gnod pa dang / phyi rol gyi mtshon cha la sogs pas bcom pa'o //
translated: The effort of others is the destruction by the harm of beings such as tigers and snakes, and by external weapons and so forth.

original: de dag gis 'tsho ba'i nye bar len pa'i rgyu la gnod par byas pa mar zad pa'i mar me bzhin du 'chi bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gis 'tsho ba'i nye bar len pa'i rgyu la gnod par byas pa mar zad pa'i mar me bzhin du 'chi bar shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that they die like a lamp whose oil is exhausted, having been harmed in the cause of appropriating life.

original: de yang 'chi ba zhes bya ba ni srog chags rnams kyi rgyun mi rtag pa bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang 'chi ba zhes bya ba ni srog chags rnams kyi rgyun mi rtag pa bstan pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, what is called “death” is the teaching of the impermanence of living beings.

original: gzhan du 'dus byas thams cad la khyab par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan du 'dus byas thams cad la khyab par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that it pervades all conditioned things,🔽it is said:

original: thams cad du ni thams cad gnas //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: thams cad du ni thams cad gnas // zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “It abides everywhere.”

original: nam mkha' khyab pa thams cad du dus kun du gnas pa'o //🔽dngos po kun la khyab pa ste //
analyzed: nam mkha' khyab pa thams cad du dus kun du gnas pa'o // dngos po kun la khyab pa ste //
translated: It abides everywhere, pervading space, at all times.🔽It pervades all things.

original: zhes bya ba ni rdzas thams cad la khyab pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rdzas thams cad la khyab pa ste /
translated: It pervades all substances.

original: 'di ltar shing bu @148b dang bum pa la sogs pa rnams la ni byung zhing /
analyzed: 'di ltar shing bu @148b dang bum pa la sogs pa rnams la ni byung zhing /
translated: Thus, it arises in sticks and pots, etc.

original: byung nas kyang rgyun mi rtag cing 'jig par mngon sum du mthong ba yin la /
analyzed: byung nas kyang rgyun mi rtag cing 'jig par mngon sum du mthong ba yin la /
translated: and having arisen, they are seen directly to be impermanent and perishable.

original: nyi ma dang zla ba la sogs pa thog ma dang tha ma mngon sum du ma mthong ba rnams la yang 'char ba dang nub pa la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs kyi khyad par las mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur bar rjes su dpag bar bya'o //
analyzed: nyi ma dang zla ba la sogs pa thog ma dang tha ma mngon sum du ma mthong ba rnams la yang 'char ba dang nub pa la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs kyi khyad par las mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur bar rjes su dpag bar bya'o //
translated: And even in the case of the sun, moon, etc., which are not seen directly to have a beginning and end, their impermanence is inferred from the special reason of their rising and setting.

original: 'on rdo rje'i sku dang ldan pa rnams kyi ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'on rdo rje'i sku dang ldan pa rnams kyi ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: But what about those who possess the vajra body?

original: de ni 'jig rten nam grags pa'i phyir chos can ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'jig rten nam grags pa'i phyir chos can ma yin no //
translated: That is not a subject of discussion, because it is not known in the world.

original: yang na skad cig ma nyid kyis mi rtag pas rdo rje lta bu'i sku la yang khyab pas dngos po thams cad dus las 'da' bar dka' ba yin no //
analyzed: yang na skad cig ma nyid kyis mi rtag pas rdo rje lta bu'i sku la yang khyab pas dngos po thams cad dus las 'da' bar dka' ba yin no //
translated: Or, since the vajra body is also pervaded by impermanence because of momentariness, it is difficult for any entity to transcend time.

original: des na bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'dul ba rnams la dngos po thams cad dus las mi 'da' bar ston par mdzad de /
analyzed: des na bcom ldan 'das dus kyi 'dul ba rnams la dngos po thams cad dus las mi 'da' bar ston par mdzad de /
translated: Therefore, the Lord, in order to teach that all entities are difficult to transcend, manifests to those who are to be trained in time.

original: de yang ji skad du /
analyzed: de yang ji skad du /
translated: And it is said:

original: dus kyi 'byung ba smin par 'gyur //
analyzed: dus kyi 'byung ba smin par 'gyur //
translated: The evolution of time is ripening.

original: skye dgu dus kyis bsdus pa ste //
analyzed: skye dgu dus kyis bsdus pa ste //
translated: All living beings are included in time.

original: dus kyis gnyid log sa dpar byed //
analyzed: dus kyis gnyid log sa dpar byed //
translated: Time makes the earth and the sky sleep.

original: dus ni 'da' bar dka' ba'o //
analyzed: dus ni 'da' bar dka' ba'o //
translated: Time is difficult to transgress.

original: zhes so // ji ste pha rol po'i gzhung las 'byung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: zhes so // ji ste pha rol po'i gzhung las 'byung ngo zhe na /
translated: If you say that this is from the scriptures of the opponent,

original: de'i tshe yang nyes pa med de phyi rol pa rnams kyis dus can las tha dad pa dang / rtag pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du bzung bas nyams pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i tshe yang nyes pa med de phyi rol pa rnams kyis dus can las tha dad pa dang / rtag pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du bzung bas nyams pa yin gyi /
translated: then there is no fault, because the non-Buddhists are damaged by holding time to be different from the temporal and to have the characteristics of permanence, etc.

original: dus tsam du smra ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dus tsam du smra ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But we do not advocate mere time.

original: de ltar yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar yang gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: dngos la zhen pas 'dzin pa dang / dag pa yid kyi 'dzin pa dag / chung ma chags pas 'khyud pa dang / bu mo byams pas 'khyud pa 'dra //
analyzed: dngos la zhen pas 'dzin pa dang / dag pa yid kyi 'dzin pa dag / chung ma chags pas 'khyud pa dang / bu mo byams pas 'khyud pa 'dra //
translated: Like the attachment of clinging to things, the attachment of clinging to the mind, like the embrace of attachment to a wife, the embrace of affection for a daughter.

original: zhes so // lus la gnas kyang lus mi skye //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes so // lus la gnas kyang lus mi skye // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Although it abides in the body, the body does not arise.

original: tshul de ltar lus can rnams la khyab kyang don dam par glo bur ba nyid yin pa'i phyir lus de ngo bo nyid med pa yin no //
analyzed: tshul de ltar lus can rnams la khyab kyang don dam par glo bur ba nyid yin pa'i phyir lus de ngo bo nyid med pa yin no //
translated: In this way, although it pervades all embodied beings, ultimately it is adventitious, and therefore the body is essenceless.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dus nyid dus ni med pa dang // 'jig rten nyid ni 'jig rten min //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dus nyid dus ni med pa dang // 'jig rten nyid ni 'jig rten min //
translated: Therefore, time itself is not time, and the world itself is not the world.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de la dus ni bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de la dus ni bstan pa'o //
translated: Here, time is the teaching.

original: 'jig rten ni bshad pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten ni bshad pa ste /
translated: The world is the explanation.

original: 'jig pa ni skye ba la sogs pa mi rtag pa nyid kyi mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig pa ni skye ba la sogs pa mi rtag pa nyid kyi mthar thug pa'o //
translated: Destruction is the end of impermanence, such as arising.

original: rten pa ni rkyen la ltos pa ste /🔽de dag rnam par dpyad na ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rten pa ni rkyen la ltos pa ste / de dag rnam par dpyad na ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir /
translated: Support is dependence on conditions.

original: chu'i zla ba ltar gcig tu bden pa dang gcig tu brdzun pa yang ma yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: chu'i zla ba ltar gcig tu bden pa dang gcig tu brdzun pa yang ma yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: When those are analyzed, they should be understood as neither truly one nor truly many, like the moon in water.

original: lha khyod kyis ni sngar bshad pa'o //
analyzed: lha khyod kyis ni sngar bshad pa'o //
translated: You, O god, have previously explained

original: bsam gyis mi khyab dus mtshan nyid //🔽ces bya ba la sogs pas ni rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi nang gi dbugs bgrang ba las @149a * //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab dus mtshan nyid // ces bya ba la sogs pas ni rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi nang gi dbugs bgrang ba las @149a * //
translated: the characteristics of inconceivable time.

original: skad cig la sogs pa'i dus ma lus par shes pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: skad cig la sogs pa'i dus ma lus par shes pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa yin te /
translated: By this and so on, the characteristics of knowing all times such as moments from counting the inner breath of yoginis are taught.

original: gang dang gang lha khyod kyis sngar bstan pa'i dbugs bgrang ba'i don dam pa'i dus bstan pa de dang de ni lus las 'das shing dri ma med pa yin pa'i phyir rnal 'byor pa nyag gcig gi spyod yul yin zhing shin tu rnyed par dka' ba ste /
analyzed: gang dang gang lha khyod kyis sngar bstan pa'i dbugs bgrang ba'i don dam pa'i dus bstan pa de dang de ni lus las 'das shing dri ma med pa yin pa'i phyir rnal 'byor pa nyag gcig gi spyod yul yin zhing shin tu rnyed par dka' ba ste /
translated: Whatever is taught by you, O god, as the ultimate time of counting the breath, that is the domain of the yogin alone, because it is beyond the body and stainless, and is very difficult to attain.

original: skye bo phal pa rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin par gsungs so //🔽de'i phyir / skye bo kun la sman slad du //
analyzed: skye bo phal pa rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin par gsungs so // de'i phyir / skye bo kun la sman slad du //
translated: It is said to not be the domain of ordinary people.🔽Therefore,

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he says, “for the sake of the welfare of all beings.”

original: 'jig rten phal pa rnams la sman slad du'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten phal pa rnams la sman slad du'o //
translated: For the sake of the welfare of ordinary people in the world.

original: dbugs kyi nges pa zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor ba rnams kyi grangs kyis gtan la phab pa'i skad cig la sogs pa'i dus rnams bshad par gsol ba'o //
analyzed: dbugs kyi nges pa zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor ba rnams kyi grangs kyis gtan la phab pa'i skad cig la sogs pa'i dus rnams bshad par gsol ba'o //
translated: The “certainty of the breath” is the request to explain the times of moments and so on, which are ascertained by the number of the breath of the yogins.

original: nad med ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: nad med ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: “Free of disease” and so on.

original: rlung dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni nad med pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: rlung dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni nad med pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: “Free of wind” is a particular kind of health.

original: khams ni snyoms par gnas pa dang // zhes bya ba la khams kyi sgra ni dbang po rnams la bya ste /
analyzed: khams ni snyoms par gnas pa dang // zhes bya ba la khams kyi sgra ni dbang po rnams la bya ste /
translated: The term “elements” refers to the faculties.

original: dbang po rnams nad kyis ma gzir zhing ngal ba la sogs pas ma gdungs pa ni snyoms pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po rnams nad kyis ma gzir zhing ngal ba la sogs pas ma gdungs pa ni snyoms pa'o //
translated: The faculties are in balance when they are not afflicted by disease, or tormented by fatigue, etc.

original: ran par za zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: ran par za zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: One eats in moderation, etc.

original: ran pa ni 'tsham par te /
analyzed: ran pa ni 'tsham par te /
