translated: Moderation means eating the right amount.🔽One should avoid eating too much, too little, too fast, too slowly, too dry, too oily, too light, or too heavy.🔽One should eat food that is not harmful, that is easy to digest, that is not stale, and that is not conducive to the arising of disease.

original: kha zas 'grangs drags pa dang / ha cang ltogs pa dang / ha cang skya ba dang / ha cang snum pa dang / ha cang yang ba dang / ha cang lci ba rnams spangs te /
analyzed: kha zas 'grangs drags pa dang / ha cang ltogs pa dang / ha cang skya ba dang / ha cang snum pa dang / ha cang yang ba dang / ha cang lci ba rnams spangs te /
translated: One should eat food that is not harmful, that is easy to digest, that is not stale, and that is not conducive to the arising of disease.🔽One should eat food that is not harmful, that is easy to digest, that is not stale, and that is not conducive to the arising of disease.🔽One should eat food that is not harmful, that is easy to digest, that is not stale, and that is not conducive to the arising of disease.🔽One should eat food that is not harmful, that is easy to digest, that is not stale, and that is not conducive to the arising of disease.🔽One should eat food that is not harmful, that is easy to digest, that is not stale, and that is not conducive to the arising of disease.🔽One should eat food that is not harmful, that is easy to digest, that is not stale, and that is not conducive to the arising of disease.🔽One should eat food that is not harmful, that is easy to digest, that is not stale, and that is not conducive to the arising of disease.🔽One should eat food that is not harmful, that is easy to digest, that is not stale, and that is not conducive to the arising of disease.🔽One should eat food that is not harmful, that is easy to digest, that is not stale, and that is not conducive to the arising of disease.🔽One should eat food that is not harmful, that is easy to digest, that is not stale, and that is not conducive to the arising of disease.🔽One should eat food that is not harmful, that is easy to digest, that is not stale, and that is not conducive to the arising of disease.

original: rlung lugs su rgyu ba dang / bshang ba snum la mi sri zhing //
analyzed: rlung lugs su rgyu ba dang / bshang ba snum la mi sri zhing //
translated: One should eat food that is not harmful, that is easy to digest, that is not stale, and that is not conducive to the arising of disease.

original: lho bar bde bar za pa'o //🔽tshul bzhin rgyu zhes bya ba ni shin tu ngal dub dang / drag shul la sogs pa spangs nas gnas pa ste /🔽skyes bu tha ma la ba de'i mig btsums gzung bar bya'o //🔽mig btsums drug la yud tsam ni //
analyzed: lho bar bde bar za pa'o //🔽tshul bzhin rgyu zhes bya ba ni shin tu ngal dub dang / drag shul la sogs pa spangs nas gnas pa ste /🔽skyes bu tha ma la ba de'i mig btsums gzung bar bya'o //🔽mig btsums drug la yud tsam ni //
translated: One should eat food that is not harmful, that

original: cig ces bya bar brjod pa yin //
analyzed: cig ces bya bar brjod pa yin //
translated: The word “also” is used to indicate that the other two are also included.🔽

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The word moment is used.

original: skyes bu tha mal pa de'i mig shin tu myur ba dang dal ba ma yin par tha mal par phye ba dang // btsums pa drug la yud tsam zhig / ces bya bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: skyes bu tha mal pa de'i mig shin tu myur ba dang dal ba ma yin par tha mal par phye ba dang // btsums pa drug la yud tsam zhig / ces bya bar shes par bya'o //
translated: The eye of an ordinary person, neither too fast nor too slow,🔽is known as a moment,

original: dus kyi go rims bya ba 'dis zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: dus kyi go rims bya ba 'dis zhes bya ba ni //
translated: in the order of time.

original: de ltar mig btsums pa la sogs pa nas cung zad kyi bar du brtsi ba 'dis so //
analyzed: de ltar mig btsums pa la sogs pa nas cung zad kyi bar du brtsi ba 'dis so //
translated: By this calculation from closing the eye up to a moment,

original: sum cu tham par bsgyur ba la //🔽zhes bya ba ni cung zad sum cu tham par spel ba'o //🔽yi ge lci ba'i dus zhes brjod //
analyzed: sum cu tham par bsgyur ba la // zhes bya ba ni cung zad sum cu tham par spel ba'o // yi ge lci ba'i dus zhes brjod //
translated: multiplying by thirty,🔽is called the time of heavy letters.

original: ces bya ba ni dus kyi khyad par gang la yi ge lci ba zhes bya ba'i ming du grags pa ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni dus kyi khyad par gang la yi ge lci ba zhes bya ba'i ming du grags pa ste /
translated: The time when heavy letters are known is🔽called the time of heavy letters.

original: yi ge lci ba'i dus gcig tu brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: yi ge lci ba'i dus gcig tu brjod par bya'o //
translated: The time of heavy letters should be stated as one.🔽Life is the time when life and livelihood are

original: srog ces bya ba ni dus kyi khyad par gang la @149b srog dang 'tsho ba zhes bya bar brjod pa'o //
analyzed: srog ces bya ba ni dus kyi khyad par gang la @149b srog dang 'tsho ba zhes bya bar brjod pa'o //
translated: called.

original: de ni zhes bya ba'i srog gi dus de'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba'i srog gi dus de'o //
translated: That is the time of life.

original: bcu gsum bsgyur zhes bya ba ni sum cur spel ba'o //
analyzed: bcu gsum bsgyur zhes bya ba ni sum cur spel ba'o //
translated: Multiply by twelve means to increase by thirty.

original: de yang gnyis su bsgyur ba ni //
analyzed: de yang gnyis su bsgyur ba ni //
translated: And that is doubled means

original: zhes bya ba ni srog gi dus te sum cu pa phrag gnyis su spel ba ste drug cur spel ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni srog gi dus te sum cu pa phrag gnyis su spel ba ste drug cur spel ba'o //
translated: the time of life is doubled, that is, increased by thirty, making sixty.

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: de brgyad ces bya ba ni chu tshod brgyad la'o //
analyzed: de brgyad ces bya ba ni chu tshod brgyad la'o //
translated: Eight of those means eight watches.

original: de bzhi la zhes bya ba ni thun bzhi la'o //
analyzed: de bzhi la zhes bya ba ni thun bzhi la'o //
translated: Four of those means four periods.

original: de ltar nyin mo'i thun bshad nas mtshan mo'i bstan pa'i phyir /🔽mtshan mo'ang de dang mnyam par bshad //
analyzed: de ltar nyin mo'i thun bshad nas mtshan mo'i bstan pa'i phyir / mtshan mo'ang de dang mnyam par bshad //
translated: Having explained the periods of the day, in order to teach the night,🔽it is said,

original: ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The night is also explained as being the same.

original: nam zhe na /
analyzed: nam zhe na /
translated: When?

original: nyin mtshan dus ni mnyam pa la ste bi shu'i dus so //
analyzed: nyin mtshan dus ni mnyam pa la ste bi shu'i dus so //
translated: When the day and night are equal, that is, at the time of Viṣṇu.

original: da ni nyin mtshan 'phel 'bri bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: da ni nyin mtshan 'phel 'bri bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: Now, in order to teach the waxing and waning of the day and night,

original: chu srin nas ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: chu srin nas ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, from Makara, etc.

original: dgun zla tha chungs kyi mjug nas dbyar zla tha chungs kyi mgo'i bar du zla ba drug po 'di la ni nyin mo'i chu tshod rnams nyin re zhing srog gsum gsum du spel bar bya ba la /
analyzed: dgun zla tha chungs kyi mjug nas dbyar zla tha chungs kyi mgo'i bar du zla ba drug po 'di la ni nyin mo'i chu tshod rnams nyin re zhing srog gsum gsum du spel bar bya ba la /
translated: During the six months from the end of the last winter month to the beginning of the last summer month, the number of daytime hours increases by three prāṇas each day.

original: de bzhin du mtshan mo ni dbri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mtshan mo ni dbri bar bya'o //
translated: Similarly, the number of nighttime hours decreases.

original: chu srin las ni 'das nas su //
analyzed: chu srin las ni 'das nas su //
translated: After Makara,

original: zhes bya ba ni chu srin nas sbal pa'i bar gyi zla ba drug po de dag 'das nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni chu srin nas sbal pa'i bar gyi zla ba drug po de dag 'das nas /
translated: after the six months from Makara to Kumbha,

original: zla ba lhag ma drug la mtshan mo srang gsum gsum de bzhin du spel bar bya'o //🔽gzhung kha cig las mtshan mo srang ni gsum gsum dbri //
analyzed: zla ba lhag ma drug la mtshan mo srang gsum gsum de bzhin du spel bar bya'o // gzhung kha cig las mtshan mo srang ni gsum gsum dbri //
translated: during the remaining six months, the number of nighttime hours increases by three palas.

original: zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: zhes 'byung ste /
translated: In some texts, it says “the number of nighttime hours decreases by three palas.”

original: de'i tshe chu srin las 'das ba zhes bya ba ni dgun zla tha chungs kyi zla ba 'das kyi 'og tu'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe chu srin las 'das ba zhes bya ba ni dgun zla tha chungs kyi zla ba 'das kyi 'og tu'o //
translated: At that time, “after Makara” means after the last winter month.

original: tshad ma de dag bstan pa'i phyir //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tshad ma de dag bstan pa'i phyir // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In order to teach those measures,

original: skye bo phal pa rnams la dus kyi tshad de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skye bo phal pa rnams la dus kyi tshad de bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach those measures of time to ordinary beings,

original: brdung bar bya zhes bya ba dang 'brel te /
analyzed: brdung bar bya zhes bya ba dang 'brel te /
translated: The phrase should be beaten is connected to this.

original: ci las ci zhig ji lta zhe na zangs ma zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ci las ci zhig ji lta zhe na zangs ma zhes bya ba la /
translated: What should be beaten? What is it? How is it?  Copper is stated.

original: zangs ma srang bcu gnyis ni ji ltar grags pa'i zangs ma srang bcu gnyis te /
analyzed: zangs ma srang bcu gnyis ni ji ltar grags pa'i zangs ma srang bcu gnyis te /
translated: Twelve measures of copper is twelve measures of copper as is well known.

original: de las chu'i snod brdung ba'o //
analyzed: de las chu'i snod brdung ba'o //
translated: A water vessel should be beaten from that.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How?

original: dpangs su sor brgyad dang rgya ru sor bcu gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: dpangs su sor brgyad dang rgya ru sor bcu gnyis pa ste /
translated: Eight fingerbreadths in height and twelve fingerbreadths in width.

original: rngams su sor brgyad yod cing kha'i rgyar sor bcu gnyis kun nas yod par brdung bar bya'o //
analyzed: rngams su sor brgyad yod cing kha'i rgyar sor bcu gnyis kun nas yod par brdung bar bya'o //
translated: It should be beaten with a height of eight fingerbreadths and a width of twelve fingerbreadths.

original: legs pa zhes bya ba ni mtho dman dang mthug srab la sogs pa snyoms pa'o //
analyzed: legs pa zhes bya ba ni mtho dman dang mthug srab la sogs pa snyoms pa'o //
translated: Well-beaten means that it is even, without high and low, thick and thin, and so forth.

original: de nas ci zhig bya zhe na /🔽gser ni 'o se sum cu las //
analyzed: de nas ci zhig bya zhe na / gser ni 'o se sum cu las //
translated: Then what should be done?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: From thirty ounces of gold and so forth is stated.

original: ji ltar grags pa'i man cha gsum gyi gser las thur mar bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar grags pa'i man cha gsum gyi gser las thur mar bya'o //
translated: A spoon should be made from the gold of three measures as is well known.

original: ci 'dra zhe na /
analyzed: ci 'dra zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: sor drug pa'i tshad tsam du zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sor drug pa'i tshad tsam du zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is stated that it is the size of six fingerbreadths.

original: ring thung sor drug gi tshad du bya'o //
analyzed: ring thung sor drug gi tshad du bya'o //
translated: It should be made the size of six fingerbreadths in length and width.

original: legs par bya ba ni sbom phra med par ro //🔽de dag gis ni rdzas @150a * //
analyzed: legs par bya ba ni sbom phra med par ro // de dag gis ni rdzas @150a * //
translated: The right size is that which is neither too thick nor too thin.🔽By these, the specific characteristics of the substance, size, etc.

original: dang tshad la sogs pa'i khyad par nges pa bstan pa yin no //🔽thur ma de yis bu ga ni //
analyzed: dang tshad la sogs pa'i khyad par nges pa bstan pa yin no // thur ma de yis bu ga ni //
translated: are taught.🔽The wise one should bore the hole

original: zangs ma'i snod la mkhas pas dbug / ces bya ba la /
analyzed: zangs ma'i snod la mkhas pas dbug / ces bya ba la /
translated: with that awl in the copper vessel.

original: mkhas pa ni bzo ba ste /
analyzed: mkhas pa ni bzo ba ste /
translated: The wise one is the craftsman.

original: yo ba dang ral ba la sogs pa med par dbug pa'o //
analyzed: yo ba dang ral ba la sogs pa med par dbug pa'o //
translated: He should bore the hole without any crookedness, holes, etc.

original: chu ni rnyog ma med pa las //
analyzed: chu ni rnyog ma med pa las //
translated: The water should be free from turbidity.

original: zhes bya ba ni shin tu dang ba'i chu'i steng du bzhag pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni shin tu dang ba'i chu'i steng du bzhag pa ste /
translated: It should be placed on very clear water.

original: gzhan du na myur du gang bar mi 'gyur ba dang / ma gang ba 'og tu 'bying ba la sogs pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na myur du gang bar mi 'gyur ba dang / ma gang ba 'og tu 'bying ba la sogs pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it will not quickly fill up, and the water that has not filled up will sink down, etc.

original: srang ni drug cu'i tshad du 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: srang ni drug cu'i tshad du 'gyur // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The scale is sixty in measure.

original: sngar bstan pa'i srang drug cu'i tshad de de ni chu tshod de 'gyur ba yin no //🔽skye bo rnams la phan phyir bshad //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i srang drug cu'i tshad de de ni chu tshod de 'gyur ba yin no // skye bo rnams la phan phyir bshad //
translated: That scale of sixty previously taught is the measure of the water-clock.

original: ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni /
translated: It is explained for the benefit of people.

original: tha mal pa'i skye bo rnams la chu tshod kyi tshad tshegs med par bya ba'i phyir bshad do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tha mal pa'i skye bo rnams la chu tshod kyi tshad tshegs med par bya ba'i phyir bshad do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is explained for the sake of ordinary people who are not skilled in the measure of time.

original: chu tshod de ni yud tsam ste //
analyzed: chu tshod de ni yud tsam ste //
translated: That measure of time is a muhurta.

original: zhes bya ba ni chu tshod nyid yud tsam du bshad kyi gzhan dum yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni chu tshod nyid yud tsam du bshad kyi gzhan dum yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that a muhurta is explained as a measure of time, but not as anything else.

original: thun phyed ces bya ba ni chu tshod bzhi la'o //
analyzed: thun phyed ces bya ba ni chu tshod bzhi la'o //
translated: Half a day is four muhurtas.

original: thun gcig ces bya ba ni go sla'o //
analyzed: thun gcig ces bya ba ni go sla'o //
translated: One day is easy to understand.

original: zla ba gnyis ni dus yin te //
analyzed: zla ba gnyis ni dus yin te //
translated: Two months is a season.

original: zhes bya ba ni zla ba gnyis gnyis shing dpyid la sogs pa'i dus drug po re rer bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni zla ba gnyis gnyis shing dpyid la sogs pa'i dus drug po re rer bstan pa'o //
translated: This means that two months each is taught for each of the six seasons such as spring.

original: dus gsum nyi ma 'gro ldog brjod //
analyzed: dus gsum nyi ma 'gro ldog brjod //
translated: Three months is a season, said to be the sun's movement.

original: ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni /
translated: This means

original: dgun dang dpyid la sogs pa'i dus gsum gsum du nyi ma lho byang du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: dgun dang dpyid la sogs pa'i dus gsum gsum du nyi ma lho byang du 'gro ba'o //
translated: that the sun moves south and north for three months each in the seasons such as winter and spring.

original: yang na yung tsam zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten phal pa kha cig la grags pas bstan pa yang yin te /
analyzed: yang na yung tsam zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten phal pa kha cig la grags pas bstan pa yang yin te /
translated: Or, a muhurta is also taught as known to some ordinary people.

original: de dag gi ltar na sngar bstan pa'i mig btsums bco brgyad la ni skad cig gcig go //
analyzed: de dag gi ltar na sngar bstan pa'i mig btsums bco brgyad la ni skad cig gcig go //
translated: According to them, the eighteen moments of eye-closure taught above are one instant.

original: de sum cu la ni thang cig go //
analyzed: de sum cu la ni thang cig go //
translated: Thirty of those are one period.

original: de sum cur bsgyur ba la ni cung zad cig go //
analyzed: de sum cur bsgyur ba la ni cung zad cig go //
translated: Thirty of those are a little while.

original: cung zad bcu gnyis la ni yud tsam gcig ste /
analyzed: cung zad bcu gnyis la ni yud tsam gcig ste /
translated: Twelve of those are one period.

original: des brtsi bar bya'o zhes zer te /
analyzed: des brtsi bar bya'o zhes zer te /
translated: One should count by that.

original: lhag ma ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as explained above.

original: dus 'byung ba'i rim par phye ba zhes bya ba la gzhung gang la mig btsums pa la sogs pa'i dus rnams kyi 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: dus 'byung ba'i rim par phye ba zhes bya ba la gzhung gang la mig btsums pa la sogs pa'i dus rnams kyi 'byung ba ste /
translated: The twenty-sixth chapter is called The Analysis of the Arising of Time, because in this treatise the arising of the times of eye-closure, etc. is taught.

original: bstan pa yod par de la dus 'byung ba'i rim par phyi ba ste nyi shu rtsa drug pa'o //
analyzed: bstan pa yod par de la dus 'byung ba'i rim par phyi ba ste nyi shu rtsa drug pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called The Analysis of the Arising of Time, the twenty-sixth chapter.

original: rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po dpal rdo rje mkha' 'gro'i rnam par bshad pa las le'u nyi shu rtsa drug pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
analyzed: rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po dpal rdo rje mkha' 'gro'i rnam par bshad pa las le'u nyi shu rtsa drug pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
translated: This completes the explanation of the twenty-sixth chapter in the commentary on the great king of tantras, the glorious Vajradaka.

original: // / da ni rgyu skar rnams kyi rigs nges par shes par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: // / da ni rgyu skar rnams kyi rigs nges par shes par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to ascertain the types of the lunar mansions, it is said:

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Then, etc.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni dus 'byung ba bstan gyi 'og tu'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni dus 'byung ba bstan gyi 'og tu'o //
translated: Then is after the teaching of the arising of the time.

original: skar @150b ma'i rigs gang yin zhes bya ba ni skar ma gang las skyes pa'i thun mong dang khyad par gyi rigs lha la sogs pa dang / ra la sogs pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: skar @150b ma'i rigs gang yin zhes bya ba ni skar ma gang las skyes pa'i thun mong dang khyad par gyi rigs lha la sogs pa dang / ra la sogs pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: What is the class of the stars? is which star one is born under, the common and special class of gods, etc., and goats, etc.

original: de dag bshad par bya zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //
analyzed: de dag bshad par bya zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //
translated: That is to be explained is the connection.

original: mdor bsdus zhes bya ba ni gzhung nyung ba dang tshegs med par ro //🔽tha skar dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: mdor bsdus zhes bya ba ni gzhung nyung ba dang tshegs med par ro // tha skar dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In brief is in a short text, without difficulty.

original: skar ma dgu dgu zhing lha la sogs pa'i rigs rnam pa gsum du bstan pa'i 'dis ni gnyen sbyor la sogs pa'i stobs brtsi ba bstan pa yin no //🔽smin drug rgyal ni ra yin te //
analyzed: skar ma dgu dgu zhing lha la sogs pa'i rigs rnam pa gsum du bstan pa'i 'dis ni gnyen sbyor la sogs pa'i stobs brtsi ba bstan pa yin no // smin drug rgyal ni ra yin te //
translated: The Pleiads and so on is the teaching of the three classes of gods, etc., with nine stars each. This teaches the calculation of the power of the conjunction, etc.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dis ni skar ma gnyis gnyis shing rigs re re bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dis ni skar ma gnyis gnyis shing rigs re re bstan pa yin te /
translated: The constellation of the Pleiads is a goat, etc. This teaches the two stars each with one class.🔽The constellation of the Pleiads is a goat, etc. This teaches the two stars each with one class.

original: khyad par gyi rigs bcu bzhir bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: khyad par gyi rigs bcu bzhir bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the teaching of the fourteen special types.🔽One who desires power should know

original: stobs 'dod pas ni shes par bya //
analyzed: stobs 'dod pas ni shes par bya //
translated: this.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is the thought:

original: khyu mchog gi rigs gang yin pa de stag gi rigs kyi stobs kyis 'joms par byed pas na /
analyzed: khyu mchog gi rigs gang yin pa de stag gi rigs kyi stobs kyis 'joms par byed pas na /
translated: The type of bull is destroyed by the power of the type of tiger.

original: khyu mchog gi mi'i stag gi rigs kyi bu mo bag mar mi blang zhing spang bar bya'o zhes par dgongs so //
analyzed: khyu mchog gi mi'i stag gi rigs kyi bu mo bag mar mi blang zhing spang bar bya'o zhes par dgongs so //
translated: Therefore, one should avoid taking as a wife a girl of the type of tiger, which is the type of man who is a bull.

original: de ltar lta 'og tu sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar lta 'og tu sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This should be applied in the same way below.

original: rang gi skye ba'i skar ma ni //
analyzed: rang gi skye ba'i skar ma ni //
translated: If one knows one's natal star

original: shes nas bzung na dpyad mi dgos //
analyzed: shes nas bzung na dpyad mi dgos //
translated: and takes it, there is no need for analysis.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: This is the meaning:

original: bzung na zhes bya ba ni bag mar blangs pa ste /
analyzed: bzung na zhes bya ba ni bag mar blangs pa ste /
translated: Taking means taking as a wife.

original: de la rang gis kye skar stobs che bar shes par bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de la rang gis kye skar stobs che bar shes par bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should know which star is powerful for oneself.🔽If one takes the reversed part of the star,

original: skar ma'i cha ni bzlog pa dag / bzung na nges par 'chi bar 'gyur //
analyzed: skar ma'i cha ni bzlog pa dag / bzung na nges par 'chi bar 'gyur //
translated: one will certainly die.

original: zhes bya ba ni bu mo'i skar ma stobs dang ldan par bzung ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bu mo'i skar ma stobs dang ldan par bzung ste /
translated: This is the meaning: If one takes a powerful star of a girl

original: bag mar blangs na nges par bya ste /
analyzed: bag mar blangs na nges par bya ste /
translated: and takes her as a wife, one will certainly die.

original: gdon mi za bar 'chi bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar 'chi bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one will certainly die.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,

original: skar ma mi yi srog yin te //
analyzed: skar ma mi yi srog yin te //
translated: the stars are the life of men,

original: gzhan du ngas ni ma bshad do //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan du ngas ni ma bshad do // zhes gsungs so //
translated: I have not explained it otherwise.

original: lug dang srang dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas kyang r'a si bzhi bzhi zhing bstan pa dang g-yo ba'i mtshan nyid re rer bstan te /
analyzed: lug dang srang dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas kyang r'a si bzhi bzhi zhing bstan pa dang g-yo ba'i mtshan nyid re rer bstan te /
translated: Also, by the sheep, Libra, etc., four Rasis are taught, and the characteristics of the movable signs are taught one by one.

original: de dag shes nas bya ba rnams dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dag shes nas bya ba rnams dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Having understood them, one should apply them to the activities.

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //🔽skar ma rnams kyi stobs kyi dbang du byas pa'i cho ga'i rim par phye ba zhes bya ba la cho ga ni bstan pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o // skar ma rnams kyi stobs kyi dbang du byas pa'i cho ga'i rim par phye ba zhes bya ba la cho ga ni bstan pa'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.🔽The chapter on the procedure based on the power of the stars is called the twenty-seventh chapter.🔽Here, the procedure is the teaching.

original: des na gzhung gang gi skar ma'i stobs kyi dbang du byas nas bstan pa de ni rim par phye ba ste nyi shu rtsa bdun pa'o //
analyzed: des na gzhung gang gi skar ma'i stobs kyi dbang du byas nas bstan pa de ni rim par phye ba ste nyi shu rtsa bdun pa'o //
translated: Therefore, that text which is taught based on the power of the stars is the chapter, the twenty-seventh.

original: rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po dpal rdo rje mkha' 'gro'i rnam par bshad pa las le'u nyi shu rtsa bdun pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /🔽// / da ni gza' dang tshes dang rgyu skar rnams la mgron du 'gro ba la sogs pa'i @151a * //
analyzed: rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po dpal rdo rje mkha' 'gro'i rnam par bshad pa las le'u nyi shu rtsa bdun pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o / // / da ni gza' dang tshes dang rgyu skar rnams la mgron du 'gro ba la sogs pa'i @151a * //
translated: This concludes the explanation of the twenty-seventh chapter of the Explanatory Tantra of the glorious Vajra Ḍāka.

original: khyad par shis pa dang mi shis pa bstan pa'i phyir /🔽tshes dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: khyad par shis pa dang mi shis pa bstan pa'i phyir / tshes dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, in order to teach the auspicious and inauspicious distinctions of going on a journey and so forth with respect to the planets, lunar days, and nakṣatras,

original: tshes dang skar ma gza' 'char ba //
analyzed: tshes dang skar ma gza' 'char ba //
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares, “The lunar day, the nakṣatra, and the rising planet,” and so forth.

original: zhes bya ba ni chos la sogs pa de dag gi sbyor ba la 'char ba ste mgron la sogs pa'i bya ba shis pa dang mi shes pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni chos la sogs pa de dag gi sbyor ba la 'char ba ste mgron la sogs pa'i bya ba shis pa dang mi shes pa yin no //
translated: The “rising” of those, the lunar day and so forth, is their application, which is auspicious or inauspicious for the activity of going on a journey and so forth.

original: ro hi ta zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'dir tshes gcig la sogs pa gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: ro hi ta zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'dir tshes gcig la sogs pa gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Rohita and so forth should be taken here as the first lunar day and so forth.

original: ro hi ta'i tshes zhes bya ba ni tshes gcig go //
analyzed: ro hi ta'i tshes zhes bya ba ni tshes gcig go //
translated: “The lunar day of Rohita” is the first lunar day.

original: mgron po lam du 'jug par bzang //
analyzed: mgron po lam du 'jug par bzang //
translated: It is good for a traveler to set out on the road.

original: zhes bya ba ni tshes gcig gi nyin par gang gi tshe rgyu skar smin drug dang gza' mig dmar 'dzom pa de'i tshe lam du zhugs na rnyed pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tshes gcig gi nyin par gang gi tshe rgyu skar smin drug dang gza' mig dmar 'dzom pa de'i tshe lam du zhugs na rnyed pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that when the star Punarvasu and the planet Mars are in conjunction on the first day of the month, one should set out on a journey and one will obtain gain.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,

original: ma ka ra yi nyi ma la //
analyzed: ma ka ra yi nyi ma la //
translated: on the day of Makara,

original: zhes bya ba ni tshes gnyis la'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tshes gnyis la'o //
translated: means on the second day of the month.

original: de ltar lhag ma rnams la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar lhag ma rnams la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This should be applied in the same way to the rest.

original: stobs ldan gyi blon po zhes bya ba ni pa ba sangs so //
analyzed: stobs ldan gyi blon po zhes bya ba ni pa ba sangs so //
translated: The powerful minister is called Papasani.

original: 'byung po'i nyi ma zhes bya ba ni mar ngo'i bcu bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'byung po'i nyi ma zhes bya ba ni mar ngo'i bcu bzhi'o //
translated: The day of the spirits is the fourteenth of the waning fortnight.

original: lhag ma ni shin tu gsal bas ma phye'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni shin tu gsal bas ma phye'o //
translated: The rest is very clear and so is not explained.

original: me'i mtshams su zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: me'i mtshams su zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: The passage beginning with “in the southeast”

original: sgra gcan 'dzin rgyu ba'i 'khor lo bstan te /
analyzed: sgra gcan 'dzin rgyu ba'i 'khor lo bstan te /
translated: teaches the wheel of Rahu’s movement.

original: 'dir phan tshun du thig gnyis gnyis btab la phyi rol bskor bas re'u mig dgur byas la /
analyzed: 'dir phan tshun du thig gnyis gnyis btab la phyi rol bskor bas re'u mig dgur byas la /
translated: Here, two lines are drawn intersecting each other, and by circling them externally, they form nine squares.

original: de me'i mtshams su ma ka ra bris te tshes brgyad do //
analyzed: de me'i mtshams su ma ka ra bris te tshes brgyad do //
translated: In the southeast square, Makara is written, which is the eighth day of the month.

original: gshin rje'i phyogs su ni ra dha ste tshes bdun no //
analyzed: gshin rje'i phyogs su ni ra dha ste tshes bdun no //
translated: In the direction of Yama, it is Radha, the seventh lunar mansion.

original: srin por ni kur ma ste tshes bco lnga'o //
analyzed: srin por ni kur ma ste tshes bco lnga'o //
translated: In the direction of Rākṣasa, it is Kurma, the fifteenth lunar mansion.

original: chu'i phyogs ni khyu mchog ste tshes bzhi'o //🔽'jigs byed ni rlung ste de'i mtshams su ni bya ku la ste tshes bcu'o //
analyzed: chu'i phyogs ni khyu mchog ste tshes bzhi'o // 'jigs byed ni rlung ste de'i mtshams su ni bya ku la ste tshes bcu'o //
translated: In the direction of Water, it is Śravaṇa, the fourth lunar mansion.🔽In the direction of Bhairava, it is Bharaṇī, the tenth lunar mansion.

original: gter ni gnod sbyin te de'i phyogs su sva pa na ste tshes bcu gcig go //🔽me gsum ni dbang ldan te /
analyzed: gter ni gnod sbyin te de'i phyogs su sva pa na ste tshes bcu gcig go // me gsum ni dbang ldan te /
translated: In the direction of the treasure, it is Svāti, the eleventh lunar mansion.

original: de'i phyogs su bzang po ste tshes gsum mo //
analyzed: de'i phyogs su bzang po ste tshes gsum mo //
translated: In the direction of the three fires, it is Aśvinī, the third lunar mansion.🔽In the direction of Bhadrapadā, it is Bhadrapadā, the third lunar mansion.

original: yang khyu mchog ni tshes bcu bzhi'o //
analyzed: yang khyu mchog ni tshes bcu bzhi'o //
translated: Again, in the direction of Śravaṇa, it is Śravaṇa, the fourteenth lunar mansion.

original: zla ba nyi ma'i bye brag gis //
analyzed: zla ba nyi ma'i bye brag gis //
translated: By the distinction of the moon and sun,

original: zhes bya ba ni zla ba yar ngo mar ngo'i bye brag gis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni zla ba yar ngo mar ngo'i bye brag gis so //
translated: the distinction of the waxing and waning moon.

original: rgyu ba zhes bya ba ni sgra gcan 'dzin rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu ba zhes bya ba ni sgra gcan 'dzin rgyu ba'o //
translated: Moving means Rāhu moving.

original: bha tra nas ni ra 'dar te //🔽zhes bya ba ni dbang ldan gyi phyogs su gnas nas ra 'da' ste /
analyzed: bha tra nas ni ra 'dar te // zhes bya ba ni dbang ldan gyi phyogs su gnas nas ra 'da' ste /
translated: From Bhadrapadā, it is Revatī,🔽means from the direction of Aśvinī, it is Revatī,

original: gshin rje'i phyogs su rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: gshin rje'i phyogs su rgyu ba'o //
translated: moving in the direction of Yama.

original: bya ku li zhes bya ba ni lho phyogs nas byang nub tu rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: bya ku li zhes bya ba ni lho phyogs nas byang nub tu rgyu ba'o //
translated: The one called Kūla moves from the south to the northwest.

original: pre sha pa zhes bya ba ni byang nub nas shar phyogs su rgyu ba ste /
analyzed: pre sha pa zhes bya ba ni byang nub nas shar phyogs su rgyu ba ste /
translated: The one called Preṣa moves from the northwest to the east.

original: rta'i 'gros kyis rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: rta'i 'gros kyis rgyu ba'o //
translated: They move at the speed of a horse.

original: 'di dag nyi ma'i rgyu ba ni //
analyzed: 'di dag nyi ma'i rgyu ba ni //
translated: These are the movements of the sun.

original: rigs mchog ma ni khyod la bshad //
analyzed: rigs mchog ma ni khyod la bshad //
translated: I will explain the best of the lunar families to you.

original: ces bya ba ni zla ba mar ngo'i tshes rnams dang / phyogs kyi rgyu ba bshad pa ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni zla ba mar ngo'i tshes rnams dang / phyogs kyi rgyu ba bshad pa ste /
translated: This explains the lunar days of the waning phase and the movements of the directions.

original: de dag @151b ni g-yas skor yin no //
analyzed: de dag @151b ni g-yas skor yin no //
translated: They move in a clockwise direction.

original: de la gang gi tshe sgra gcan 'dzin bzang po'i tshes la /
analyzed: de la gang gi tshe sgra gcan 'dzin bzang po'i tshes la /
translated: When Rāhu is in the lunar day of Bhadrapadā,

original: dbang ldan gyi mtshams na gnas pa'i tshe dbang ldan nas lho phyogs su 'gro ba dang / gang gi tshe sgra gcan 'dzin ra 'dar 'gro ba'i tshes bzang po nas bya ku li'i phyogs su 'gro ba dang / gang gi tshe bya ku li'i phyogs su song ba'i tshe khyu mchog gi phyogs su 'gro ba rnams ni gnod pa med cing skyon med pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang ldan gyi mtshams na gnas pa'i tshe dbang ldan nas lho phyogs su 'gro ba dang / gang gi tshe sgra gcan 'dzin ra 'dar 'gro ba'i tshes bzang po nas bya ku li'i phyogs su 'gro ba dang / gang gi tshe bya ku li'i phyogs su song ba'i tshe khyu mchog gi phyogs su 'gro ba rnams ni gnod pa med cing skyon med pa yin no //
translated: When the moon moves from the northeast to the south, when it moves from the east to the west, and when it moves from the southwest to the northwest, it is without harm and without fault.🔽When it moves from the northwest to the north, from the west to the east, and from the southeast to the southwest, it is with harm and with fault.🔽When it moves from the northeast to the southeast, from the southwest to the northwest, and from the northwest to the southeast, it is without harm and without fault.🔽When it moves from the southeast to the northeast, from the southwest to the northeast, and from the northwest to the southeast, it is with harm and with fault.

original: de bzhin du khyu mchog gi phyogs su song ba'i tshe rlung gi phyogs su 'gro ba yang nyes pa skyed par mi 'gyur ro //🔽khyu mchog dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /🔽zla ba mar ngo'i rgyu ba bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du khyu mchog gi phyogs su song ba'i tshe rlung gi phyogs su 'gro ba yang nyes pa skyed par mi 'gyur ro // khyu mchog dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni / zla ba mar ngo'i rgyu ba bshad pa yin te /
translated: When it moves from the northeast to the southeast, from the southwest to the northwest, and from the northwest to the southeast, it is without harm and without fault.🔽When it moves from the southeast to the northeast, from the southwest to the northeast, and from the northwest to the southeast, it is with harm and with fault.🔽When it moves from the northeast to the southeast, from the southwest to the northwest, and from the northwest to the southeast, it is without harm and without fault.🔽When it moves from the southeast to the northeast, from the southwest to the northeast, and from the northwest to the southeast, it is with harm and with fault.🔽When it moves from the northeast to the southeast, from the southwest to the northwest, and from the northwest to the southeast, it is without harm and without fault.🔽When it moves from the southeast to the northeast, from the southwest to the northeast, and from the northwest to the southeast, it is with harm and with fault.🔽When it moves from the northeast to the southeast, from the southwest to the northwest, and from the northwest to the southeast, it is without harm and without fault.🔽When it moves from the southeast to the northeast, from the southwest to the northeast, and from the northwest to the southeast, it is with harm and with fault.🔽When it moves from the northeast to the southeast, from the southwest to the northwest, and from the northwest to the southeast, it is without harm and without fault.

original: yang rang gi gnas dbang ldan gyi gnas su gnas nas khyu mchog la sogs pa'i gnas rnams su g-yon skor du rta'i 'gros kyis rgyu bar gsungs so //
analyzed: yang rang gi gnas dbang ldan gyi gnas su gnas nas khyu mchog la sogs pa'i gnas rnams su g-yon skor du rta'i 'gros kyis rgyu bar gsungs so //
translated: When it moves from the southeast to the northeast, from the southwest to the northeast, and from the northwest to the southeast, it is with harm and with fault.🔽When it moves from the northeast to the southeast, from the southwest to the northwest, and from the northwest to the southeast, it is without harm

original: gang gi tshe dbang ldan gyi gnas na gnas pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe dbang ldan gyi gnas na gnas pa de'i tshe /
translated: When Rahu is in the northeast,

original: skyes bus khyu mchog gi phyogs su 'gro bar bya'o //🔽gang gi tshe khyu mchog tu 'gro ba de'i tshe ma ka rar don du gnyer na 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes bus khyu mchog gi phyogs su 'gro bar bya'o // gang gi tshe khyu mchog tu 'gro ba de'i tshe ma ka rar don du gnyer na 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: one should go in the direction of the bull.🔽When one goes in the direction of the bull, if one seeks wealth, one will obtain it.

original: gang gi tshe ma ka rar song ba de'i tshe khyu mchog gi phyogs su don gnyer na 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe ma ka rar song ba de'i tshe khyu mchog gi phyogs su don gnyer na 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: When one goes in the direction of the bull, if one seeks wealth, one will obtain it.

original: de bzhin du gzhan dag kyang rjes su dpag par bya'o //🔽nya la me mtshams gnas pa ste //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan dag kyang rjes su dpag par bya'o // nya la me mtshams gnas pa ste //
translated: The rest should be inferred in the same way.🔽Rahu is in the southeast on the new moon,

original: stong la rlung gi phyogs su gnas ;
analyzed: stong la rlung gi phyogs su gnas ;
translated: and in the northwest on the full moon.

original: / zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'di skad du bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: / zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'di skad du bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: nya'i nyi mar sgra gcan 'dzin me mtshams su gnas nas /
analyzed: nya'i nyi mar sgra gcan 'dzin me mtshams su gnas nas /
translated: When Rahu is in the southeast on the new moon,

original: me dang rlung mtshams gnyi gar blta bas blta ba'i chad pa 'byung ba'i phyir skyes bus phyogs de gnyis su 'gro ba spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: me dang rlung mtshams gnyi gar blta bas blta ba'i chad pa 'byung ba'i phyir skyes bus phyogs de gnyis su 'gro ba spang bar bya'o //
translated: one should avoid going in those two directions, because an eclipse of the sun or moon will occur by looking at them.

original: de bzhin du stong gi nyin par rlung mtshams su gnas te /
analyzed: de bzhin du stong gi nyin par rlung mtshams su gnas te /
translated: In the same way, on the one hundredth day, the wind abides in the southeast,

original: rlung dang me mtshams gnyi gar blta bas skyes bu phyogs de gnyis su 'gro ba spang par bya'o //
analyzed: rlung dang me mtshams gnyi gar blta bas skyes bu phyogs de gnyis su 'gro ba spang par bya'o //
translated: and the person should avoid going in those two directions.

original: kha cig ni tshes de gnyi ga la dbus su gnas nas /
analyzed: kha cig ni tshes de gnyi ga la dbus su gnas nas /
translated: Some say that both of those days abide in the center,

original: mtshams de gnyi gar blta ba yin te /
analyzed: mtshams de gnyi gar blta ba yin te /
translated: and look in both directions.

original: gnas pa'i sgras ni blta ba la bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gnas pa'i sgras ni blta ba la bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: The word “abide” refers to “look.”

original: blo ldan 'bad de shes par bya //
analyzed: blo ldan 'bad de shes par bya //
translated: The wise should know this with effort.

original: zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor pa mkhas pa rnams kyis ni tshes rnams kyi chu tshod kyis gra gcan 'dzin gyi gnas su rgyu ba shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽tshes grangs skar ma'i nges pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor pa mkhas pa rnams kyis ni tshes rnams kyi chu tshod kyis gra gcan 'dzin gyi gnas su rgyu ba shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to // tshes grangs skar ma'i nges pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: This means that the wise yogis should know the movement in the houses of the sun and moon by the hours of the lunar days.🔽The chapter on the certainty of the lunar days and stars.

original: gzhung gang du tshes grangs dang skar ma gtan la phab pa de la tshe grangs @152a * //
analyzed: gzhung gang du tshes grangs dang skar ma gtan la phab pa de la tshe grangs @152a * //
translated: In which text the lunar days and stars are determined, that is called “the certainty of the lunar days and stars.”

original: dang skar ma nges pa'i rim par phye ba zhes bya ba ste nyi shu rtsa brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: dang skar ma nges pa'i rim par phye ba zhes bya ba ste nyi shu rtsa brgyad pa'o //
translated: The chapter is called “the certainty of the lunar days and stars,” the twenty-eighth.

original: rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po dpal rdo rje mkha' 'gro'i rnam par bshad pa las le'u nyi shu rtsa brgyad pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /🔽// / da ni ye shes kyi de kho na nyid dang / ye shes kyi mtshan ma'i le'u bstan par bzhed nas /
analyzed: rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po dpal rdo rje mkha' 'gro'i rnam par bshad pa las le'u nyi shu rtsa brgyad pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o / // / da ni ye shes kyi de kho na nyid dang / ye shes kyi mtshan ma'i le'u bstan par bzhed nas /
translated: This concludes the explanation of the twenty-eighth chapter of the Explanation of the “Shri Vajraḍāka Mahātantrarāja.”

original: nyon cig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: nyon cig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, intending to teach the chapter on the reality of wisdom and the signs of wisdom, [the Bhagavān] declares, “Listen!” and so forth.

original: sgyu ma che zhes bya ba ni thabs kyi cha'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma che zhes bya ba ni thabs kyi cha'o //
translated: “Great illusion” is the aspect of method.

original: sgyu ma kun zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi cha'o //🔽rnam par rol pa zhes bya ba ni thabs dang shes rab de dag gis sems can gyi don gyi phyir /
analyzed: sgyu ma kun zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi cha'o // rnam par rol pa zhes bya ba ni thabs dang shes rab de dag gis sems can gyi don gyi phyir /
translated: “All illusions” is the aspect of wisdom.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs su sprul pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs su sprul pa'o //
translated: “Play” is the emanation of various forms for the sake of sentient beings by means of those methods and wisdoms.

original: de dag ni lha mo la bod pa'o ;🔽/ lus can thams cad rnam shes te //
analyzed: de dag ni lha mo la bod pa'o ; / lus can thams cad rnam shes te //
translated: Those are the questions of the goddesses.

original: zhes bya ba la lus can thams cad ni gzung ba dang 'dzin par snang ba'i tshogs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la lus can thams cad ni gzung ba dang 'dzin par snang ba'i tshogs so //
translated: “All embodied beings are consciousness” — all embodied beings are the collection appearing as apprehended objects and apprehending subjects.

original: rnam shes ni rnam par rig pa tsam nyid de rang rig pa'i ye shes dang lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba dang / 'od gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: rnam shes ni rnam par rig pa tsam nyid de rang rig pa'i ye shes dang lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba dang / 'od gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: Consciousness is mere awareness, and is the same as self-knowing wisdom, the innate bliss, and the essence of clear light.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: lus las 'das shing dri ma med //🔽ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: lus las 'das shing dri ma med // ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Beyond the body, stainless.

original: dri ma med ces bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: dri ma med ces bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rnam pa ste /
translated: Stainless means free from the aspects of passion and so forth.

original: de dag kyang rang rig pa'i mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang rang rig pa'i mthar thug pa'o //
translated: And these are the ultimate of self-knowing.

original: lus dang lus can rnams 'od gsal bar 'gyur bde nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: lus dang lus can rnams 'od gsal bar 'gyur bde nyid gsungs pa /
translated: The body and embodied beings become clear light.🔽Thus it is said:

original: lhun po dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: lhun po dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Meru and so forth.

original: 'bigs byed sogs zhes bya ba la sogs kyis ni gangs can la sogs pa lcags ri'i mthar thug pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: 'bigs byed sogs zhes bya ba la sogs kyis ni gangs can la sogs pa lcags ri'i mthar thug pa gzung ngo //
translated: And so forth refers to the snowy mountains and so forth, up to the iron mountain range.

original: de dag gis ni ri rnams bstan to //🔽shar gyi lus 'phags zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de dag gis ni ri rnams bstan to // shar gyi lus 'phags zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: These are the continents.🔽The eastern Videha and so forth.

original: bcas zhes bya ba ni gling phran rnams te /
analyzed: bcas zhes bya ba ni gling phran rnams te /
translated: And so forth refers to the subcontinents.

original: 'di dag gis ni gling rnams bstan to //🔽lan tshva can zhes bya ba la sogs pa la lan tshva can ni rgya mtsho zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di dag gis ni gling rnams bstan to // lan tshva can zhes bya ba la sogs pa la lan tshva can ni rgya mtsho zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: These [verses] teach the continents.🔽In salty, etc., salty is to be connected with ocean.

original: sogs kyis ni ngan skyugs kyi rgya mtsho la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs kyis ni ngan skyugs kyi rgya mtsho la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The word etc. includes the ocean of vomit, etc.

original: 'og ces bya ba ni sa 'og go //
analyzed: 'og ces bya ba ni sa 'og go //
translated: The word below is the underworld.

original: steng zhes bya ba ni mtho ris so //
analyzed: steng zhes bya ba ni mtho ris so //
translated: The word above is heaven.

original: khams gsum ma lus zad par bya //
analyzed: khams gsum ma lus zad par bya //
translated: One should destroy the entire three realms.

original: zhes pa ni de ltar ri la sogs pa'i khams gsum por gtogs pa'i dngos po rnams shes rab kyi mtshon chas rdul phra rab tu gtubs shing bshig la zang cing mi snang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de ltar ri la sogs pa'i khams gsum por gtogs pa'i dngos po rnams shes rab kyi mtshon chas rdul phra rab tu gtubs shing bshig la zang cing mi snang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that one should destroy, pulverize, and annihilate with the weapon of wisdom all the things belonging to the three realms, such as mountains, and make them invisible.

original: de ltar phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams stong pa nyid du bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams stong pa nyid du bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught external things as emptiness,

original: rang gi lus kyang stong pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang gi lus kyang stong pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach one's own body as emptiness,

original: @152b gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: @152b gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares, form, etc.

original: sogs kyis ni tshor ba la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs kyis ni tshor ba la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The word etc. includes feeling, etc.

original: skye mched ces bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams so //
analyzed: skye mched ces bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams so //
translated: The so-called sense-fields are the objects such as form.

original: khams zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'i khams rnams te /
analyzed: khams zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'i khams rnams te /
translated: The so-called elements are the elements such as the eye.

original: nang gi skye mched nyid yin no //
analyzed: nang gi skye mched nyid yin no //
translated: They are the internal sense-fields.

original: 'byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni nye bar bsdu ba bstan pa yin te /🔽'jig rten gyi khams kun dang bcas pa yi //
analyzed: 'byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni nye bar bsdu ba bstan pa yin te / 'jig rten gyi khams kun dang bcas pa yi //
translated: The summary is taught by the words element, etc.

original: bdag nyid kyang ni zad par bsgom par bya //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang ni zad par bsgom par bya //
translated: The self should be meditated upon as being completely the same as the entire world.

original: zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: This is to be connected with the words:

original: stong pa de yang ci 'dra zhe na /
analyzed: stong pa de yang ci 'dra zhe na /
translated: The emptiness of that is also what kind?

original: dngos dang dngos med 'dres pa ste //
analyzed: dngos dang dngos med 'dres pa ste //
translated: It is the mixing of entity and non-entity.

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: dngos dang dngos po med pa gnyi gar rang bzhin med pa gang du ro gcig cing mnyam par 'dres pa de la de skad ces bya'o //🔽da ni ye shes kyi mtshan ma bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos dang dngos po med pa gnyi gar rang bzhin med pa gang du ro gcig cing mnyam par 'dres pa de la de skad ces bya'o // da ni ye shes kyi mtshan ma bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Where entity and non-entity are of a single taste, equal and mixed, that is called the mixing of entity and non-entity.

original: gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, in order to teach the sign of wisdom, he says form, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rnams stong pa nyid du mnyam par bsams la /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rnams stong pa nyid du mnyam par bsams la /
translated: Having contemplated the equality of the natures of form, etc. in emptiness,

original: der ni mtshan ma brtag par bya //
analyzed: der ni mtshan ma brtag par bya //
translated: one should investigate the sign there.

original: zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //
translated: This is connected with the verse.

original: thams cad nam mkhar thim pa yis //
analyzed: thams cad nam mkhar thim pa yis //
translated: By the dissolution of everything into space,

original: ba lang rmig par grong khyer bsgom //
analyzed: ba lang rmig par grong khyer bsgom //
translated: one should meditate on the city as the footprint of an ox.

original: zhes bya ba la grong khyer te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la grong khyer te /
translated: Here, the city is the collection of sense-spheres, etc.

original: skye mched la sogs pa'i tshogs rnams ba lang rmig pa ste stong pa nyid du bsdu bas bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: skye mched la sogs pa'i tshogs rnams ba lang rmig pa ste stong pa nyid du bsdu bas bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on it as the footprint of an ox, i.e., as emptiness, by subsuming it in emptiness.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How?

original: thams cad nam mkhar thim pa ste bshad zin to //
analyzed: thams cad nam mkhar thim pa ste bshad zin to //
translated: By the dissolution of everything into space, as has been explained.

original: sems ni mar me lta bur bsgom //
analyzed: sems ni mar me lta bur bsgom //
translated: One should meditate on the mind as a lamp.

original: zhes bya ba la sems ni ste rnam par rig pa tsam nyid mar me lta bu ste 'od gsal bar bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sems ni ste rnam par rig pa tsam nyid mar me lta bu ste 'od gsal bar bsgom pa'o //
translated: The mind is mere representation, like a lamp, i.e., as clear light.

original: de dbus yid kyis bltas nas su //
analyzed: de dbus yid kyis bltas nas su //
translated: Having looked with the mind at its center,

original: zhes bya ba la de zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba thams cad do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la de zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba thams cad do //
translated: one should look at the center of that, i.e., of all worlds.

original: dbus zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: dbus zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid do //
translated: The center is emptiness.

original: blta zhes bya ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: blta zhes bya ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: To look is to perceive.

original: der ni mtshan ma brtag par bya //
analyzed: der ni mtshan ma brtag par bya //
translated: There, the signs should be examined.

original: zhes bya ba la der ni zhes bya ba ni 'od gsal ba der ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la der ni zhes bya ba ni 'od gsal ba der ro //
translated: There means in the clear light.

original: mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni bya ba'i ltas so //
analyzed: mtshan ma zhes bya ba ni bya ba'i ltas so //
translated: Signs means the signs of activity.

original: de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: He states just that:

original: mar me lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: mar me lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Like a lamp, etc.

original: gang gi tshe stong pa nyid du thams cad thim zhing 'od gsal bas mi g-yo bar gnas pa de'i tshe ting nge 'dzin gyi mthar 'od zer mar me lta bu snang bar gyur na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe stong pa nyid du thams cad thim zhing 'od gsal bas mi g-yo bar gnas pa de'i tshe ting nge 'dzin gyi mthar 'od zer mar me lta bu snang bar gyur na /
translated: When everything dissolves into emptiness and abides unmoving in the clear light, then at the end of meditative concentration, if a lamp-like light appears,

original: de'i tshe zhi ba'i las 'grub par gyur pa de'i mtshan ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe zhi ba'i las 'grub par gyur pa de'i mtshan ma yin no //
translated: at that time it is the sign of the accomplishment of pacifying activity.

original: chags pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni chags pa ni dbang du bya ba'o //
analyzed: chags pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni chags pa ni dbang du bya ba'o //
translated: Attachment, etc. means that attachment is subjugation.

original: sogs kyis na dgug pa dang gzung bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sogs kyis na dgug pa dang gzung bar bya ba yin no //
translated: Etc. means that it is to be summoned and held.

original: 'od zer zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /🔽'od @153a * //
analyzed: 'od zer zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / 'od @153a * //
translated: Light rays, etc.🔽Light rays

original: zer dkar po long long pos //
analyzed: zer dkar po long long pos //
translated: that are white and flickering

original: bkra shis kyis ni lam ston yin //🔽zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: bkra shis kyis ni lam ston yin //🔽zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: are the path shown by good fortune.

original: bkra shis kyi lam zhes bya ba ni 'das pa la sogs pa'i dus kyi cha'o //
analyzed: bkra shis kyi lam zhes bya ba ni 'das pa la sogs pa'i dus kyi cha'o //
translated: The so-called path of good fortune is the time period of the past, etc.

original: de bzhin du sngags kyi dngos grub 'grub ces bya ba la yang 'od zer dkar po long long po snang ba dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sngags kyi dngos grub 'grub ces bya ba la yang 'od zer dkar po long long po snang ba dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Similarly, with regard to the statement “one attains the powers of mantra,” one should apply the radiance of white light.

original: cho ga zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni stong pa nyid kyi rnal 'byor sngon du 'gro bas lha'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom par bya zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: cho ga zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni stong pa nyid kyi rnal 'byor sngon du 'gro bas lha'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom par bya zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: By the words “ritual,” etc., he teaches that one should cultivate the meditative concentration of the deity preceded by the yoga of emptiness.

original: cho ga 'dis ni zhes bya ba la 'dis ni stong pa nyid du bsgom pa'i cho ga 'dis so //
analyzed: cho ga 'dis ni zhes bya ba la 'dis ni stong pa nyid du bsgom pa'i cho ga 'dis so //
translated: “By this ritual” means by this ritual of meditation on emptiness.

original: ci zhig stong par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig stong par bya zhe na /
translated: What is to be emptied?

original: gzhan gsal dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gzhan zhes bya ba ni ri bo lhun po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gsal dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gzhan zhes bya ba ni ri bo lhun po la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Other, clear,” etc. “Other” refers to Mount Meru, etc.

original: gsal zhes bya ba ni mtho ris kyi 'jig rten no //
analyzed: gsal zhes bya ba ni mtho ris kyi 'jig rten no //
translated: “Clear” refers to the heavenly world.

original: gzhan gyi gzugs zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi khams la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi gzugs zhes bya ba ni gzugs kyi khams la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Other forms” refers to the form realm, etc.

original: dbu ma rnams zhes bya ba ni bar la gnas pa rnams so //
analyzed: dbu ma rnams zhes bya ba ni bar la gnas pa rnams so //
translated: “The centers” refers to those located in the middle.

original: de 'og rnal 'byor bskyed par bya //
analyzed: de 'og rnal 'byor bskyed par bya //
translated: Then one should generate the yoga.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is what is said.

original: de ltar 'gro ba thams cad stong pa nyid du bsgoms kyi 'og tu lha'i ting nge 'dzin bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'gro ba thams cad stong pa nyid du bsgoms kyi 'og tu lha'i ting nge 'dzin bskyed par bya'o //
translated: Thus, after meditating on all beings as emptiness, one should generate the samadhi of the deity.

original: de ltar stong pa nyid bsgoms pa la yon tan ci yod ce na /
analyzed: de ltar stong pa nyid bsgoms pa la yon tan ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the benefit of meditating on emptiness in this way?

original: ye shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: ye shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: It is said, “wisdom and so forth,” and so on.

original: ye shes la sogs sems kyis ni //
analyzed: ye shes la sogs sems kyis ni //
translated: The mind of wisdom and so forth

original: sems ni myur du thar par 'gyur //
analyzed: sems ni myur du thar par 'gyur //
translated: the mind is quickly liberated.

original: zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: This is what is said.

original: de la ye shes la sogs sems zhes bya ba ni lha'i rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: de la ye shes la sogs sems zhes bya ba ni lha'i rnal 'byor ro //
translated: Therein, the mind of wisdom and so forth is the yoga of the deity.

original: gang zhig ces bya ba ni sgrub pa po gang zhig gis so //🔽thar par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni tha mal pa'i 'ching ba las grol ba ste /
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba ni sgrub pa po gang zhig gis so // thar par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni tha mal pa'i 'ching ba las grol ba ste /
translated: “ Whoever” refers to the practitioner.🔽“ Liberated” means freed from the bonds of the ordinary.

original: mtho ris dang thar pa'i dngos grub bo //
analyzed: mtho ris dang thar pa'i dngos grub bo //
translated: It is the attainment of the higher realms and liberation.

original: de dag gis ni 'di skad du rnal 'byor pa gang zhig gis stong pa nyid mngon sum du byas na lha'i ting nge 'dzin gyis myur du mtho ris dang thar pa'i dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: de dag gis ni 'di skad du rnal 'byor pa gang zhig gis stong pa nyid mngon sum du byas na lha'i ting nge 'dzin gyis myur du mtho ris dang thar pa'i dngos grub thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: They teach that whoever the yogi is who actualizes emptiness, he will quickly attain the power of heaven and liberation by the samadhi of the deity.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: ye shes kyis ni shes bya brtag / shes byas 'gro ba brtag par bya //
analyzed: ye shes kyis ni shes bya brtag / shes byas 'gro ba brtag par bya //
translated: By wisdom, the knowable is imagined; by the knowable, the world is imagined.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: ye shes ni stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: ye shes ni stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: wisdom is the samadhi of emptiness.

original: shes bya ni lha'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: shes bya ni lha'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The knowable is the samadhi of the deity.

original: brtag pa ni mnyam par sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: brtag pa ni mnyam par sbyar ba'o //
translated: Imagined is the union.

original: 'gro ba ni dngos grub kyi go 'phang ngo //
analyzed: 'gro ba ni dngos grub kyi go 'phang ngo //
translated: The world is the state of power.

original: brtag pa ni bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: brtag pa ni bskyed pa'o //
translated: Imagined is the generation.

original: sngar bstan pa'i bsdus pa'i don nye bar bsdu ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i bsdus pa'i don nye bar bsdu ba gsungs pa /
translated: The summary of the previously taught condensed meaning is stated:

original: pha dang ma ni gsad bya zhing //
analyzed: pha dang ma ni gsad bya zhing //
translated: One should kill one’s father and mother,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and so on.

original: pha zhes bya ba la @153b sogs pa ni nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: pha zhes bya ba la @153b sogs pa ni nga rgyal lo //
translated: Here, “father” and so on refers to pride.

original: ma ni sred pa'o //
analyzed: ma ni sred pa'o //
translated: “Mother” is craving.

original: bram ze gtsang ma gnyis ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang ngo //
analyzed: bram ze gtsang ma gnyis ni 'dod chags dang zhe sdang ngo //
translated: The two pure Brahmins are passion and aversion.

original: rgyal po ni ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal po ni ma rig pa'o //
translated: The king is ignorance.

original: yul 'khor ni lus so //
analyzed: yul 'khor ni lus so //
translated: The realm is the body.

original: bcas pa ni dbang po rnams te /
analyzed: bcas pa ni dbang po rnams te /
translated: The retinue is the faculties,

original: de dang lhan cig tu 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig tu 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they function together with it.

original: bcom pa ni rnam par rtog pa rnams bshigs te snang ba med par byas pa'o ;
analyzed: bcom pa ni rnam par rtog pa rnams bshigs te snang ba med par byas pa'o ;
translated: The destruction is the destruction of the conceptualizations, the non-appearance of the signs.

original: / ye shes zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma'i ye shes so //
analyzed: / ye shes zhes bya ba ni mtshan ma'i ye shes so //
translated: The knowledge is the knowledge of the signs.

original: rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni thabs kyi cha'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni thabs kyi cha'o //
translated: The nature is the part of the method.

original: su zhig ce na /
analyzed: su zhig ce na /
translated: Who?

original: kun dang sbyor ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: kun dang sbyor ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The one who is connected with all.

original: mkha' 'gor ma kun dang sbyor ba'i rdo rje mkha' 'gro'o //
analyzed: mkha' 'gor ma kun dang sbyor ba'i rdo rje mkha' 'gro'o //
translated: The Vajra dakini is connected with all the sky-farers.

original: ye shes 'byung ba zhes bya ba la ye shes ni mtshan ma'i ye shes so //
analyzed: ye shes 'byung ba zhes bya ba la ye shes ni mtshan ma'i ye shes so //
translated: The origin of knowledge is the teaching of the knowledge of the signs.🔽The knowledge is the knowledge of the signs.

original: 'byung ba ni bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba ni bstan pa'o //
translated: The origin is the teaching.

original: rim par phye ba ni gzhung gi tshogs so //
analyzed: rim par phye ba ni gzhung gi tshogs so //
translated: The chapter is the collection of the text.

original: nyi shu rtsa dgu ba'o //
analyzed: nyi shu rtsa dgu ba'o //
translated: The twenty-ninth.

original: rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po dpal rdo rje mkha' 'gro'i rnam par bshad pa las le'u nyi shu rtsa dgu pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
analyzed: rgyud kyi rgyal po chen po dpal rdo rje mkha' 'gro'i rnam par bshad pa las le'u nyi shu rtsa dgu pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
translated: This concludes the explanation of the twenty-ninth chapter of the Explication of the “Dhāraṇī of the Great Noble Lotus King,”

original: // / da ni 'chi ba'i dus kyi blo'i khyad par bzhin du skye ba len par bstan pa'i phyir ye shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: // / da ni 'chi ba'i dus kyi blo'i khyad par bzhin du skye ba len par bstan pa'i phyir ye shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, in order to teach the taking of birth in accordance with the particular mind at the time of death, the Bhagavān declares the wisdom, etc.,

original: ye shes zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Wisdom is consciousness.

original: khyad par ni blo'i khyad par gang dang gang gis 'gro ba khyad par can thob par byed pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: khyad par ni blo'i khyad par gang dang gang gis 'gro ba khyad par can thob par byed pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: Particular is the particular of the mind, by which particular one obtains a particular rebirth.

original: de yang ci 'dra zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ci 'dra zhe na /
translated: And what is that like?

original: ye shes thun mong byin brlabs pa //🔽zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ye shes thun mong byin brlabs pa // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The consecration of the common wisdom.

original: thun mong ni lhan cig skyes pa'o ;
analyzed: thun mong ni lhan cig skyes pa'o ;
translated: Common is innate.

original: / byin brlabs pa ni thog ma med pa'i dus nas khyad par thams cad kyi rjes su 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: / byin brlabs pa ni thog ma med pa'i dus nas khyad par thams cad kyi rjes su 'jug pa'o //
translated: Consecration is the engagement in all the particularities since beginningless time.

original: kha cig na re lha dang lha ma yin la sogs pa'i tha mal pa'i rnam par shes pa ni thun mong ma yin la /
analyzed: kha cig na re lha dang lha ma yin la sogs pa'i tha mal pa'i rnam par shes pa ni thun mong ma yin la /
translated: Some say: The ordinary consciousness of gods, demigods, etc. is not common.

original: byin gyis brlabs pa ni rang grub pa'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs pa ni rang grub pa'o zhes zer ro //
translated: The empowered is self-established.

original: bye brag gzhan ni ji lta bu zhes bya ba ni bye brag ma rtogs par rnam par shes pa bstan par mi nus pas bye brag gi khyad par nyid gsol ba btab pa yin nom //
analyzed: bye brag gzhan ni ji lta bu zhes bya ba ni bye brag ma rtogs par rnam par shes pa bstan par mi nus pas bye brag gi khyad par nyid gsol ba btab pa yin nom //
translated: What is the other distinction? Since consciousness cannot be taught without understanding the distinctions, he asks for the distinction itself.

original: sngar bstan pa bzhin du yang ci'i phyir gsol bar byed ce na /
analyzed: sngar bstan pa bzhin du yang ci'i phyir gsol bar byed ce na /
translated: Why does he ask again, as it was already taught?

original: 'di la sngar ni thos pa tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: 'di la sngar ni thos pa tsam du zad kyi /
translated: Here, it was previously just heard,

original: khyad par nges par ma gzung ngo zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: khyad par nges par ma gzung ngo zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: but the distinction was not definitely grasped, he thinks.

original: ye shes kyi de kho na nyid kyi bye brag gsungs pa /
analyzed: ye shes kyi de kho na nyid kyi bye brag gsungs pa /
translated: The distinction of the reality of wisdom is stated:

original: lci bar gyur pa sum cu yis //
analyzed: lci bar gyur pa sum cu yis //
translated: By the thirty heavy ones,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: and so on.

original: lci bar gyur pa ni dus kyi khyad par gyi ming ngo //
analyzed: lci bar gyur pa ni dus kyi khyad par gyi ming ngo //
translated: Heavy is a name for a particular time.

original: ji snyed cig ce na /
analyzed: ji snyed cig ce na /
translated: How many?

original: sum cu yis te dbugs rgyu ba'i grangs sum cu rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: sum cu yis te dbugs rgyu ba'i grangs sum cu rgyu ba'o //
translated: thirty times, that is, thirty times the breath moves.

original: dge dang sdig pa'i 'bras 'byung ba //
analyzed: dge dang sdig pa'i 'bras 'byung ba //
translated: The result of good and bad actions

original: zhes @154a * //
analyzed: zhes @154a * //
translated: arises.

original: bya ba ni mtho ris dang ngan 'gro'i lus so //
analyzed: bya ba ni mtho ris dang ngan 'gro'i lus so //
translated: The body in the happy realms and the body in the miserable realms.

original: gang gis she na /
analyzed: gang gis she na /
translated: By what?

original: nga rgyal gyis ni byin brlabs pa'i //🔽sems kyis byas pa'i las tshogs kyis //
analyzed: nga rgyal gyis ni byin brlabs pa'i // sems kyis byas pa'i las tshogs kyis //
translated: By the mind that is consecrated by pride.

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The collection of actions is done by the mind.

original: dge ba dang sdig pa'i bdag nyid kyi las kyi tshogs sems kyis byas pa ni dmigs pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: dge ba dang sdig pa'i bdag nyid kyi las kyi tshogs sems kyis byas pa ni dmigs pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: The collection of actions of the nature of good and bad is done by the mind. The special object is

original: de ci 'dra zhe na /
analyzed: de ci 'dra zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: nga rgyal gyis ni byin brlabs pa //🔽zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: nga rgyal gyis ni byin brlabs pa // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It is consecrated by pride.

original: blo'i bdag nyid kyis zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: blo'i bdag nyid kyis zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: It is the nature of the mind.

original: de dag gis ni 'di skad du gang gi tshe 'chi ba'i dus la bab pa na /
analyzed: de dag gis ni 'di skad du gang gi tshe 'chi ba'i dus la bab pa na /
translated: They say this: When the time of death arrives,

original: lci ba'i dus su dbugs rgyu ba sum cu snyed tsam du 'og nas 'byung ba'i blor khyad par rtse gcig tu dmigs par 'gyur na /
analyzed: lci ba'i dus su dbugs rgyu ba sum cu snyed tsam du 'og nas 'byung ba'i blor khyad par rtse gcig tu dmigs par 'gyur na /
translated: if the breath moves thirty times at the time of the heavy exhalation, and the mind focuses one-pointedly on the special object as it will be explained below,

original: blo'i khyad par bzhin du lha la sogs pa'i 'gro ba de dang der skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: blo'i khyad par bzhin du lha la sogs pa'i 'gro ba de dang der skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: It shows that one is born in that and that god realm, etc., according to the difference in mind.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /🔽bsgoms par gyur pa'i rang rig pa'i //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa / bsgoms par gyur pa'i rang rig pa'i //
translated: Therefore, it is said:🔽The mind that is cultivated by self-awareness

original: sems ni 'gro ba de ru 'gro //
analyzed: sems ni 'gro ba de ru 'gro //
translated: goes to that realm.

original: zhes bya ba la bsgoms par gyur pa zhes pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la bsgoms par gyur pa zhes pa ni /
translated: Here, “cultivated” means

original: nyon mongs pa'i rkyen can gyi dmigs pa'i khyad par gyi las kyis bsgos pa'o ;
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rkyen can gyi dmigs pa'i khyad par gyi las kyis bsgos pa'o ;
translated: conditioned by the afflictions, it is dyed by the karma of the special object.

original: / rang rig ces bya ba ni rang gi bsam pas 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: / rang rig ces bya ba ni rang gi bsam pas 'gro ba'o //
translated: “Self-awareness” means going by one’s own intention.

original: 'gro ba de ru zhes bya ba ni lha la sogs pa'i 'gro ba khyad par can du'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba de ru zhes bya ba ni lha la sogs pa'i 'gro ba khyad par can du'o //
translated: “To that realm” means to the special realm of gods, etc.

original: gal te rang rig pa'i rang dags 'gro ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te rang rig pa'i rang dags 'gro ba yin na /
translated: If it is the case that one goes to a realm by self-awareness,

original: ngan 'gro'i 'gro ba med pa la sogs pa shin tu thal ches par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: ngan 'gro'i 'gro ba med pa la sogs pa shin tu thal ches par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then it would be a very extreme consequence that there would be no bad migrations, etc.🔽The Bhagavān said:

original: srid pa'i zhags pas rtag 'jig pas //
analyzed: srid pa'i zhags pas rtag 'jig pas //
translated: Because of the noose of existence, one is always destroyed

original: de yi 'gro ba mi mthong ngo //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de yi 'gro ba mi mthong ngo //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: and does not see that realm.

original: srid pa'i zhags pa zhes bya ba ni lcags sgrog lta bu'i rnam pa lci ba'i dus kyi 'og tu nam mkha' las 'phyad bar snang bar 'gyur ro zhes man ngag las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: srid pa'i zhags pa zhes bya ba ni lcags sgrog lta bu'i rnam pa lci ba'i dus kyi 'og tu nam mkha' las 'phyad bar snang bar 'gyur ro zhes man ngag las shes par bya'o //
translated: The “noose of existence” is a heavy iron chain that appears in the sky above the person at the time of death.

original: rtag 'jig pa zhes bya ba ni des blo dman pa rnams kyi rnam shes dkrugs shing brgyal bar gyur pas so //🔽de yi 'gro ba mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: rtag 'jig pa zhes bya ba ni des blo dman pa rnams kyi rnam shes dkrugs shing brgyal bar gyur pas so // de yi 'gro ba mi mthong ngo //
translated: “Constant destruction” means that the mind of those of lesser intelligence is disturbed and rendered unconscious by that noose.

original: zhes bya ba ni bde 'gro la sogs pa'i dmigs pa mi dran cing mtshams sbyor bar mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bde 'gro la sogs pa'i dmigs pa mi dran cing mtshams sbyor bar mi nus pa'o //
translated: “One does not see the destination” means that one is unable to remember the object of a happy rebirth, etc., and to connect with it.

original: yang na man ngag dang bral ba ni mi mthong ba'o //
analyzed: yang na man ngag dang bral ba ni mi mthong ba'o //
translated: Or, “without instruction” means that one does not see.

original: de dag gi don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de dag gi don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: nye ba'i skye ba'i las kyi bag chags kyis mtshams sbyor ba ni 'chi ka ma'i sems kyi khyad par yin la /
analyzed: nye ba'i skye ba'i las kyi bag chags kyis mtshams sbyor ba ni 'chi ka ma'i sems kyi khyad par yin la /
translated: The connection by the latent propensities of karma for a new birth is a special state of mind at the time of death.

original: de yang srid ba'i zhags pa mthong bas sems dkrugs shing myos na /
analyzed: de yang srid ba'i zhags pa mthong bas sems dkrugs shing myos na /
translated: If that mind is disturbed and rendered unconscious by seeing the noose of existence,

original: rang dga' ba de blo dman pa kha cig la ji ltar skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: rang dga' ba de blo dman pa kha cig la ji ltar skye bar 'gyur /
translated: how can one of lesser intelligence, who is not in control of himself, be born in the way he wants?

original: rang bzhin gyis blo brtan pa kha cig la skye ru rung yang bla ma'i gdams ngag dang bral ba yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis blo brtan pa kha cig la skye ru rung yang bla ma'i gdams ngag dang bral ba yin no //
translated: Some, who are naturally firm-minded, are fit to be born there, but are devoid of the guru's instruction.

original: 'du shes rnam pa lnga zhes @154b bya ba ni lha'i lus la sogs par dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'du shes rnam pa lnga zhes @154b bya ba ni lha'i lus la sogs par dmigs pa'o //
translated: The five kinds of perception are the perception of the body of a god, etc.

original: lta ba lnga yis pha rol 'gro //
analyzed: lta ba lnga yis pha rol 'gro //
translated: One goes beyond by the five views.

original: zhes bya ba la lta ba ni bsod nams la sogs pa'i blo'i khyad par te nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la lta ba ni bsod nams la sogs pa'i blo'i khyad par te nga rgyal lo //
translated: View is a special kind of mind, pride, of merit, etc.

original: de nyid gsungs pa /🔽lha'i ye shes gsang bar ston //
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa / lha'i ye shes gsang bar ston //
translated: That is stated:

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The knowledge of the gods is taught in secret.

original: gsang ba ni bsod nams kyi blo'o //
analyzed: gsang ba ni bsod nams kyi blo'o //
translated: Secret is the mind of merit.

original: ston pa ni lta ba'o //
analyzed: ston pa ni lta ba'o //
translated: Teaching is view.

original: lha ni des lhar skye ba ste /
analyzed: lha ni des lhar skye ba ste /
translated: God is one who is born as a god by that,

original: gang gi 'chi ka'i sems bsod nams kyi rang bzhin gyi blo'i nga rgyal gyis gnas pa de ltar skye bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
